description:
MAKE A RESERVATION! Got there in time before all the reservations and walk-ins came in so we had first-come-first-served seating at the bar (for 2). 

For first-timers, we got the Outlaw and it was perfect for two people. Everything tasted perfect and was paired nicely with the bottomless sides. They took a while to prep and serve (but that was probably cause every party placed their order at the same time) but the service and everything else afterwards was great. 

We weren't stuffed (which was great) cause then we had energy to go to other places after! Fondue Cowboy is a great place to start off your night and is an experience, especially if you haven't had fondue before!
author: Erika D.

description:
I've been to Fondue Cowboy a couple of times, and it's always been good.  It's a cute little a restaurant great for date nights and family dinners.

I've tried a few of the cheese fondues and a couple of the sweet ones. In particular, the Traditional (Swiss Gruyere, Emmenthaler, White Wine, Roasted Garlic, Fresh Ground Nutmeg), the Outlaw (Aged Cheddar, Beer, Slow Roasted Tomatoes, Roasted Garlic, Roasted Jalapeno, Cilantro), and the Quick Draw (Manchego, White Wine, Roasted Red Pepper, Roasted Garlic). These were all great and came with plenty of dip-ins (bread, potatoes, olives, broccoli, apples, and grapes). You can also order meat dip-ins separately which are quite tasty. Each of the fondues, with the non-meat dip-ins included, run about $28 for 2 people. You can also request more of certain dip-ins if you have leftover cheese fondue. 

While I enjoy the cheese fondue somewhat, the chocolate fondue takes this restaurant to another level. I've had both the Happy Trails (Dark Chocolate with Cayenne) and Buck-A-Roo (Milk Chocolate with Walnuts) and they are both fantastic. These cost $25 for 2 people and come with lots of fruit (pineapple, kiwi, strawberries, banana) and other dip-ins (lady fingers, marshmallows, chocolate bread). These fondues definitely make the trip worth it. 

Whenever I've been the employees have always been extremely courteous, fun, and thoughtful. It is an awesome experience every time. 

I would recommend making a reservation, especially if you have more than a couple of people in your party (or if you don't want to sit at the bar).
author: Kristin A.

description:
My husband and best friend (who are both Aussies) had never been to fondue before So I was excited to find this place on Yelp. Located on the less popular side of SOMA, I would imagine people who live and work around here would visit often.

It's a cute little place on the corner and has cowboy decor all throughout the restaurant. My favorite details were the bandanas they use as napkins. As I waited for my friends, the waiter came over and got me a glass of (Australian) wine, which was cheaper because it was happy hour. They don't have a full liquor license, but offer wine and beer and wine cocktails.

We ordered two pots of fondue and a side of meat and meatballs. We also ordered more drinks after the waiter prompted us that happy hour would be ending soon and we should take advantage.

The pots of fondue were good, but I didn't think there was anything special about them. One was cheddar and one was goat cheese, but the dipping options weren't amazing. The meatballs were good but the standard items you get included a handful of vegetables, apples, pickles, and lots of bread.

The dessert fondue on the other hand was great! We had the dark chocolate option and the cakes were given to eat with it were wonderful.

I'm not sure if I would come back here because I don't like fondue enough generally, but worth a visit if you like fondue.
author: Jade R.

description: I came here with my bf one night for dinner without a reservation. It was risky, but we decided to give it a shot anyway since we were in the neighbourhood. There was a wait as expected, but since there were only two of us the wait wasn't too long and we were able to sit at the bar. There were so many fondue choices that it was difficult to decide! In the end, we ordered the Rawhide (Italian Dolce Gorgonzola, Emmenthaler, White Wine, Bacon, Roasted Garlic). We were tempted to order a meat platter as well (since the provided sides didn't include meat), but instead opted for dessert. Best. Choice. Ever. We ordered the High Noon (White Chocolate with Balsamic Strawberry Puree) based on a recommendation from the server. Usually I wouldn't choose white chocolate, but the taste of it changed somehow based on the way it was melting in the pot. Plus, the dessert sides were superb. I definitely want to come back soon and try something new :)
author: Bianca C.

description:
tl;dr probably the only place with decent free parking in SF, great fondue, even better meat, and excellent desserts and cocktails! Suuuper expensive though.

We came here tonight (Friday) and for whatever reason they weren't very busy--which surprised me because it seems like the perfect place to have some drinks and snacks with a coworker, friends, or a date.

They have a few different cheeses to pick from. We chose the Lonestar, which has gouda, emmenthaler, thyme, garlic, onion, and white wine. For sides, we got the chicken skewers and spicy hot links, both of which were delicious! I also loved the little potatoes that they give you with the sides (you get potatoes, bread, grapes, apple, olives, and mini pickles). For dessert, I definitely recommend the High Noon with the strawberry purée!! It went perfectly with their chocolate bread.

I also thought Fondue Cowboy had good cocktails. My first was the strawberry mojito which was pretty much as you'd expect. The cowboy punch was my favorite: a light, refreshing but delightfully cinnamon-y sangria. 

So, yeah, I'll definitely make my way back here when I need my liquid cheese + chocolate fix, but maybe on special occasions only because it's definitely on the expensive side ($28 per fondue, not including sides).
author: Claire C.

description:
Give me some boots, a hat, a horse, and a saddle -- and I'm riding.  However, despite this, I'm not a fan of the cowboy who serves Fondue.

The menu is small: 6 types of cheese-based fondues, 3 sides, 3 salads, and 3 sweet fondues.  Happy hour has $4 drafts, here's hawwww!

I ordered:
========
1.  The Traditional Fondue [$28, 3.5 stars] -- good, but not great.  Served with a great amount of bread, crostini, roasted potatoes, black olives, pickles, raw broccoli, apples, and grapes.  I liked the wide selection and varieties of stuff, but in the end, it was novelty and not delicious.

2.  Side of Homemade Meatballs & Spicy Louisiana Hot Links sausage [$12, 2.0 stars] -- homemade my butt, it had the taste of frozen balls from Costco all over it.  The waiter was nice enough to split the order so I could try both.  Normally, they are $12 each.

Conclusion:
==========
It's a cute place, and seats about 30.  Cool bar -- that's about where it ends for me.  Fondue, traditionally, is a great and fun thing to share on a date, or better, for a group.  Fondue Cowboy holds up this tradition, I just don't like the food offerings much.
author: Randy B.

description:
Great little fondue spot in the tenderloin / western SOMA. Nice corner location and - at least when we went there - easy parking.

Tried a bunch of the fondues including:

Traditional - really good perfect for dipping
Outlaw / cheddar - seems like more of a cheese sauce and probably wouldn't order again
- Desperado / goat cheese - super good and light
Stagecoach - A lot of wine flavor but also very good

Also had the charcuterie plate and the meatballs which were essential. Meatballs were amazing for dipping and we wound up ordering a second order. All this for eight people and we were pretty well satisfied.

The pots initially look really small, but there's quite a lot of cheese in there and definitely seems like two people could be fed with one pot, especially if you ask for some extra bread. Homemade iced tea was also pretty amazing.

Also tried the milk chocolate and white chocolate dessert fondues. Decadent and awesome. Wish this place was a little closer to the house, but will definitely be back.
author: Bob K.

description:
This is a cool place for an intimate date night if you're looking for a new experience! 

We ordered the Outlaw and were able to get it with no cilantro (the servers were very courteous with this request!). When we got the food, I found that I was not the biggest fan of the flavor. It was my first time eating fondue, so maybe I simply was not used to it! There was a very strong flavor of beer in the fondue (it says beer in the ingredient list, but it was much more than I expected), which made the fondue bitter at times. If you're not a beer lover and this is your first time trying fondue, hopefully this can be a helpful warning for what to expect if you order the Outlaw! 

On the plus side, the chocolate fondue was absolutely amazing! Please order this if you love chocolate like me!! 

Overall - great ambience, new adventures, feeling like a kid when you eat, and lovely servers! I'd definitely recommend giving it a try if you've never had fondue before!
author: Susan S.

description: We enjoyed our meal and left full.  We always have dinner before a show in SF and this time we chose Fondue Cowboy.  I've been to fondue places before and this is definitely a bit different but fantastic.  We had the Outlaw with cured meats and meatballs.  Wish I had room for dessert, it looked amazing  Also their Sangria is unique and AMAZING.  We will definitely return
author: Lynne S.

description: Everything is absolutely amazing. It was so cozy, the seat was fabulous, music was elegant and waiters were very kind. I ate traditional fondue with herb chickens, some breads, veggies and fruits.
author: Yeonjin L.

description:
I'm a fondue fiend so was excited to try a new place.

Fondue Cowboy has a cute, intimate interior with a small number of tables and dimmed lighting. It was a very warm atmosphere perfect for dates.

The food was good, but very tiny portions. I wish the fondue pot was bigger. The sides were varied and generously portioned as a free addition.

I probably wouldn't go back, but I'm not upset I went.
author: Isabel B.

description:
Mmmm fondue! 

I always order the "outlaw" and they never do me wrong. The sides compliment the cheese very well! 

I sometimes wish they gave you a little more cheese if you're a heavy dipper like me.

We usually end the night with a sweet fondue and go home completely happy. 

I should also mention the service is delightful. Thanks folks!
author: Raul S.

description:
What a fun(due) spot! We made a reservation for a Thursday but definitely didn't need it. It's pretty small but not too crowded or loud. They had a comfortable set up.

Fondue never seems like it'll be a lot of food and then you're stuffy silly (with no regrets). The small salad was plenty to share as an appetizer.

The meatballs were a good choice and I don't usually like meatballs that much but these were so juicy and extra delicious dunked in cheese.

They bring out more dippers if you need, so I asked for more potatoes and that's where I went overboard.

The chocolate dessert was good but honestly I was so full at that point I couldn't really enjoy it. My boyfriend never had fondue before and he said "tastes like melted chocolate" lol I mean yea, that's what it is.
author: Kelly G.

description:
I haven't had fondue in forever. This place was surprisingly good. Menu items are enough for 2 people. Perfect place for date night.

I would make reservations before going. The place is very small & requires reservations to be seated. 

The sweets fondue was so good! I finished the whole chocolate. Get the white chocolate with balsamic strawberry!
author: Monica N.

description: This place surpassed my expectations. Great savory and sweet fondue selections. The place has an interesting vibe to it as it's completely western interior serving fondues. If you are planning to get full definitely order a side of meat or a salad. One fondue is good for two people, prices and service are great.
author: Yéva M.

description:
Delightful. Came here with some girlfriends for dinner and catching up. We ordered the Outlaw, Stagecoach, and meatballs. Perfect amount of food for 4 people.  I was indifferent about some of the dipping things... like I wouldn't dip an olive or cornichon into hot cheese but I still enjoyed them cheese-less.  Our server was really cool too. She was overly attentive at first but quickly got the picture that we were super low maintenance and didn't want to be disturbed and she backed off unless she noticed our glasses we're empty. I appreciate that. 

Kudos! It's nice having a fondue place in the city.
author: Jessica F.

description:
Found Fondue Cowboy through Yelp for my partner and I's 3 year anniversary! We were extremely pleased and glad to try this restaurant out!

We did not know exactly what to try because it all looked and sounded so delicious! We ultimately chose the Outlaw as our waiter explained it is a fan favorite! Note: this fondue is a bit spicy. It came with delicious potatoes, broccoli, vegetables and breads. There was not anything wrong with the food selections that it came with. If you are a bit more hungry, they also offer meat portions for an extra cost. Since we were getting a dessert fondue after, we decided not to get the meat portion with our fondue. We definitely will try the meat though next time we come! 

The dessert though was amazing! The food items it came with (fruit, Madeline's, chocolate bread, and marshmallows) were perfect and made it a delicious dessert.

Our waiter, forgot to ask his name, was EXTREMELY hospitable, kind, and caring throughout our stay. Knowing this is owned by him and his partner also was an interesting fact about Fondue Cowboy and how it was started out! 

It is a small restaurant so I would recommend making reservations ahead of time. When we got there it was not packed at all..15 minutes later it was a full house! 

Thank you so much for making our 3 year anniversary extra special!!! We will definitely be coming back!
author: Michael T.

description:
Melty, gooey, cheesey fondue paired with crisp veggies, fruits, and bread and an excellent selection of wine. What more could one want. 

OVERALL
Great, cozy place for a date or a nice evening with friends. Highly recommend you get reservations, as the place is quite small and fills up fast. Bar seating available for walk-ins. 

FOOD
We ordered the Outlaw (which was cheddar cheese I believe) and omg it was so flavorful and delicious! Even though the portion looks small, it definitely fills you up, and there's plenty to share. Bread and veggies sides are refillable for free btw! 
For dessert, we ordered the dark chocolate fondue, which was oh-so smooth and rich. Sides were madeleines(!!!!), chocolate bread, marshmellows, & assorted fruits. 
Even though we only ordered those two fondues & no meat sides, we were stuffed at the end! Definitely don't let the portion size fool you, it's very filling. 

SERVICE
Our waitress was amazing! Sad that we didn't get to catch her name. It wasn't too crowded when we arrived (had a reservation for 5:45pm on a Friday), so our waitress was very attentive and patient. 

PLACE
Small but cozy place, about 10-12 tables and 12-14 bar seats. All of the tables were reserved the Friday night we went (thank god we made a reservation), so other people who walked-in had to sit at the bar. Low lighting and great western-themed decorations all around.
author: Danny C.

description:
We suddenly craved fondue (+ one of my friends never had it), we just yelped around and found this place! Surprisingly small, but very comfy with great services! It was unusual but cool to have a western theme because I never associated fondue with cowboy lol
I love how there are different choices for cheese, because I actually don't like gruyere. 
For 3 people, we ordered Outlaw, and a sweet chocolate fondue Happy Trails for dessert. We also got homemade meat balls. 
The portion is perfect for 3 (women), even though the cheese pot seemed small at first. All the sides are refillable, and our server actively asked us if we want refill, which was nice :D! 
The surprise is the meat balls! THEY WERE SUPER DELICIOUS! Super hot (as in temp) and fresh, love it so much.

Fondue is such a good way to eat and chat. The atmosphere and setting were also pretty comfortable.
author: Ya K.

description:
OVERALL EXPERIENCE
Though the fondue selection that we got wasn't the greatest, it was an overall awesome experience because of stellar customer service. That's all it takes to satisfy me in the end. 

ATMOSPHERE
It was clean. The seating and lighting made everything feel very cozy and intimate.

CUSTOMER SERVICE
Big shout out to how well you all treated us - simply the vibes and the patience with us as my lady and I were quite the newbies when it came to fondue. I was amazed at the attention and care that was put into our service and I walked out satisfied and happy about visiting. 

SUGGESTIONS
Maybe have a tasting selection before customers could order? The fondue we ordered didn't sit well with the aftertaste, but my lady and I had to push on through since we paid for it and all. 

Thank you Fondue Cowboy! =D
author: Jonathan R.

description:
My daughter wanted to try fondue so bad. Since finding place in or near L.A. or the O.C are almost impossible, I checked out San Francisco since we were heading there for a short break between Christmas and New Year's. Using Yelp, I came across Fondue Cowboy. 

After visiting their website, I knew this was the perfect place. I mean, who doesn't like fondue and western movies, right? I made a reservation for 8 p.m. on the evening of the 26th of December. I figured that would be a great way to kick off our San Francisco adventure. When we arrived, the place was busy. It is a small place with a bar and maybe 5 tables. Paul greeted us when we arrived. Just an FYI, kids can sit at the bar since they serve food there. 

The fondue menu has several options. Since our daughter was with us, we chose the more milder of the fondues. The Outlaw. Each fondue comes with bread, roasted potatoes, black olives, and pickles. For dessert, we had the Happy Trails dark chocolate fondue. It comes with marshmallows, strawberries, banana, and kiwi. All together, an incredible mix. 

The bar serves beer and wine. The wine list is simple, but good. A little on the pricey side, but after all, it's San Francisco. 

Finding Cowboy Fondue was easy. It's a small place, but the sign is unique so you can't miss it. It is right on the corner of Folsom and Russ. We were staying on Nob Hill so we took Lyft since it was on the other side of town for us. 

Check out Fondue Cowboy if you are in town. It is the true, San Francisco treat.
author: Bill S.

description:
If you've been to The Melting Pot you will be sorely disappointed here.

We had The Outlaw (cheddar, beer etc.) and the Milk Chocolate with walnuts. I was more surprised by the chocolate because it wasn't like any milk chocolate I've had before, wasn't sweet and didn't taste anything like e.g. Hershey's milk chocolate, Gharradelli etc.. That's hard to mess up. The cheese was just meh, nothing compared to the cheddar/beer at The Melting Pot.

The sides were limited, no pretzels for the cheese no blondes for the chocolate. 
Like others have said the menu is pretty limited, 

Great service though.
author: Xi W.

description:
Decided to give this place a try as my boyfriend's apartment is nearby (plus, he loves cheese). We made a reservation that day just 3-4 hours ahead of time, and they were super accommodating; we got a table right in the back by the kitchen. The decor threw me off a little bit--it's pretty dark in there, and as the name would suggest, the decor was Western-themed. I'm talking handkerchiefs instead of napkins, people. It was pretty cute though, so I didn't mind one bit! They were definitely committed to the theme.

As this was our first time a bit, we were a little bit confused as how to navigate the menu. Our waitress was very sweet & helpful--she explained that it's $28 for one serving of fondue, which is meant for two people. In addition to the melting cheese pot, you also get unlimited little bread pieces, olives, apples, broccolis, pickles, grapes, and potatoes. The pot itself doesn't look that big, but trust me, you will be full!

What We Ordered:

-Lonestar Cheese (3/5): This was very flavorful, but just a bit salty for my taste. It's a pretty sharp cheese, but to be fair, I don't like cheese that much. It paired really well with the bread pieces, as well as the hot links. Surprisingly, the grapes/apples also tasted kind of great with the cheese? I was a little taken aback, but it was definitely a pleasant surprise.

-Side of Hot Links (5/5): These were so juicy with a rich, tangy aftertaste, and paired perfectly with the fondue that we ordered. I would highly recommend dishing out the extra money to order a side of meat with your fondue!

All in all, I'm not sure I would come back as I'm not the biggest fan of cheese, but this is a great place to take all of your cheese-loving friends and family! You can also make reservations ahead of time to make getting a table extra simple.
author: Stephanie N.

description:
5/5 for the reasonable prices and quality here at Fondue Cowboy! Even though the Western theme is a bit confusing when you're eating French cuisine and the awesome charcuterie plates, the cool black and white movies and awesome playlist in the restaurant makes the weird mix perfect. Make sure to get a reservation as this place does fill up on some days, grab a friend, and come split a fondue! 

[Fondue]
The fondues are normally split between two people, so its advisable to bring a friend. Each one is about $28, so splitting between two people makes the price reasonable. If you want a classic fondue, go for the original, but if you want to try something a bit more flavorful, I would try Rawhide. What genius decided to put bacon in fondue? The fondue comes with a plate with amazing potatoes, as well as bread, grapes, raw veggies, cornichons, and olives. If you're not a fan of olives like me, I normally ask for extra bread or cornichons. The meat plates are extra and I only order them if I'm extra hungry because the fondue will fill you up! 

[Drinks]
Great happy hour prices! They have cheap house wine if you go during the weekday, but I normally am a fan of their Sangria. 

Fondue Cowboy is pretty unique in San Francisco - I haven't found a place like it elsewhere and for the price and quality as well. If you're looking for a date spot, I would highly recommend this place! Or if you're just looking for some awesome fondue to satisfy your cheese craving.
author: Alice Z.

description: We ended up seated at the bar, even with a prior reservation through Open Table. It actually was fine and probably just as enjoyable as a table. Service was attentive and pleasant. The cheese fondue was well-executed and deceptively the right size for our party of two. The "dippers" were all fresh and nicely presented, including the Fingerling potato chunks served in a traditional fondue accompaniment. Similarly, the chocolate fondue was appropriately sized and presented with fresh fruits (banana, strawberry, kiwi, pineapple), chocolate sourdough bread chunks, craft marshmallow pieces, and nicely textured Madelines. We will definitely return, particularly as a nice pre-show meal since it is an easy walk from Civic Center/UN Plaza.
author: Glen J.

description:
We were easily able to reserve for a large group during the week. Fondues are for two, so come with a friend or a big appetite. I know, I know, they look small at first, but they're pretty filling.

The group liked the Outlaw the best. Skip the Mixed Greens salad, it was lackluster. The meat portions were sizeable, and we liked the Spicy Sausage the best of the three. The dessert fondues were solid - definitely preferred the dark chocolate with a spicy kick.

Solid place for a date, groups, etc. Fast and friendly service. I'm still not sure what cowboys have to do with anything. You get a bandana instead of a napkin, and the decor is vaguely Western themed. But why?
author: Eva W.

description:
Hands down our favorite restaurant in San Francisco, and far overdue to receive a glowing review.  Have been regulars here for over 4 years, we celebrate every birthday and special occasion here.  

The food is delicious first of all.  And parents, what a fabulous and fun way to get vegetables into your child!  It's truly a joy to watch kids sit for longer than usual while they shove broccoli into their mouths.  The classic fondue is true, and all the variations are wonderful too.  This was one of the few restaurants we could go with a friend who is allergic to cow dairy and everyone could still have a wonderful time.

Wine selection is great, and the happy hour is a great bargain.  They really take the time to select interesting wines that pair well.

Almost more important that the food, the owners and staff are some of the kindest and attentive folks we've ever encountered.  They are all competent, efficient, and patient.  They welcome us back every time with warmth and recognition.  And as parents of young kids, we are always grateful when we can find a place with class, upscale food, and a lack of judgment about little ones.  And with a sparkling clean bathroom to boot.  Paradise!
author: Penny L.

description:
Pros:
*We got the Outlaw. The fondue was delicious. *Comes with bread, potatoes, olives, cornichons (little pickles), apples, grapes

Cons:
*The restaurant doesn't have their liquor license, so they have wine 'cocktails.'  I got the Cherry Margarita, it was really sweet, and didn't taste at all if there was wine it in
*The price is a bit expensive for this place. It was $97 for fondue, two drinks, the meat side, sausage side, and the beet salad. 
*I felt pretty hungry still when I was done eating 

Recommendations:
*They could use more side options
*Lower their prices
author: Chris S.

description:
Happy hour no longer covers fondue, which sucks because I put off going here for almost a year until we could go early in the evening. I didn't realize it until I checked the receipt, and we'd tipped 40% to compensate for the lower prices! But I'm okay with that because our waiter was lovely and we had a great time.

I intended to get two savory and one dessert fondue. But I was stuffed after our pot of Rawhide (and two half-priced beers). The Gorgonzola was just prominent enough that you knew it was there without overpowering the classic base. It went best with the cornichon and apples.

It was nice to have fondue in a casual environment. We especially appreciated how they didn't cram too many seats into the small space, and left plenty of room between tables. Because we cheese-enthusiasts often require a little extra room!
author: Lauren C.

description: My first time having fondue was at this restaurant and I must say it was fantastic. The staffs were super kind and enthusiastic. Although, I wish there was more meat options. I ordered the original  cheese which was so yummy! Next time I would like to try the two different cheese. Also, the cost for the meal isn't bad!
author: Kristi A.

description:
I am such a fan!! My first time here and went with a group of 5 girls and it was the perfect amount. The food was delicious, the server was AMAZING. I think his name was Paul ha! I'd definitely will come back here again. It has a great vibe to it. 

Sides: 
- Roasted Beet: Arugula, Goat Cheese. Toasted Walnuts, Tarragon Vinaigrette (really good)
- Homemade Meatballs (goes really well with the savory fondues) 

Savory Fondues: 
- Outlaw: Aged Cheddar, Beer, Slow Roasted Tomatoes, Roasted Garlic, Roasted Jalapeno, Cilantro
- Stage Coach: Jarlsberg Cheese, White Wine, Sauteed Mushrooms, Roasted Garlic (sub mushrooms for bacon instead) 

***Also try the dessert fondue with dark chocolate!
author: Jenn L.

description: The cheese and sides were so amazing!! Meatballs and white chocolate was so yum! Ambiance is perfect. Service was lovely!
author: Marci M.

description: What a great twist to a 70s staple. I really like this place. It's clean and modern and the service is over the top!  Great job guys.
author: Jerry V.

description: This is probably my favorite place to eat in SOMA. The food is great and a good value. Service is always on point.
author: Kylie H.

description:
Food and service great.
Loved the fondue n all the assortments. 
Two thumbs up. 
We had the OUTLAW Fondue, added Spicy Sausage, Strawberry Mojito n Sangria.
author: Hungry K.

description:
This place was rated so highly that I was almost kind of skeptical when going here. No way this place could be that good, right? Well it is. There is awesomeness all around.

We ordered "The Quick Draw" fondue (Gouda and white wine). The waitress brought us this tiny pot and my first thought was that it might not be enough for 2 people. Boy, was I wrong. This little pot seemed bigger than I anticipated so our bellies were full before we knew it. Also because they provide you with endless potatoes and bread (genius!) besides the broccoli, grapes, olives, cornichons and green apple you get as a side. 

The waitress was very friendly and fast. Great experience overall. My only regret is not having enough belly space left over for chocolate fondue. I'll definitely be back.
author: Ellen H.

description: Loved the fondue here! We got the outlaw and it was amazing, a perfect size for 2 people. I wish I could have tried the others too! Definitely going back. The restaurant is small and casual, it has a relaxed vibe. The staff was accommodating and friendly.
author: Ray N.

description:
FOOD
- Traditional Savory Fondue: Swiss Gruyere, emmenthaler, white wine, roasted garlic, and nutmeg. Good but it had a little bit of an aftertaste. Comes with unlimited slices of bread, roasted potatoes, pickles, black olives, broccoli, red grapes, and green apples. 3.75/5

- Rawhide Savory Fondue: Italian Dolce Gorgonzola, emmenthaler, bacon, roasted garlic, and we substituted the white wine with apple juice. I definitely liked this cheese better. Comes with unlimited slices of bread, roasted potatoes, pickles, black olives, broccoli, red grapes, and green apples. 4.5/5

- Cured Sliced Meat Plate: Prosciutto De parma, Sopreseta Salami, Hot Coppa Salami. All tasty. 3.5/5

- Homemade Meatball: flavorful! This was my favorite side. 5/5

- Spicy Sausage: Louisiana hot links. It had a nice kick. 4/5

SERVICE
Friendly and attentive. 5/5

FINAL THOUGHTS
I would come back to try other flavors. Next time I'll leave room for a sweet fondue!
author: Jennifer N.

description: Melted deliciousness...what's not to love?!?!  This place will always be a special place for me being it was a first date spot for us.  I've been here half a dozen times and have had every cheese and chocolate and side on the menu.  My favorite is the cheddar fondue with the Gouda as a close second.   I love the "stock" sides they provide with the cheese and think it's plenty.  But the meats are a great and are a great addition and go with every cheese. I've had one of the salads.  I remember pears and a vinaigrette dressing I think.  I've had each of the chocolates and they are all delicious.  Recently we had walnuts with dark chocolate, I think I prefer it without the walnuts.  The Malbec they have is delicious.  Not too dry and very aromatic.  Besides the deliciousness of melted cheese I really appreciate the service.  Our waiter has been so friendly and pleasant every single time we have been there.  We look forward to seeing him and hope he is there when we go.  I appreciate how he jokes around with us and goes with the flow.  I am embarrassed to admit I realize I can't remember his name at the moment.  He is part of the reason we keep coming back.  Great food, great ambiance and,  great service is what this place is made of!
author: Kelly D.

description:
Was in the SOMA district, and decided to take a chance based on Yelp reviews.  So glad we did!  Located on the corner of Folsom and Russ; we were able to find free street parking on Folsom.  Its a little restaurant and there were no tables available, but the bar was available and we grabbed a couple of seats.

Decor is western, with an old western movie playing on the wall; even their napkins are western handkerchiefs.  

They have a variety alcohol, wine, beer and cocktails.  I opted for a Pinot Noir and it was good.

We ordered the newest fondue on the menu, the Lonestar.  We added the cured slice meats (proscuitto, salami).  When our little fondue pot was brought out, out came chunks of bread, potato, broccoli, pickles, apples, and grapes.  The fondue?  Rich and Spreadable.  Yes, we ate it all.  The cured sliced meats were savory.

Finally, service was friendly and efficient.

What a cute date spot!
author: Melissa L.

description:
Omg! If you love cheese you have to come here!  I'm from Europe and since I tried fondue as a little girl I was a big fan, so it was my lucky day when I found this place on the other side of the world!  Me and my hubby went there to celebrate my BDay and the service was great! The food was even better. The texture of the fondue was so smooth and all the sides were a perfect match! We tried the classics but for sure we will be back to try all the rest and the chocolate as well. Surprisingly they have great cocktails as well (I would expect them to have more wines but oh well) 

PS one portion is just right for two.
author: Katerina P.

description:
my Beautiful Girlfriend loves cheese.
one day before my birthday, I made a reservation for us for a nice, romantic cheesy date :)
we ordered Traditional Cheese Fondue (Swiss Gruyere, Emmenthaler, White Wine, Roasted Garlic, Ground Nutmeg).
with the addition of Meatballs.
the cheese fondue comes with crackers, dill pickles, olives, sliced apples, grapes.
it was good, but the price kinda high for what you get.
author: Rudy H.

description:
Omg, this place is amazing.  Came here with my boyfriend just as happy hour was ending and had such a great time.  We got the Outlaw, side of meats, and the milk chocolate fondue.  I literally dream about this place. 

The bartender / host was super friendly and helpful with guiding our selection of both food and beverages.  And he was spot on!  By the time we finished, we decided to host my boyfriend's 30th at this awesome venue!  I can't wait to spread the love (and cheese) to our friends with this amazing little gem of a restaurant.  Love, love, love.  New favorite place in the city!  Just fon-due it. Ha.
author: Ashley T.

description: Delish fondue & sides! We ordered two cheeses (which the names I can't remember) but were delicious and the sides were great. Definitely recommend the sausage links as a side to help round it out as a meal. I went with three others and we ordered two fondues and it was just the right amount! My only critique was that I felt like the wine pour was a little stingy, and I've had bigger pours per glass for the same price (and relative quality of wine) elsewhere. But- definitely check them out. Great for a girls night out or date night!
author: Chelsea G.

description: Lovely place and really enthusiastic staff--made for a really fun birthday evening with friends. Portions are on the smaller side but are simply fun to eat, pleasing to the eye, and both savory and chocolate fondues were superbly tasty.
author: Rex N.

description: Fantastic! Hubby & I split one if the fondue and meat plate and gorged ourselves. Try the Cowboy Punch!
author: Vicki H.

description:
Service - 5/5
Food - 5/5 

Ordered the lone star and classic fondue. Automatically comes with veggies, bread, fruit and pickles. Ordered charcuterie and the spicy sausage. Way bette than melting pot by far. 

At first, I thought it was going to be enough food for our group of 5 but I was dead wrong. Just the right amount of food and enough room for their dark chocolate fondue - that's a must. Definitely coming back here.
author: Vince L.

description: This was good! I was surprised by how small the fondue pot was, but actually it was perfectly filling for us two ladies. It is smaller than many places for the same price though, so he warned
author: j s.

description: definitely recommend the place for anyone looking for a delicious swiss fondue. The meatballs had a special taste in this restaurant and they're nearly identical to what I have tried in Switzerland. Their small serving pot serves two.
author: Nadeem W.

description:
I live a block away and this is my favorite date night spot with the hubby. The cowboy decor theme is trendy and cool. They have a great romantic atmosphere. 4/5 are young or young-ish couples. 

We have tried pretty much everything and they are all great, but our favorite are: outlaw, rawhide, meatballs, and sausages. The cheese portion is very small compared to Matterhorn Fondue. You can dip but not completely immerse your sides in the Fondue. You have to ration or the last 10 bites will not have any cheese to dip in. Now maybe I'm being greedy, but we are eating bread with straight up melted cheese here, no one is following a diet. Can't I be fat but happy?

Tip:
You get a free carb plate (toasted bread and roasted potatoes) and a free pallet cleaning plate (pickled olive, pickled baby cucumber, apples, and grapes). If you don't like any of the choices, you can ask them to substitute something for another that you like.
author: Tata X.

description:
What an incredible experience!

I went with my partner and two friends to celebrate their New Year's engagement. This was my first time trying fondue (yes, ever!) and I'm worried other places simply won't live up to the standard set by Fondue Cowboy!

Service - We had an incredible waiter! They did a marvelous job setting expectations around the entire experience - from suggesting serving amount appropriate for four people to letting us know how long both our main courses and our dessert would take. They even periodically updated us so we were never in the dark wondering where our cheese was!

That said, everything came out promptly, hot, and delicious!

They even went so far as to accommodate a distaste for olives (by supplementing with the other dipping options) and checked back to see if we needed more of anything in particular (we requested more green apples, and they showed up in a jiffy).   

Food - We had:

The Traditional - Swiss Gruyere, Emmenthaler, White Wine, Roasted Garlic, Fresh Ground Nutmeg
The Rawhide - Italian Dolce Gorgonzola, Emmenthaler, White Wine, Bacon, Roasted Garlic

A cured meats plate
A meatball plate

And for dessert, Happy Trails - Dark Chocolate with Cayenne

Everything was incredible! The Traditional was mild and creamy, with a little earthiness from the nutmeg. The Rawhide was the right balance of pungent and smooth. The options for dipping items was a great spread: pickles, green apples, black olives, conchirion pickles, raw broccoli, baguette, and roasted potatoes. Divine! Meats were additional, but honestly, I'd have been satisfied without them - though they were very tasty.

The wine selection was very good and the offer of 1/2 bottles was very convenient for trying to wines between four people.

Desert was also yummy but to be frank, I would rather have kept dipping fruit in cheese! That's how good the cheese was - it was LITERALLY better than chocolate.

Decor/Atmosphere - Small, intimate, fun, funky. The Western theme is carried from the Clint Eastwood stencil on the wall to the paisley colored bandana napkins.

Overall - this place is great for a date night, a celebration, or a small group (I'd say 4-6 people max).

I can't wait to go back and I hope that you try it, too!
author: Jesseca E.

description:
I've lately been getting more into fondue places, the concept of dipping food into a pot of melted cheese just resonates with me. Cheese lovers unite! But Fondue Cowboy wins my vote so far.

Portion size, it was perfect for two people. As for the selections, we went with the Outlaw which was delicious (Aged Cheddar, Beer, Slow Roasted Tomatoes, Roasted Garlic, Roasted Jalapeno, and Cilantro) my tummy was happy. The fondue comes with a selection of dippers  (potatoes, bread, dill pickles, olives, apples, and grapes). We asked for refills on our favorites and the server happily refilled them, and quite fast too.

As for dessert, we went with a slightly customized order (Dark chocolate with walnuts). They were very accommodating with our custom order which we appreciated. Dippers for dessert were marshmallows, brownie bread, madeleines, and fresh fruit.

So if you're in San Francisco, find yourself craving a pot of melted cheese, Fondue Cowboy is your place. Cheese lovers are welcome .
author: Christine D.

description:
Dinner review. 

Outlaw - 5/5
Rawhide - 4/5
Meatballs - 3/5
Spicy sausage - 3/5
Buckaroo - 3/5

Overall, "as good as it gets."
author: Mark O.

description:
Great place to have a meal with friends. The atmosphere is really fun and who doesn't like fondue! 

Okay so the food in itself was probably more of a 4. But, the service was a 5! The waiter was awesome! He was so friendly and helped us decide which types of fondue we should get. 

We got two types of cheese fondue and 2 types of chocolate fondue for dessert. I've been to melting pot and each and every time I have been there, I always leave hungry. Not here, they're pretty generous with their fondues and their sides to dip. 

Cheese fondues: traditional and desperado (I think) both tasted similar, so I can't remember which one I liked better. At times, I felt like I could taste a weird cheap wine flavor, but maybe it was just me. 

Chocolate fondues: happy trails and high noon. High noon was a white chocolate based fondue while the other was a dark chocolate with cayenne. I think we all liked the dark chocolate one the best. 

We also started off with 2 salads, a beet salad and mixed greens. Both delicious and fresh.
author: Nancy A.

description: We got the Lonestar savory fondue because the server recommended it to us, but it was extremely bitter and tasted overpoweringly like alcohol. It was impossible to mask the taste of wine. I guess if people enjoy bitter cheese, then they'll enjoy this fondue. However, the sweet Buck-a-roo fondue was delicious. Service was good, but the prices were a bit high considering how bad the savory fondue was.
author: Dinnerdash A.

description: What a fun, unique and charming gem this is!  It's a small space so reservations would be recommended unless you're dining late.  Small fondue menu for dinner and dessert - all are made from scratch when ordered.  Menu says each fondue can be shared by 2 - I would agree with the dippers {potatoes, bread, apples, pickles, olives and grapes} but not for the cheese.  Hubby and I each easily ate our own fondue choice with no leftovers {other than the dippers}.  We added a side of meatballs which were very good, want to try the sausage next time.  The fondue is excellent - the gorgonzola needed salt desperately and was a little heavy on the cooking sherry but was still very good.  Hubby had the spicy one and it was excellent.  White chocolate fondue for dessert - I could have just eaten that an gone to heaven.  Excellent service and a really unique space - all cowboy themed even Western movies playing on their big screen.  We'd definitely will come back.
author: Samantha T.

description: Had the Stagecoach Fondue and it was delicious! Came with plenty of things to dip in the fondue - more than enough for two people. In fact, we were so full we didn't even order the chocolate fondue that we planned on having. We'll have to go back for it. Also, it just happened to be happy hour and our wine was half off!! Loved this place, I'll be back!
author: Allie H.

description:
5.23.16 

This place is fantastic! Super cute cowboy theme. The napkins here are handkerchiefs. Adorbs, no? We made a reservation through Yelp for a table that can accommodate 7. We were celebrating a coworkers birthday. We were greeted by the nicest fellow and got seated right away. 

I didn't catch the guy's name, but he was really nice to our party. E.g. Making sure we understood the menu, explaining to us the different options, letting us know it was happy hour, etc. They have wine on tap! $5 per glass during happy hour. Awesome deal! 

We ordered 4 different cheeses. 

Outlaw-my favorite!!! Cheddar beer jalapeño. 
Rawhide-tie for second favorite. 
Traditional-tie for second favorite. Gruyere. Goes really well with the fruits! 
Quick draw-Manchego one.

The cheeses come with a platter of potatoes (reaaaalllyyyy delicious), crostini, bread cubes, olives, baby picked (reaaalllyy yummy), grapes and green apples! It's actually quite a bit! We also order the spicy sausage and a plate of charcuterie. Spicy sausages were deeeeelissshhh. 

At the end we got the milk chocolate with walnuts. That came with chocolate bread, marshmallows, and mixed fruits. I really want to try the dark chocolate with pepper if I come back! 

TL; DR-get the outlaw! Add spicy sausage. Happy hour is a steal!
author: Dianna C.

description: Ambiance is incredible, portions are better than expected and the food is out of this world. The small details make it worthwhile (bandanas for napkins, and western films playing) but the fondue was to dieeeee for.
author: Lauren M.

description:
I went in excited and left stuffed and happy, expectations surpassed. The restaurant is smaller than expected but that gives it a local homey vibe, and we got some great attention from our waitress. Pro tip: make a reservation!

The cheese fondue was thick and frothy and their were lots to pick from, different cheeses and some with wine, beer and bacon as ingredients. Dips were included and refills were free, their roasted potatoes were excellent! They say you should split one between two, but it can stretch to 3 or 4 peeps, especially if you want to save room for the chocolate fondue dessert. I had the dark chocolate and cayenne and it was so rich I was temporarily struck silent with sugar overload. Six stars!

(And they give you bandannas as napkins!)
author: Zara S.

description:
For some reason fondue isn't very popular in the US , and that's nuts. Fondue cowboy has a nice lounge vibe and their food is simple and done right. 

I suggest a group of 2-4, make a reservation, and start w the classic fondue. The lone star fondue is good, but has a good tang to it from caramelized onions.

This place is in deep soma, and nothings around so you'll need to uber out here.
author: Grayson K.

description: Really enjoyable.  Love the low key atmosphere. The service, as well as food was great. Portions were more than adequate. The cowboy punch was delic. Parking was a breeze.  An overall pleasant evening.
author: Lisa M.

description: A little pricey but the dark chocolate fondue was wonderful. The customer service is good.
author: Grace Y.

description:
Not bad if you're really craving fondue. I appreciate that the servings aren't huge - one "Serves 2" fondue pot really is pretty small and appropriate for two.

RESERVATIONS
Made for 7pm on a Friday for four, and expanded to six of us the day before. It's a small spot, and it was full for dinner, but there didn't seem to be a wait.

SERVICE
We didn't love our server. As a group of six, it was important to us how many meatballs were in the Homemade Meatballs side. She said twelve - which is perfect! Two each. After we got the meatballs, we realized we were one short. We half jokingly brought it up to her, saying there were only 11 in our dish. No smile, barely any acknowledgement - she just asked, "So do you want another order of the meatballs?" My friend joked "Only if there are 12," at which our table laughed. Again, no smile from the server, just "So do you want another order?" Man, so cold! I understand that picking over one single meatball is not a big deal, but she could've had a bit of a sense of humor, or acknowledged her misinformation to our group.

COST
$197.06 before tip, split six ways. We got a couple drinks, 3 fondue pots, and 3 sides. 

SIDES
Spicy Sausage was the best - juicy, and legit spicy. The meatballs were a bit dry. The sliced meat were a nice extra option to wrap around the bread or potatoes and dip in to your cheese. 

SAVORY FONDUE
We got the Rawhide (Gorgonzola), Desperado (Goat Cheese), and Outlaw (Cheddar). The Gorgonzola was the most flavorful, Cheddar the most bland. All were melted to a nice balance of thickness without being watery. I.e., not a huge threat of dripping.
author: Ziyan C.

description:
A little taste of the Alps in San Francisco ! 

What a great place to enjoy some cheese. We tried the traditional fondue, it felt exactly like a french Fondue Savoyarde ! 
The dips were interesting, you have bread of course, but also olives, fruit, vegetable... 

Quantity for two is way not enough compare to what I am used to, so we took a second one as it was really good ! 

We came at the end of happy hour, beers and wine are half price, perfect to start dinner. 

Service was really nice, the guys were ultra friendly and polite. We will definitely come back there.
author: Anthony D.

description:
Fondue in of itself is an AWESOME concept. Give me a bucket of melted cheese and let me dip stuff in it. You can't really go wrong with that. And then to end the evening with a bucket of melted chocolate and yummy sweets to dip in. 

Why don't we have more restaurants like this in San Francisco??

I have been here a handful of times and I have enjoyed every single time. I have tried the classic and goat cheese fondue. I like the classic better. I feel like it does a better job of not overpowering the food items. 

I always go for the milk chocolate fondue for dessert, cause it's just amazing. 

My complaint is the portion size of the melted cheese or chocolate delivered. It's definitely not a bucket size, which I guess I am okay with but it could be just a tad bigger. If you give me melted cheese, normal appetite constraints don't quite apply. I mean if I have landed myself in this establishment I have obviously chosen to go a less than healthy route for the day so I need MORE cheese and chocolate than what they typically serve to really go out with a bang.

Pro tip: Make a reservation this place will fill up on the typical busy nights of Friday or Saturday evening.
author: Cynthia G.

description: I've never been to a fondue restaurant before so I wasn't sure what to expect, and it was great. The service was excellent. The two gentlemen working were attentive, friendly, and very helpful. My friend and I had a lot of special requests they graciously accommodated. I thought the selection had good variety, and our drinks were very good as well. I look forward to coming back.
author: Beth D.

description: My favorite place in San Francisco. Nice people, great fondue! Great happy hour, too.
author: Ginny P.

description:
This place is cool. It's a nice spot to meet up with friends or take a date. I came on a Sunday afternoon and my trip just happened to coincide with their weekend happy hour, which has good + affordable drinks but the food is still a little pricey. The cured meat selection seemed like it was pulled out of Trader Joes. Given how small the cheese pot is, you're basically paying mostly for things to dip in it.

Still, Fondue Cowboy is definitely different from a lot of places in SF. The cowboy theme is fun and makes for good conversation; maybe check it out for a first date or gathering with a big group of friends.
author: Brandon M.

description:
My first time trying fondue -- I was so excited because it has always been something I wanted to try!  

We ordered two cheese plates and two meat plates (we were a party of 3).  Our waitress had recommended two cheese plates, but honestly we would have been fine with one.  For our two cheeses we got the Traditional and the Desperado.  They were both good, but I definitely liked the Desperado.  Again, I have to emphasize, we had way too much cheese -- 1 order of cheese would have been perfect for a group of 3.  We got the meatballs and the cured meat plate -- and they were both delicious.  The meatballs look small but those things are dense (which is a good thing).  

Our waitress had advised us that we would veggies too, but she did not mention the bread and potatoes we would get too.  So again, we probably had more food than we needed.  Wish we had known that...

Overall though, I liked it a lot and would definitely return.  The decor was pretty neat, and the food was good.  Only downside is the location if you don't have a car and you use public transit (like me).
author: Michelle S.

description: Service, not bad but you are "cooking" yourself.  But wait, where is the oil? or broth?  Is this real Fondue Ok, so the cheese choices are nice.  My highlight was the dark chocolate with cayenne.   The meatballs are "Costco" like.  Veggies, breads, fruits all seem like they are store bought and not the quality I would expect in a restaurant.   With just a bit more attention to food quality at the same price, I think Fondue Cowboy would rock.   Beer and Wine only, if it matters, corkage is a reasonable $20 if you BYOB.
author: Jas S.

description:
Fondue Cowboy serves savory (cheese) and sweet (chocolate) fondues in a dim but cozy Western-themed environment. The cheese fondues are vegetarian and come with a plate of fresh vegetables and fruit and a plate of potatoes and bread. This portion may be just enough to satisfy two hungry adults, but I suggest supplementing with a plate of meat too.

We shared the Outlaw Cheddar fondue, which is aged cheddar melted cooked with beer, roasted tomatoes, garlic, jalapeños, and cilantro. The texture was very gooey and creamy, and it was overall delicious with a mild kick from the jalapeños.

Our vegetable and fruit plate included olives, pickles, broccoli, red grapes, and apples, all of which were very fresh, crisp, and paired nicely with the cheese fondue. Since we wanted some additional protein, we ordered a plate of spicy Louisiana hot links, which were very salty and oily, but good.

The fondue experience was fun, but I was a little disappointed with the portion size, which seemed a little too small. Overall, Fondue Cowboy provides a great fondue experience in a fun atmosphere, despite being hidden away in the sketchy SOMA district. The restaurant is quite small, so reservations are recommended for large groups.
author: Priscilla W.

description: I love love love cheese and this was the place to indulge. We ordered the cowboy fondue and what is better than cheese and bacon?? Drinks were delicious service was quick and friendly and the chocolate fondue was delicious as well. Price was a little high but when compared to other fondue places it was a deal!
author: Monica B.

description: Nice service and intimate but fun atmosphere. We, or more like I, had a hard time deciding on which savory fondue to pick, so I gave my top 3 choices to the waitress, and she picked a delicious choice! She gave us the Outlaw (aged cheddar, beer, slow roasted tomatoes, roasted garlic, roasted jalapeño, and cilantro) with meatball side. Wish there was a savory and sweet combo!
author: Jasmine M.

description: One of the best restaurants I've been to in SF. They brought us our cheese fondue which was so good. They refilled our potato and bread plate 3 times which was very generous, and had sweet deals on their beer during happy hour. This would be the perfect place for a date night for foodies. I recommend getting the fondue of your choice and if you need some meat get the sides, but the fondue alone is enough for a meal for two.
author: Parker C.

description: I've been to this place 3 times and I will keep coming back. When you walk in you think that it's just a cute little place in a somehow shady part of the city, but then you start ordering and... the food is soooooo good!!!! I mean... you think that the selection is not big enough and then you order and BAM! you get everything and more. I love this Fondue Cowboy, and I'll keep coming here!
author: Daniele P.

description: I have to say this place sucked the girl that's taking reservations makes it seem like the place is always packed yet it was dead the fondue was bland and the place lacks ambiance
author: Vk K.

description: Had a lovely date night here. Service was great, and the fondue was amazing!!! Their house wine was nice (and cheap!) too. I would definitely recommend it for a date night or at most a 3-4 person group - it is quite small, so make a reservation :)
author: Nina S.

description: I ended up at Fondue Cowboy with a buddy on a weekday evening. The atmosphere was on the darker side, tight seating and the menu seemed limited. More of a date night kind of spot. We tried  a savory & sweet fondue with a side of sausage.  We ate everything.
author: Andrew H.

description: Super cute place! My first time trying fondue and my friends and i loved it! Very friendly service. I look forward to coming back!
author: Maria N.

description: We had a wonderful experience at Fondue Cowboy! The servers are incredibly friendly and helpful. The decor is very cute and the smell is intoxicating (but not in a totally overwhelming way- more in a way that gets you even more excited to eat melty cheese than you thought was possible). I'm drooling just writing this post. Love love love this place!
author: Hilary R.

description:
Where should we eat? Criteria: I wanted to go to SF; hubby wanted hipster; teen girl wanted fondue. Ta da! Fondue Cowboy!

Our experience began with making the reservation....at the last minute, of course. Called on Saturday at 5:30pm to see if they could take 3....teen girl was on Yelp saying there was an 8pm available and hubby was saying there was an 8:15. I just wanted to call. The woman on the phone couldn't have been nicer and was looking at their system and seeing there was some kind of hold or inquiry of these times and then I yelled out the two knuckleheads to close Yelp and then asked her to refresh her system and she did.... she gave us the 8:00 but also let me know there was a good chance we could come earlier and would text us if something became available. I hung up and 10 minutes later got a text that we could come at 7:30. Yay!

We arrived 30 minutes early, because traffic was non-existent on this holiday weekend, and yet our table was ready and waiting for us! We had a lovely table at the end. I enjoyed the bench seating on the wall with all the pillows, since I had been gardening all day and my back hurt.

We ordered sangria, beer, wine and ginger ale. The sangria was delicious - just the right amount of fruit pieces so you could eat a few, but not feel like they were trying to give you more fruit than alcohol. 

We ordered two fondues - Traditional (Gruyere, Emmenthaler, White Wine, Roasted Garlic, Fresh Ground Nutmeg) and Desperado (Goat Cheese, Emmenthaler, White Wine, Roasted Garlic, Olives). The Desperado was our clear favorite....nice flavors and the addition of the tiny chunks of olives was good. The Traditional could have used a bit more flavor....perhaps amp up the garlic? Or add champagne. Champagne makes everything better. I like the accoutrements that come with the fondues....it's everything we use at home. Bread, apples, cornichons, potatoes (these were by far the best dipping item), broccoli (although I do like it slightly steamed, rather than raw, as these were), and grapes.

We were pretty hungry and the two fondues were just right for the three of us. If it were just two of us and we had ordered one fondue, I think I wouldn't have been satisfied. Obviously this is a personal quantity preference - you decide for yourself.

Great atmosphere, super friendly service, and good food....I'd definitely come back!
author: Laurie H.

description:
I stopped in here while traveling to San Francisco. I sat at the bar and the staff was friendly.  I had a cheese fondue and a chocolate fondue and they were both great.

I'd recommend it!
author: Matthew S.

description: Great place for fondue! Comfy seats, and simple menu. They have nice cheese fondue options plus meat (salami, sausage, etc.) that go well with your hot cheese. Don't skip dessert - dark chocolate fondue was just awesome. It comes with fruits, marshmallow, and chocolate bread. It is to die for!
author: Merve A.

description:
Winter is here and as such cravings for warm food are back, and of course fondue is one of them! I opened Yelp and look for a fondue place (wasn´t really sure if there was one in SF) and Fondue Cowboy came first in the list, so my friends and I decided to gvie it a try it.
The menu is short and simple but very innovative, like who would have though jalapeños in a fondue... so we decided to give it a try as it was one of the recommendations and we do not regret! The flavor was really good, not too spicy but it gave a different taste to the cheese. We also got the sausages and meatballs, which we recommend both, and for dessert we went with the milk fondue which comes with walnuts, and they were kind enough to put them on the side. The service was great and we will certainly return for our fondue cravings!
author: Azul O.

description: We had a delicious night of fondue - cheese, chocolate, meat, and wine, yum! We had a delicious dinner with the outlaw fondue - which was cheddar, jalapeño, & cilantro and came with bread, apple, roasted potatoes, broccoli, baby pickles, and olives. We drank the white wine on tap from California which was buttery and delicious. We followed all this with some desert wine and white chocolate dip. The dip came with bread, cookies, and a plate of fruit. It was a great meal! Our waiter was super friendly and very attentive.
author: Jessie V.

description: Fondue Cowboy - I wanted so much to love it but was disappointed thinking we should have just gone to a shabu shabu place for a real meal or The Melting Pot. Service is great, though, so 3 stars for the guys that helped us out. This place would probably be better for meeting with friends as a happy hour kind of thing rather than a real meal.
author: Leina K.

description:
I discovered this restaurant by searching for places to take a teen. My 12 year old and I wanted to celebrate the hard work I've been doing for planning my upcoming wedding, and my birthday. We chose well by dining here last night.

Our server was extremely personable and figured out what we would like best. We ordered the Lonestar cheese fondue (love the Western-themed names), the pear and gorgonzola mixed greens salad, spicy sausage, and the white chocolate foundue. I also got a strawberry mojito (which wasn't that impressive, imho, hence the loss of the star).  Everything else was delicious, and I was pleased with the taste, restaurant ambiance, and remarkable service.  I especially appreciated how the server brought us more apples and grapes, because my kid wasn't a fan of the olives, raw broccoli, or cornichons. I think it was the service and atmosphere that sells me on this place. It is a nice place to take a young person, and fun to eat, but it was also upscale enough with the right lighting that would make it great for a date or celebration. We went on a Wednesday night, and it wasn't crowded. It was busy, but we were able to make and change our reservations online, no problem.
author: Robin W.

description: This place gets packed quickly, so either make a reservation or come early! They do have a happy house right when they open til 6 I believe, so thats worth coming to. I came here on my first date with my boyfriend and we came back a year later! The milk chocolate fondue is the best! It comes with so many different things to dip in, same with the regular fondues. Just the concept of dipping things in cheese and chocolate is such a fun experience that would be good for any kind of outing!
author: Larissa L.

description:
Fondue is the best date night idea ever! 5 stars for the service and food.
We ordered the stagecoach which uses a lovely white jarlsberg cheese and has sautéed mushrooms. They do offer sides with the cheese (a plate of fruit, veggies and a plate of bread and potatoes) but we ordered a side of sausage as well. The sausages went very well with the bread.

Portion sizes are good enough for 2 people and you can order dessert. We had the happy trails which is dark chocolate with cayenne pepper. The marshmallows go very well with the dark chocolate
author: Debjani B.

description: I'm so glad I found a fondue place! Yesterday was my sisters birthday so I planned a little dinner here for her. We arrived about 45 minutes early and our table was ready. The waitress immediately greeted us and we ordered drinks while we waited for the rest of our party. Once our party arrives our lovely waitress took our drink orders and gave us menus. Since each fondue feeds two people we paired off so that we can share with one other person. I shared the Longstar with my friend and my sister shared the QuickDraw with her daughter. We ordered a side of sausage and meatballs to go along with the dippers that come with the fondue. Everything was delicious. I did want more seasoning with the cheese fondue but it was still tasty. I can honestly say the best part was the dessert fondue. If you are tasing this get the dark chocolate with cayenne pepper, omg! With every dipper in that chocolate there was a party in my mouth. The atmosphere was super chill, there is plenty of parking if you come after 6. If you come before 6, parking is only one hour. The only reason I am giving four stars is because we came during happy hour and only the drinks were half off. Most establishments that I have been with happy hour include some of the food items as half off. Other than that, I plan to go again. Thanks Fondue Cowboy for making my sisters birthday a special one.
author: Adrienne M.

description:
The food, atmosphere and service were amazing this Valentines Prix Fixe evening.

There are less than 8 tables so be sure to book early. We picked the Rawhide for the savory (because bacon) and the Happy Trails for the sweet. The gorgonzola on the savory was just the right amount of creamy and bite. The dark chocolate paired with cayenne  created a really nice kick. 

I would recommend getting the cured meat add-in if you want to bump up the protein. 

We topped it off with the best cup of French Press roast I've ever had.  

I rarely have a server so engaged that both my husband and I hugged her on the way out. 

Fun had by all.
author: Dan E.

description:
Hmm... I think I'm just not a huge cheese/fondue person so my review might be the black sheep here. Everything was solid, but a bit too pricy for me. Between the 5 of us, we ordered 3 fondue sets. We all agreed the Outlaw was the best! It has a nice kick to it and it's flavorful! The portions were pretty generous... definitely heaven for carb lovers out there!

Our server was great although a bit awkward. Haha. But nonetheless, he made great wine and food recommendations!
author: Janet H.

description: Underwhelmed is the best way for me to put it.  I was looking forward to dipping things in cheese (I mean, who isn't?!) and thought the whole Western theme sounded cool.  I didn't feel like it was as "themed" as people made it out to be.  There is a big dead space between the row of tables/booths and the bar.  There is a Western playing on the TV.  Nothing else struck me to be so "Western" other than the clever names of the fondue.  We ordered the white bean salad (delish!) and the outlaw fondue with the prosciutto and salami on the side.  You definitely need to order a meat or you will not be full.  The fondue comes with an assortment of fruits, veggies and some bread.  A lot of things I probably would never dip into cheese, but hey, I'm new at this.  The cheese wasn't what I expected it to be.  Thought given the description it would've had more of a kick to it, but it just felt like cheese and tomatoes.  I didn't have a problem with service so much, and to be fair, there was only a couple of guys working there.
author: Reena P.

description: I honestly want to give this place a zero. worst customer service possibly. dont come here, u will b disappointed
author: Jazmyn R.

description: Fondue cowboy never disappoints! If you're looking for a delicious and interactive dining experience, I would recommend this spot over any of the Melting Pot chains. They have a great selection of wine and beers and the service is ALWAYS impeccable! Also...Come for happy hour!
author: Lauren B.

description: Delicious!! Very small venue but very tasty food and worth the visit. Everything we had was good and the staff is very friendly.
author: Bassam D.

description: For a group of three people, 2 fondue pots was way too much! The servings look small, but it is so deceiving. I truly enjoyed this fondue spot, I would 100% go again! It was delicious. The wine wasn't too overpowering but you could totally taste it. We ordered the lone star and the outlaw cheese fondue. It was so amazing and our server was so awesome. All the dipping appetizers were fresh. The marshmallows were all homemade and the fruits were nice &  fresh. We ordered the milk chocolate with walnuts Buck a roo fondue. It was so fulfilling and it hit the spot most definitely. The price was affordable. Other fondue restaurants would've costed more. Worth the trip, worth the money. I can't wait to go there again !
author: Elizabeth K.

description:
3.5 Stars.

Oh Fondue Cowboy are you a cute bar with a side restaurant? A tiny restaurant with a nice bar??

Fondue is really hard to find in San Francisco. Sure you have the Melting pot in Marin. The Matterhorn here in San Fran.....but not much else.

Fondue cowboy serves very good, albeit tiny portions, of unique and tasty fondue.

 We had the Outlaw fondue with: Aged Cheddar, Beer, Slow Roasted Tomatoes, Roasted Garlic, Roasted Jalapeno, and Cilantro. What an amazing combo of rich and tangy flavors. This fondue went well with all of the more mild fruits, vegetables, bread and potatoes. I would highly recommend this if you like spicy.

The other fondue was the Stage Coach:  Jarlsberg Cheese, White Wine, Sauteed Mushrooms, and Roasted Garlic. The stage coach was more buttery, creamy, and smooth. This fondue went well with the more spicy dipping items...the meats. Although it went well with all the veggies, fruits, and bread as well. This was def more of a traditional Swiss fondue.

The final order was for the cured meat plate. The plate was a nice selection of prosciutto type meats sliced thin ready for dipping in the warm gooey cheeses.

Service was really good. Our waiter was wonderful.

So why only three and a half stars. 

It is pricey for what you get. With a tip the bill was roughly a Benjamin. No drinks just two fondues and the cured meat...and I still was sorta hungry. 

Tip: Happy hour has great deals on drinks and fondues. That is when to go although it gets crazy busy than I am sure.

Yodel-ay-hee-hoo!
author: David G.

description: Tried fondue for the first time here. Their signature cheese fondue was good, came with fruits and veggies to dip. Also got a refill on our most popular veggie to dip (potatoes) with no extra charge. Immensely enjoyed the dark chocolate with cayenne  came with strawberries, breads, brownie, etc to dip. Would go back again but I will try a different cheese fondue
author: Sristi C.

description:
I mean really, what is not to love? It's fondue! And lightly cowboy themed! 

Fondue Cowboy is great for a group. I had a group of 7, and it all ran smooth as melted fondue chocolate. I am often tasked with group dinners in SF, and this was one of the best in terms of quality, speed and fun factor. Sometimes group dinners can drag on for hours and hours...we had a 7pm reservation and my jet-lagged Euro group was on their way no later than 9:30pm (with some dilly dallying at the end!), a record. 

Service was perfect. Friendly, fast and always with an eye on the wine! My kind of guys. We were ordering from the wines on tap and particularly enjoyed the Chardonnay, Pinot Grigio and Petit Syrah. Nice to be able to try different varieties out of the tap before indulging in a full bottle. 

The fondue! Perfect for a non-picky group (of which thankfully I was dining with). Your group likes cheese and chocolate? Things are going to be just fine! We tried 4 of the fondues (I liked them all, they were all cheese, I can't really go into the details, see above wine paragraph), which came with platters of dippers: roasted potatoes, bread chunks, veggies, etc. Everyone had a good time, interactive enough but not so interactive that its annoying or feels like "work." Word to the wise, I'm not sure this would be a great spot for vegans. We didn't have any. However, gluten-free folks will find fondue is a good option -- just avoid that bread and have them bring you a platter of veg! 

Dessert was such a treat! Of course. We ordered two chocolates, served with marshmallows, madeleines, brownie chunks, strawberries, etc. I mean -- again, what's not to love? Its not innovative pastry art, it's CHOCOLATE BOWLS. Perfection. 

This place has a great vibe, I really enjoyed the entire meal. Very laid back, super comfortable table with soft chairs and excellent for a group of 7. I encourage a reservation for a group so they can get your table setup. I was also able to make this reservation about a week out, unlike most other spots in SF. Easy peasy -- located at 1052 FONDUE!
author: Colleen C.

description: Really good service. We got traditional fondue and chocolate for dessert. Everything was fresh. They do happy hour, so that could be a good deal if you want to get some alcohol too.
author: Cesar N.

description: This place is AMAZING! Our waiter was Paul and he was extremely accommodating. They had delicious homemade Sangria and an awesome happy hour 6 days a week (Wednesday night's have half off bottles of wine). Paul walked us through the menu and was very attentive. Definitely come with an empty stomach and be prepared to eat alot.
author: Rachel C.

description:
Perfect date spot. This is a great spot for a small group of friends, or a first date. Intimate, but with the activity of dipping food, it's fun and whimsical.

We came here on a rainy night and it was steady crowd. The service was attentive and fast. They only have beer and wine, but also have cocktails made from that. So definitely something for everyone.

We did cheese and chocolate fondue, and it was definitely enough for 2 but could easily feed 3-4 if just coming for snacks. Note. They don't do the grilled meat place anymore, but the meatballs are good, just a little spicy for me!

Would definitely come back.
author: Natalie G.

description: The three cheese fondues we had amongst our group of 6 all tasted very similar which was a little disappointing and I would have enjoyed a wider array of vegetables to dip but other than that  it was great. We nearly didn't get the milk chocolate fondue for dessert (we also had the white chocolate) and I'm glad we did as it was my favorite item. I also really liked the drinks selection. I had the mango moscato and there were a couple of cocktails that I liked the look of which is unusual for me since I prefer sweet fruity drinks and those don't seem to be in vogue at the moment. Overall I'd say it was very good but not quite amazing.
author: Teegan L.

description:
Cardinal sin committed: we were rushed to leave!  It was my birthday dinner and head server was much more concerned about having our table to accommodate another party already seated next to us.  

The food is very overpriced for what you get.  Meatballs literally resemble Trader Joe's in every way.  Ingredients are not anything special.  The traditional cheese was good.  Everything else def. comes off as store bought.
author: Drew B.

description:
Came here during happy hour, and I must say I don't think the fondue here is worth it during normal hours. The pot is really tiny. I've been to Simply Fondue in Livermore before, so I made plenty of comparisons between the two. I think Simply Fondue is still better quality fondue, with very large portions, but it's also three times more expensive than Fondue Cowboy. 

We ordered the Outlaw and Happy Trails, since they came heavily recommended on Yelp. The taste of beer was pretty heavy in the Outlaw, but I loved dipping potatoes and apples in the cheese. We also ordered sausage, and it was hot off the grill. Our waitress was very attentive and happily filled us up with more potatoes, apples, and grapes as we requested. Seriously, those fingerling potatoes are to die for. 

I was less pleased with Happy Trails, since it tasted like any fondue I could cook up at home in my own fondue pot with some chocolate chips. I didn't really taste any cayenne, but maybe that's just me. Still, nobody can resist marshmallows and fruits ranging from pineapple to strawberry and kiwi, slathered in dark chocolate sauce. It's a small, cute little place. It was empty when I got there around 5:30, but started filling up after 6. Take advantage of happy hour, people! It's worth it.
author: Sophie W.

description:
I always have a hit or miss experience at fondue places. I thought The Melting Pot was awesome albeit spendy, but I thought Melt! was shitty and still spendy. So I was a little bit skeptical coming here, but with my low expectations from Melt, I was ever so surprised about Fondue Cowboy.

I like the decor, it's modern and very clean. Also, the assortment of dippers they give you is simple but not too lame. We ordered 2 cheese fondues because 1 can be shared, but might leave you wanting more. Accompanying the fondue we got ... bread, fingerling potatoes, broccoli, mini pickles, olives, grapes, and apples (all free refills!). We also got the salami plate which came with cantaloupe and honey dew (YUM!).

My only thing about fondue is you can always taste the alcohol and I'm not a huge fan of that taste in my cheese, but that could be personal preference. I was so full from everything though, it was awesome.
author: Angela L.

description: This review is a long time coming. I am lucky enough to work just a few blocks away from this place, and if I don't get to stop by at least once a week, I'm (at least internally) upset about it. And that's because Fondue Cowboy is PHENOMENAL. Phenomenal atmosphere, phenomenal food, phenomenal staff... 10/10. I have never had better fondue anywhere in my life. And all the fruits/veggies/breads that accompany the cheese are also so fresh and delicious!! The only reason this place doesn't have a line out the door constantly is because of the location...if this was in North Beach or the Marina, ohhh man. Not that I'm complaining about the lack of wait!! It just floors me sometimes because this place is that good. You'll never go anywhere else for fondue again. Thanks guys!!
author: Kat M.

description:
+ Awesome service and staff.
+ Great location ----- easy Parking.
+ HALF PRICE ON WINE BOTTLES (it was a Wednesday).
+ Not too noisy you can actually talk.
+ Cool set-up, lights are great and you can see the kitchen through a huge glass wall.
+ Quite decent price.

- The "traditional fondue" is not very traditional, the cheese taste is too sweet.
