When you place your order you should ask for cubes of white bread ONLY or they'll bring you potatoes and garlic toasted bread as well. The sides are completely wrong (except pickles) but the taste was right so its OKAY San Francisco is pretty far from Switzerland :)

I may go back to try another Fondue (and half price wiiiine) but definitely no more "traditional fondue" expectation.
author: David M.

description: I've never really been a fan of cheese fondue, but this place was ok. In comparison to other well known fondue places, I would pick this over the melting pot. It's a lot cheaper and you mostly get the same expirience. We tried 3 fondues; traditional, our law and quick draw. In terms of flavor and taste, my favorite was the Quick Draw. I am a fan of manchego cheese so I may have a bit of a bias.  We also got a meat plate, meatballs and a couple of dessert fondues, bother the chocolate and white chocolate. I would put more comments but there's nothing really special with the meal other than the portion is good to share with 3-4 people. When it comes to dessert, I usually like white chocolate, but the real chocolate fondue is the winner on this one.
author: Jan R.

description: Too many good things to say about this place! Can't recommend it rebought. Definitely try the rawhide. My friend and I came here to do our (better late than never) holiday gift exchange and couldn't have had a better experience! The wait staff was super friendly and attentive and the fondue was just fabulous! Price point is perfect as well. And they do half off bottles of wine on Wednesday's! The place is a little small so if you're going around the dinner hour I recommend making a reservation!
author: D. L.

description:
I stopped in around 6ish recently, and we had our choice of tables! It was pretty empty for a Thursday. We tried to Outlaw fondue (their Southwest flavored one with jalapeño.) It came with two plates of sides including pickles, veggies, potatoes, olives, and bread. The fondue pots look small, but they're actually pretty filling once you add in all of the sides.

Also, as of this year, their happy hour is JUST half off wine and beer, not fondue. So disregard the previous Yelp reviews. 

Lovely atmosphere: the Yelp photos don't do it justice.
author: Margs K.

description:
This is definitely a good place for fondue. Prices are high and portions are small. We got the Traditional and the Desperado. The offerings for things to dip were delicious! They had a tasty crispy bread and pickles!

The portion size is ridiculously small. I thought it was a practical joke. They were serious. 

Overall, good meal but wouldn't do it again.
author: Akshaya V.

description:
More people need to know about the HH here 530-630 daily

Honestly, I would never have entered except for some reason there was traffic at 6pm on a Saturday in Folsom so we pulled over and parked. Salvation! A happy hour sign. We ordered 2 glasses of wine (half off) and a charcuterie plate that came with melon which was a nice change from the random pickled veggies we usually get! 

We didn't do it, but the couple near us shared a chocolate fondue dessert and it was cute. Two mules for sister Sara playing on the TVs, for what that's worth.
author: Elaine L.

description: Good place for fondue, with a cute vibe. Not a big place at all, so make sure you make reservations. We did happen to make reservations, so we were seated right away. We got the mixed greens salad, the Outlaw cheese, and the High noon chocolate fondue. We also got the side of meatballs for the Outlaw cheese. Everything was good. The portions aren't too big, so if you come with big appetites you might want to double up. No really, just double up. For what you get, for the price? Ehhhhh. Very ehh. 3 stars.
author: Carina R.

description:
Awesome place. Very very nice staff, terrific fondue. Small and intimate, would be a great date place. I was so pleased with the food and fun kitchy atmosphere. 

Had the beet salad (which I shared). Really fresh greens and wonderful vinegrette dressing. The others had the mixed green with pear. It was terrific! 

5 of us shared two of the fondues. Traditional and the western cheddar. We added the meat plate and meat balls. Everything was fresh and very tasty. 

We also shared the Dark chocolate desert fondue and milk chocolate. We really enjoyed all of it!

PS. Wine based cocktails were yummy especially the Monitor!
author: Stu S.

description: Do you like fondue? Do you like western flicks? Do you love gimmicks for the sake of a trendy hipster spot? Well, here's the place for you. The decor is nice but dim and the servers are accomodating and friendly. The cheeses come with bread, potatoes, green apple, grapes, raw broccoli, cornichons pickles, and olives! The dessert fondue come with chocolate bread pieces, a few marshmallows, madelines, strawberries, banana, kiwi, and pineapple! I could do with just the chocolate to be honest!!
author: Stephanie R.

description:
Been here well over 15 times in the year and a half living in SF. 
The Outlaw. The Cured Meats Plate. The Goods.

Best fondue I've had, even in comparison to LaFondue in Los Gatos and $80 in cheese homemade fondue. 

Atmosphere is awesome, and Sheila is wonderful.
author: Kimberly H.

description:
I have a complicated relationship with food.  Those who know me know I have a LOT of food allergies, and this often impedes my ability to fully enjoy and appreciate certain cuisine.  This restaurant is a hard place for someone like me to eat:  between the raw fruits and veggies and the fact that there's garlic in EVERY fondue (unless you order it without, which they can do!), it's one culinary hazard after another!

I'll be honest with you:  Fondue isn't my thing, at least not as a main course.  I would've never sought out this restaurant on my own, but came here as part of a large group for a close friend's birthday.  So please take what I have to say about the cheese fondue with a grain of salt.

I found the cheese fondue here to be incredibly bland, probably because it was garlic-free.  My partner and I split two different fondues:

First we tried The Traditional ($18, Swiss Gruyere, Ementhaller, White Wine, Roasted Garlic (which was left out for us), Fresh Ground Nutmeg).  Gruyere is my favorite cheese and I LOVE nutmeg in my creamy/cheesy sauces, so this seemed like it should be a no-brainer for me...but I found it intensely bland.  And of the items that were available to dip in it, the only two items that I a) wasn 't allergic to, or b) didn't hate (gerkins, olives) wound up being raw broccoli and bland pieces of bread (my partner tried the roasted potatoes that came with it as well, but I couldn't eat these because they, too, were cooked in garlic oil).

The second cheese fondue we tried was The Rawhide ($18;  Italian Dolce Gorgonzola, Emmenthaler, White Wine, Bacon, Roasted Garlic (which was left out for us)).  While both of us agreed that this was the better of the two fondues we ordered, it still didn't have tons of flavor and seemed to be overwhelmed by the Emmenthaler...in fact, it didn't taste too terribly different from the first fondue we tried.  It was vastly improved, though, by adding copious amounts of salt...!

Dessert was a huge hit for me:  We ordered the Happy Trails ($16; Dark Chocolate with Cayenne).  At my request, they left out the cayenne, since I am not a fan of pepper, and only brought us grapes and bananas for the fruit (I'm allergic to their other fruit offerings).  My favorite things to dip into the delicious chocolate turned out to be the chocolate bread (!!!!) and madeleines...very tasty!!!

So if I was generally underwhelmed by 2/3 of my dinner, why am I giving this place 4 stars?  The service was AWESOME.  They were attentive, responsive, polite, and friendly.  They catered to my special requests without batting an eyelash.  The food arrived in a timely fashion, the mixed drinks we ordered were delicious and well-balanced, and the ambiance was warm, inviting, and cozy.  It was a relatively quiet restaurant, which was really nice for conversation with my friends, and the seats were super-comfortable, especially for a big-butted woman like me.  

It's not Fondue Cowboy's fault that I'm not really into fondue...and if someone invited me to go here with them for dinner sometime, I wouldn't hesitate to say yes.  After all, a restaurant is more than just the food:  it's about the experience, which I'd say is a good one here.
author: Amy L.

description:
The farthest thing on my mind was associating a European dish with cowboys. But I love Fondue so I definitely wanted to check out Fondue Cowboy. Love the simple concept of this restaurant, a hip little place in Soma which manages to bring a modern angle to this traditional cuisine.

Old John Wayne cowboy movies on a big screen TV behind the bar is about the only thing cowboy about this place, The cheese fondue selection is surprisingly diverse distinctive Western names of savory fondue like Outlaw, Stage Coach, Rawhide & Desperado.

A variety of dipping items for the fondue are a diverse and crunchy selection of  baguette squares, roasted fingerling potato, broccoli florets, black grapes, black olives,  green apples and pickles. I don't eat pickles but I love eating these pickles and dipping it into the different fondue.

Love how the fondue is served in these cute colorful cast-iron chafing pots over a hot blue flame that keeps the wonderful melted cheese bubbling and warm.  These are my favorites:

The Traditional~ $24 a sharp, rich nutty pool of Swiss-only cheeses (Gruyère and Emmental), white wine and nutmeg

Outlaw ~ $24 robust mix of cheddar, beer, roasted tomatoes, garlic, jalapeño and cilantro

Rawhide ~ $24 Italian Dolce Gorgonzola and Emmenthaler gives it a nice kick, White Wine, Bacon, Roasted Garlic

And if you think you have already been treated to a decadent meal it hasn't ended yet.  You have a choice of sweet sinful treats ~ $20 like  Happy Trails which is Dark Chocolate with Cayenne, the Buck-A-Roo ~Milk Chocolate and High Noon ~White Chocolate.  All are tempting but I have never had space for dessert.  So I must come in one day just for the sweet fondue.  They also have salads but I can eat a salad anywhere so I want to reserve all the space to stuff myself with  rich warm gooey melted cheese!

Great place for conversation and connection. The fondue is generous ~ good for two, imaginative and delicious, with something for everyone. Been here many times and have brought friends here to enjoy Fondue Cowboy just as much as I do! A solid four stars!
author: Maria M.

description:
Finally made it in to this place.
The atmosphere is cool - they did a good job with the western theme without going overboard.
Our server was absolutely great - she struck that perfect balance between perfectly attentive but never hovering.
And the food was delicious. The fondue was flavorful and a perfect texture. A good portion to share for two (but if you were really hungry you could eat one yourself). And the dippers were all really good.
author: Michail Y.

description:
Pros:
good selection of different types of fondue
amazing sides for dipping - the potatoes, olives and crispy bread were my favorite!
ambience - cozy place, great for a date night

Cons:
limited options outside of fondue, especially for vegetarians
pricey compared to the quantity of food given
 
I had a pleasant meal but I would only go back if I was really craving fondue
author: Shree K.

description:
Fondue Cowboy is a cute, small fondue spot in SOMA! Beware, it's a very small restaurant so I would recommend reservations even on weekdays just to be safe! They only have beer and wine, but they play that to their advantage by making wine cocktails. I had their wine mojito and it was surprisingly very good!

To eat, we ordered the stage coach to share between the two of us. The pot of cheese fondue comes with some veggie dippers, bread, and potatoes. You can add on an extra meat plate for a more filling meal if you want. Fondue is always a fun meal and I did enjoy the cheese as well as the dippers that came with it. Towards the end, the cheese started to get a little strong for my liking but overall, if you like mushrooms, I would recommend the stage coach!

Unfortunately we did not have enough space for the dessert fondue but we will be back for that! All of them sounded absolutely delicious (my only problem with them was they were slightly expensive especially if you're not too hungry at the end of your meal). I wish they had half chocolate fondues if you're just looking to get a taste instead of a large, hearty dessert! 

For portion sizes, I would say that 1 cheese fondue is enough for two people if you're not too hungry. If you're hungry, I would definitely recommend ordering a meat plate or getting a dessert fondue as well!
author: Malika R.

description:
A group of 5 of us celebrating a birthday.  First time trying the restaurant and we were happy we did.  The service and ambiance was great!  Paul, the person who answered the phone, server, bartender was a delight to meet.  He was so patient, nice, funny and just very hospitable.  The fondue cheese we chose was the Manchego and Gouda.  Both were delicious.  We added the sliced meats to accompany the cubed bread, potatoes, olives, pickles, broccoli, apples and melons for dipping.  We later added the meatballs which were good but nothing special.  The sliced Italian meats is a must.
Then we ended with the dessert of milk chocolate and walnuts fondue.  It included assorted kiwi, strawberries, bananas, pineapples, cubed bread and a few Madelines.  The chocolate was good but I would have preferred a little more selection of items to dip like pound cake, Rice Krispies more Madeline's.  The bread was a little stale and to me it didn't make sense for dessert.  I wish the fruits were cut a little bigger and more of it.  But at the end it was a fun experience and I would definitely return again!
author: Karen S.

description: This place was great! Service was friendly and attentive, they have happy hour and the portions were perfect. I went with my boyfriend and we shared one fondue (stage coach, super yummy) plus a cured meat plate. It looks like a snack but believe me it fills you up! All the sides that come with the fondue are a great addition to the cheese. We were too stuffed for dessert but will definitely be going back!
author: Shawn H.

description: It's 2017, People. Why are we eating fondue? The 70s are over. Like disco and the pet rock, fondue is over.
author: Ivan L.

description:
*Great experience, nice location, simple but delicious menu, knowledgable staff*

Made a reservation on yelp, although there were plenty of tables on a Wednesday.  None the less, the staff new me by name and followed up on the reservation.  Really felt like home.

Open kitchen, visible to patrons.  Extremely clean and well kept.  

Ordered:
Goat cheese fondue (with Apple juice instead of white wine)
Rich but delicious.  Served with: pickles, apples, grapes, brocolli, 2 kinds of bread, olives
Half milk/Half semisweet chocolate dessert fondue with madalines, chocolate cake, kiwi, strawberries and maybe some other things...

Highly recommend, I'll be coming back.
author: Rimi K.

description:
I live very close to this place and for some reason never went, I think the theme (cowboy / western) just seemed so odd to me that I never considered going.  Well after living on the same block for 1.5 years, I finally went and it was actually great!
The fondue (we got RawHide) was delicious.  It was a small, as some people mentioned, but for 2 people I thought it was perfect.  On 'Wild West Wednesdays' bottles of wine are half off, so that was also great.  Beer & wine is also half off during happy hour, which unfortunately ends at 630 but still nice if you can make it.
Overall good experience and I will definitely be back!
author: Rachel M.

description:
It's just great.  They give you everything to dip in your choice of cheese fondue.  If you like fondue you will love Fondue Cowboy.  The only downside to it might be the cost.  It's $28 for fondue for two, which is actually pretty reasonable when you see all the things you get.  Prices go up when you add meat and drinks.  So for vegetarians like myself, it's a nice and fun dinner.  I love the Outlaw fondue.  Very flavorful with a nice kick to it.  But if I wanted meat I'd have to pay an extra $13 which feels like a lot.  Thankfully I don't want meat!

But they've got speedy, kind service with great food.  It's easy to make a reservation, even at the last minute.  It's a great dinner for before or after a movie (as it's not far from theaters) or you could grab a drink at another bar if you prefer.  They have some good drinks at Fondue Cowboy, though, from the look of it.  I haven't had any alcohol there but the pomegranate margarita looks awesome.

Anyway, I'm mostly trying to fill out this review so it's got some meat in it but I don't have much to say.  If you like fondue you should go.  If you don't like fondue, probably not (but then why are you looking at reviews of a fondue restaurant??).  It's not complicated.  It's just great fondue.  Treat yourself.
author: Adam D.

description:
Shared a traditional and buckaroo. 

Traditional was really nice, great balance of flavors. You can taste the wine and spices, but they don't overpower the cheese. All the dipping ingredients were very fresh and well thought out. Vegetarian friendly less you order a meat plate.

Buckaroo was good too but nothing to write home about, not sure which chocolate they use but it seems closer to Hershey's than TCHO, lacked depth. 

Came out to about $60 and we were pleasantly full, not cheap but the experience and ambiance make it feel well worth it. Service was super friendly and attentive. Pretty busy on a Thursday evening, I'd suggest making reservations. 

Good stuff, we'll be back!
author: Holden C.

description: Food was great!  Service was excellent. The kids enjoyed the chocolate fondue, however, there was not enough chocolate for the amount of food they provide for dipping.
author: Mita I.

description: Awesome food. Amazing owners. Such a great date night here.
author: Michelle L.

description:
Oh fondue me good, cowboy! ;)

Haha finally knocked out this bookmark from my list. We had the Outlaw and the Buckaroo. 

The Outlaw was good. The Cheese was tasty. For the dipper- they had potatoes, olives, bread, grapes, and pickles. My faves were def the grapes & bread. Least fave would be the olives since I don't like olives.

The Buckaroo was milk chocolate w/ walnuts. The dippers were madeleines, brownies, strawberries, bananas, pineapple, kiwi, and sugar coated marshmallow. Faves would be the strawberries, bananas, & brownies. 

Pretty yummy dining experience w/ my sweet guy. :)

This place is definitely a good one for a date night or chill spot for a couple of friends.
author: Amy C.

description: First try for us from LA, great concept, food and drinks wonderful. Very small place so make reservations. Had the cheddar fondue and white chocolate for desert. Shelia was our server, very friendly and attentive. Definitely recommend it!
author: Bruce M.

description:
I took my boyfriend here for their happy hour. During usual hours, a serving of fondue for two is $25, but during happy hour, everything is half off.

Their menu has a selection of savory and sweet fondue paired with an assortment of beer and wine. 

We decided to order the Rawhide fondue, Louisiana hotlinks, and a glass of Grenache wine. 

The fondue, topped with bacon bits, was served in a small ceramic bowl the size half a mug. We initially thought it was quite small, but it ended up being just the right amount of cheese for two people. The Rawhide was Dolce Gorgonzola with white wine and roasted garlic. It tasted a bit bitter, but overall, delicious. The fondue was served with cubed pieces of bread, pickles, olives, grapes and green apple. I was particularly fond of dipping the bread, and eating all the other sides by itself.

The hotlink was also a great addition. It was juicy and hot and perfect to dip in the cheese. The additional protein was also greatly appreciated. 

The Grenache wine was our least favorite. It was not smooth and did not pair with the meal very well. The saltiness of the cheese and hotlinks required gulps of water anyway.
author: Linda P.

description:
Everything from start to finish was a great experience.

I was able to easily make a reservation for 2 and got a good idea of what to expect from fellow Yelpers.

We ended up with the Outlaw and found it was plenty for 2 people.  We found the portions to be plentiful.  We were asked if we would like any additional dippers about halfway through our meal.  We ended up getting dessert as well and got the white chocolate option.  White chocolate isn't my favorite, but it is my husband's so I was willing to compromise...this time, haha.  We were pleasantly surprised to taste mint in the marshmallows!  We were offered additional dippers for dessert and happily accepted some more of the tasty marshmallows.  The brownies definitely have more of a bread consistency.  The fruit was really fresh and they were sure to ask if there were any allergies (sadly, there are) to be aware of, which I appreciated.

On the beverage front, we ordered some local beers and the cherry lime italian soda.  All were tasty and didn't break the bank.  

The service is great and this little place is cozy but offered everyone plenty of space.  They don't try to pack you in and you're not put in another table's conversations because you're so close together.  The bathroom is really clean, too!  

This is a super fun place for a group or a couple.  I wouldn't hesitate to come back!
author: Lauren R.

description: Soooo I surprised my boyfriend to this place for Valentine's Day (he is a fondue virgin but I am a fondue snob and have been to several other fondue places) and we did the dinner for 2 for $100, which consisted of cheese fondue with tons of different toppers, (the potatoes- to die for) a salad for each, and the chocolate fondue with more amazing toppers. oh my gosh. So. Worth. Every. Penny. And what I liked about this place honestly is that they bring everything out already made and ready (not like melting pot and simply fondue where you cook everything yourself) I feel like it was so easy, delicious, and romantic. It's a perfect vibe for a night out that's for sure. And of course the western theme is just so charming. Also it's a pretty small place- not crowded by any means but small- you won't be forgotten about (: oh but fair warning it's hard to leave because you will be so insanely full from gorging yourself with chocolate. I will drive the 45 mins to the city just for this place!! So great. Oh and the service was amaZing also. We showed up starving and left so full we could barely move! Such a great experience.
author: Courtney P.

description:
Fondue Cowboy is a cozy, western-themed fondue (obvi) restaurant.  There are not many tables, although there is additional seating at the bar.  We had a reservation & were seated immediately. With such limited seating, I strongly suggest making a reservation.  
We were greeted & seated by our super friendly waitress.  We enjoyed a nice but very reasonable bottle of wine, then started with a large roasted beet arugula salad. The salad wasn't bad but someone in our group accurately described it as "unremarkable."  I'd go with the Roasted Pear Gorgonzola instead. The two savory fondues the group decided upon were the Traditional and the Lonestar, both delicious! The fondues are served with little potatoes, chunks of bread, grapes, tiny pickles, fresh broccoli and apple chunks for dipping.  Our server graciously brought us extra "dippers"  to finish our fondues.  For dessert, the Happy Trails fondue was outstanding.  It's a dark chocolate with a little bit of cayenne served with chocolate bread, banana slices, strawberries & kiwi pieces - OMG so good! 
So we had four adults & one very tall, very hungry teenager. We all were completely satisfied with the large salad, two savory fondues, one order of meatballs and the Happy Trails fondue for dessert.  What a fun & tasty dinner!
author: Kel E. B.

description: Oh this place was so wonderful.  Artisan cheeses, great atmosphere, wonderful service...not a single complaint.
author: Jennifer Q.

description:
I was intrigued by the name alone. Cowboy themed stuff...love! Hot cheese in a pot....shit yes I'm in!! Chose this spot for my birthday because I thought it'd be fun and different (yes my idea of fun is exchanging germs with my friends because I'm sure we totally double dipped and cross contaminated at some point). It's really small and easy to miss. I only noticed it because I see it every damn day on my way to school right across the street, SF Institute of Esthetics & Cosmetology (I'm an esthie student and currently taking appointments for waxing and facials til January...get at me!).

The bill was a lot but no sweat off my sack because I wasn't paying since it was my birthday...so sweat on everyone else's. I think it was $50 per person...for some damn cheese but we all had a great time.

The menu is concise but there's something to please everyone but then again I am easy to cheese.
author: Tatiana D.

description:
I came here yesterday with a group of friends and we ordered four different fondues between five people, three savory and one sweet. Of the savory ones, my favorite one was the outlaw, which had cheddar, beer, tomatoes, garlic, jalapeño, and cilantro. One thing to note, is that in any of the fondues, you can request that they withhold an ingredient if you don't like it, such as jalapeños. I'm not a fondue connoisseur, but I could certainly taste the difference between each of the fondues, so if you can, I would recommend going with a group of friends so you can try more than one.  

When the fondue arrived at our table, I was a bit shocked by how small the portion was. However, you'll be pleasantly surprised at how long you can dip into the pot before you even make a dent in it. By the end of the meal, I was stuffed. Feel free to ask for extra bread, or any of the dippers if you're running low during your meal. The only dipper I imagine they would say no to would be the kielbasa which you have to order separately. 

We came with a reservation, but I would say it's not necessary given that during our entire meal, it was only our party and another party in the restaurant. I would come back again.
author: Austin W.

description:
I'm from Wisconsin.....so I'm naturally completely obsessed with CHEESE!!!!  Fondue restaurants are very special to my heart.

We popped in for a late dinner around 8:45 pm on a Thursday.  There was one other couple finishing up a dessert fondue, but besides that it was EMPTY.  We could tell the staff was pretty much done for the night and we were therefore a bit rushed through our dining experience.  (I just checked the website and observed that they close at 10pm on weekdays, so shame on us for not coming in earlier) 

Fondue Cowboy is a darling little whipper snapper of a place.  The the western theme interior decor is tastefully done.  The theme is carried onto the menu....

We split a carafe of wine from the wine tap and a salad to start.  The small salads are a pretty good size and enough for 2 people to split.  Our table of two went with the state coach savory fondue as our main.  I was really impressed with the variety of items that came with the delicious fondue. Plates were filled with bread, pickles, olives, apples, and roasted fingerling potatoes.  It was surprisingly filling!  

After about 45 minutes after sitting down the small staff started to call it quits-- a line cook took the trash out (through the dining room), another cook left for the night, and a manager sat at the bar and counted receipts and cash.  Nonetheless, our server did not shortchange our service.  

I really want to go back and experience a fondue dinner or happy hour without the feeling of being rushed-- the food was excellent and our server was so friendly.
author: Andrea H.

description:
Disappointed.

Pros:
-good service
-beer choices
-cute place, but small
-good for vegetarians!
-loved the pickles on the plate for dipping

Cons:
-cheese was eh
-barely give you any cheese - lots of leftover things to dip, and no cheese. We scraped the crap out of the cheese bowl. I even made a comment when they brought it out - wait...will we be able to get more cheese?
-nothing traditional here, there's a cheese course (but no broth or meat). If you want meat, you have to do sausage. 
-left hungry

We didn't order dessert, and instead walked down to zero zero and sat at the bar and enjoyed dessert. Super underwhelmed. My brother commented it was like if we tried to do fondue at home, and didn't know what we were doing.
author: Amy O.

description: This was such a fun experience! My friend and boyfriend and I stumbled upon this place before 1015 Folsom. We had some great beer, sangria, and conversation at the bar. And then we saw the fondue platter come out that our neighbors ordered and we were sold! There were fluffy bread cubes, garlic butter toasted crostinis, fingerling potatoes, green apples, broccoli, mini pickles, olives, and grapes to dip in the candle heated pot of stretchy cheese fondue. And we ordered a cured meats plate that had prosciutto, Serrano ham, and some kind of giant salami that came with honeydew and cantaloupe! Good times
author: Elise G.

description:
Came here for a birthday party. The staff was friendly and patient with our big group. I thought the fondue was really tasty. The Outlaw was one of the favorites. We also ordered all the chocolate fondues which made everyone happy (my fav was the dark chocolate with Cayenne). Sangria was a favorite, though they don't have a full bar. 

Definitely a great group spot. Easy to share and not super crowded!
author: Nikki M.

description: I really like this spot. The seating is  super comfortable & I love the western vibe. Heeehawwww! I had the lone star with the meat platter. Lots of food. Wonderful flavor. It came with bread, pickles, black olives, broccoli & potatoes! I'm looking forward to coming back and trying dessert and another cheese fondue plus a bottle of wine! They have a great selection.
author: Madeleine V.

description:
Make a reservation, unless there will not be room for you. My one gripe: There were no actual cowboys at this fondue restaurant. This made me sad. Oh, so sad. Not a single cowboy hat in site. I would have to call that a little bit of false advertising on their end. Le sigh...

What could I have done with?  A little bit more of variation in what was offered as dippers for the different fondues. Serving up the same things with the different fondues makes it a bit dull. However, everything was tasty, so one can not complain *too* much. 

Except for the lack of cowboys. Tsk Tsk.
author: Danielle L.

description: We throughly enjoyed our dinner and the service was superb! Can't wait for our next visit!
author: Robin M.

description:
I find myself going here again and again because my boyfriend and I always want to show off this neighborhood gem to new groups of friends. 

Making a reservation at peak times is important, but they have worked miracles for me when we forgot to do so with just an hour or two's notice. 

The food is so yummy! I especially like the traditional, which might sound boring, but is DELICIOUS, and the cured meat plate. They make each pot of fondue to order and fresh, so it's not instant like you might think it would be it they had big old vats of it in the back, but is worth a little bit of a wait. 

Last but not least, the service is really what keeps us coming back more than anything. Good service, good food - we're really happy customers.
author: Shushannah A.

description: I came here for the first time for a date night with my boyfriend. I'm amazed by the taste of their fondue. We ordered a Stage Coach fondue and a High Noon fondue. The Stage Coach came with breads, roasted potatoes, broccoli, olives, cucumbers, grapes, and apples. The High Noon came with fruits, pieces, marshmallow, and chocolates cakes. They're so yummy! The service there is wonderful as well. Definitely come back next time!
author: May N.

description:
My friend and I came here around 5:30 PM on a Friday night and there were enough tables filled where we didn't feel like this was a deserted establishment. My apologies for judging the exterior. 

We took a while to order since everything looked so promising!
We ended up choosing the outlaw savory fondue. 
As soon as our order came, we grinned at each other and were ready to unbuckle our belts.
From the grapes to the salted meats to the little bread pieces to the actual cheese fondue, everything looked and tasted great! This order would have been great even if we shared with one more person. We left with our bellies satisfied. 

I'd say this is the perfect environment to come chill with a small group of friends or have a unique date night with your significant other at night.
author: Jane S.

description:
Awesome little gem in a relatively quiet part of Folsom St.  I went here to attend a private party and thoroughly enjoyed my experience here.  The staff was very friendly and prompt.  Their recommendations were spot on too - great drinks and delicious food.  Because this was a private party, I was able to sample a couple different fondues.  My favorite savory fondue was the Rawhide.  The gorgonzola paired excellently with the bacon and gave depth to the ingredients I dipped into it.  As for the dessert fondues, the High Noon, with its white chocolate and balsamic strawberry puree, was the clear winner in my book.  I was also able to sample some sides too, favoring the mini meatballs and the cured meat plate.

I drank a mojito and followed that with glass of prosecco.  I regret not trying their sangria, though.  My friends who tried it really enjoyed it.  Next time!  With a great atmosphere, superb service and delicious food, I'm 100% sure I'll be back here more than once.
author: Eileen P.

description: This place was so much more than we were expecting! Did a group team dinner here and everything was perfect! Waitstaff (i.e. Paul) was fantastic!! Experience was so perfect and food was excellent! Can't wait to make this our go to team dinner spot!
author: Megan B.

description:
I've fondued before, but this was my first time fonduing at a fondue only restaurant.  It was the Mr.'s first time too, so it was fun that we fondid it together along with two of our good friends.  It wasn't awkward at all.

Between the four of us we ordered thusly:

Stage Coach - my favorite because I love Jarlsburg
Desperado - didn't taste too much of the goat cheese
Cured meat plate - came with melons; reminded me of Europe :)
Sausage plate - Louisiana hot links, yum

The fondues were yummy.  It's hard to go wrong with bowls of melted cheese, but the masterful pairings of the cheeses with the other added ingredients was what took it to the next level.  I would've ate the fondue by the spoonful, except the table setting didn't included spoons--perhaps to protect impulsive individuals like myself from cheese overload.  Each order of fondue came with bread, potatoes, Gherkins, broccoli, grapes, and apples.

We ended our meal with the Buck-A-Roo--milk chocolate fondue with walnuts.  Into the delicious melted chocolate goodness, we dipped various fruits, chocolate bread, marshmallows and madeleines.  

Everything tasted great and we left full to the gills.  They'll give you more dipping items and we asked for extras for both the cheese and chocolate fondues!    

The western theme decor and ambiance was really cool; the old black and white western movie playing on silent behind the bar was a nice touch too.  All in all, great fondue experience.  I would definitely come again, but probably to their happy hour as it can get pretty pricy.  It was $144 before tip for 4 people.
author: Thi D.

description: It's an American style French/ Swiss place. Place is dimly lit, ambiance is rustic modern. Has a nice bar. They've got an excellent selection of cheeses. This place would be great for groups. You get to dip into sweet & savory fondue.  For the savory type of Fondue we tried the Rawhide (Italian Dolce Gorgonzola, Emmenthaler, White Wine, Bacon, Roasted Garlic) & the Desperado (Goat Cheese, Emmenthaler, White Wine, Roasted Garlic, Olive) and for the sweets we had the Buck-A-Roo(Milk Chocolate with Walnuts) & the High Noon (White Chocolate with Balsamic Strawberry Puree) We were a party of 4 and we were dipping into our fondues till our hearts delight. I keep coming back to this place coz its sooooo good. Quite pricey though, each order costs about $25-$28 dollars. They say if you come during happy hour you get cocktails and a fondue plate for about $20++. Haven't been to Happy hour but next time will round up the group earlier. They also serve meat plates and salads.
author: Tina M.

description:
Best fondue in the Bay Area.

Happy hour here is a great deal. 1/2 price fondue plus drink specials when you sit at the bar. If you haven't been here, you are missing out!

This is great spot after a Giants win (or loss).
author: David P.

description: Came here for my birthday dinner last night and was very impressed. The wait staff was incredibly attentive to my strawberry allergy and constantly (but not in an annoying way) checked in on us. The food is amazing, the drinks are great, the atmosphere is swanky, and the music isn't too loud where you can't have a conversation. Would strongly recommend.
author: Tommy C.

description:
We finally fondid it for the first time a couple of weeks ago and we did it cowgirl style (whenever I dipped an item, she would dip another on top of mine).  

Our previous respective fondue experiences never really counted as they weren't at a restaurant solely focused on fondue. I don't know why either of us never fondid it all the way before, but I guess we were both just waiting for the right person to fondue it with.  

I always knew there was something different about this girl, however, especially when she asked if another couple could join us.  

An orgy of indulgent consumption subsequently ensued.  

Delicious melted jarlsburg and goat cheeses dripped from the bread like hot wax from a burning candle. Us guys also requested an order of the cured meat plate because it came with melons. The ladies ordered the sausage plate, naturally.  

For a sweet ending we finished by doing a Buck-A-Roo (sounds simple but not a beginner move by any means as it required a lot of flexibility . . . on the part of our stomachs). 

I can't wait to fondue it again!
author: Erich D.

description:
Fondue was good but very small portions compared to the amount of stuff they give you to dip in. 
I really wanted to enjoy the night with my three girlfriends but man, the service was horrible. We were misled by the guy and kept thinking one of their sparkling wines was on happy hour. We kept asking about happy hour drinks and kept ordering the same wine and only at the end of the happy hour the waiter goes "Just so you know, the Sparkling rose is not on happy hour". I wish he had stopped me at the second glass, which I ordered right before 6.30pm. And my girls followed me and ordered the same...
Not only that, but they basically kicked us out after 2 hours! Seriously. The experience was overall poor and we will not go back.
author: Angela G.

description:
Made a reservation for my parents and I to come here on a Saturday night. I'm familiar with the fondue chain restaurants and I was worried this place would be packed at dinner time on weekend. 

Parking was a monster, but when is it not in San Francisco?

The place is full of ambience. Very hipster, western vibe with black and white movies playing and a rustic feel. Immediately loved it, especially because it wasn't packed with people and we didn't have to wait for our table. 

My dad came along and he's a very "meat and potatoes" kind of man. Wasn't into it at first, but definitely changed his mind by the end. 5 stars because they actually serve meat and potatoes...

We started out with the mixed green salad (large) and it fed three of us happily. That salad was the absolute bomb. Probably one of my new all time favs. We ordered the "rawhide" cheese dip and an extra plate of beef on the side. Holy crap, that was freaking delish. We rounded it off with one pot of milk chocolate and walnuts and a very happy mom, dad, and Kim. 

Highly recommend. Great waiter. Great ambience. Phenomenal food. Overall quality experience.
author: Kimmy B.

description:
UMMMMMM I'm in YUMMMMMMMMMMMMM. CHEESE ME PLEASE! Fondue Cowboy, I'll be your cowgirl! I love this place. Must revisit. I ate here about a year ago, with my brother... we both LOVE CHEESE.

We were like two mice, dunking lots of goodies in their bowls of warmed up cheese mixes. They have chocolate fondues too... but I try my hardest to stay away from sugar. Here, every type of eater is welcomed and adored. Vegan, Vegetarian, Omnivore, Carnivore... or make up your own 'vore' are all welcomed, with their array of choices.

It's so fun to eat here... I feel like a cave woman who's about to dip my choices into a pot of warmed up mixed cheeses. Hannah like cheese, so hannah place stuff into fire pot of other stuff. Hannah tummy likey so much. Good feeling. What's this? Ah, a stick to poke into stuff. Neat. O.

So which is it Hannah... cowgirl or cavewoman? WHO GIVES A FLYING BEEP... CHEEESESSSSS GALORE!
author: Hannah Y.

description: The fondue experience without having to clean the fondue pot - excellent. Fondue Cowboy is a great small spot in SOMA to enjoy fondue on their large couches. We tried the beer based fondue because we were told it was most popular, and it was delicious and did not have an overbearing taste of beer. The fondue came with bread, potatoes, melon, pickles, olives, and broccoli to dip. And dippers were not limited. We then decided to go for the dessert fondue and got a dark chocolate fondue, which came with chocolate bread (yum!), madeline cookies, and fruit. Overall, great fondue spot.
author: Nikita K.

description: Good service, friendly staff, comfortable atmosphere, and most importantly fantstic fondues.  What more can you ask for.  Do yourself a favor and give them a try.
author: Robert H.

description: This place is quite a gem.  The fondue base was excellent.  Good side dish choices for dipping and all ingredients high quality and fresh, with relatively inexpensive prices.  Services very friendly and attentive.  Place is clean and uniquely decorated.  Walking distance to downtown offices and on week nights, parking easy to find nearby as well.  Definitely highly recommended.
author: Adrian H.

description:
Quality of the cheese fondues were there. They give a lot of accompaniments with it - bread, crostinis, potatoes, broccoli, apples, grapes, olives, and pickles. 

Ordered 2 cheese fondues (The Stage Coach and another one with goat cheese in it) and a sausage plate. Everything was delicious, but for what it's worth, it's really pricey ($24 for each fondue + $9 for sasauge). Drinks were $8-10 too, so everything definitely adds up. There were three of us & we could barely finish both fondues. The accompaniments really fill you up & are super heavy.

I'm glad I had a deal to save some money. I would probably go back, but next time just order one fondue. And honestly, Melting Pot is just as good, but a lot cheaper ($16 for one fondue, $8 during happy hour).
author: Alysha K.

description:
I love it here! It's really delicious and it's such a fun idea.

Savory cheese fondue: usually comes with bread, potatoes, broccoli, grapes, green apple, cornichons (little pickles), and olives. 

I've tried the traditional, stage coach and the quick draw. All VERY good. My favorite: the stage coach (jarlsberg cheese, white wine, sauteed mushrooms, and roasted garlic). $25

Sweet fondues usually come with chocolate bread, marshmallows, pineapple, banana, strawberries, kiwi. I've only tried the happy trails (dark chocolate w/ cayenne) $20

Salads are good too. Sometimes they offer a grilled beef plate to go with your fondue -- so delicious! I've also tried the cured meat plate and that was good too but I'd go with the grilled beef. I haven't tried the sausage but I'll try that next time. The salads are also very delicious! 

Drinks aren't too memorable. Fun place to go with friends or on a date if you'd prefer. Heck, even with your family. If you're in a larger group, make sure to make reservations. It can get packed.
author: Natalie M.

description: Great experience. The outlaw is my favorite. The portions that they give are very generous! The spicy sausage was amazing too! The desert was very good as well. Would come back again soon
author: Raj K.

description:
Had a reservation here with my family just for kicks and it was a pleasant dining experience! The servers are all friendly and helpful when we were unsure with what to go with. 

We tried a chocolate fondue and white chocolate fondue with fruit, marshmallows, etc. YUM! Cool place to bring a date or celebrate a special occasion. It has an intimate ambience.
author: Nicki F.

description:
I had extremely high hopes for this place but came out severely disappointed. The quality of food was passable nothing great. The fondue itself tasted like it was made from budget Safeway cheese and really lacked flavor and potency. It it was bland you could not taste any of the wine.


But what really shocked me was the size of the portions. Each fondue is approximately $30.  I was expecting a little bit more than half a pound of mediocre cheese barely melted in a tiny, little, ramekin. I would be embarrassed to serve even desert in those tiny ramekins.

Overall quality of food was mediocre but it's absurd that we paid $30 for those tiny little cups of melted cheese.
author: Paul B.

description:
Love this place! Have been a few times and it's always great. Delicious fondue, they're super friendly and attentive, and cool theme/atmosphere. 

Stagecoach + happy trails = winning combo!
author: Caroline B.

description: Intimate ambiance and fun experience. The High Noon- white chocolate with balsamic strawberry puree was delicious.
author: Sarina A.

description:
Last night I attended a small GrubWithUs event, our reservation was for 7:30 and when I walked in at 7:15 I was taken aback by the small intimate feel of this place. 

The decor is soft, with soft but bright lighting, it was a cute style with hues of brown everywhere. Over the bar there is a flat screen TV, playing was very cold Cowboy movies, this was a great conversation starter for a group of strangers eating together!

Being the table snob that I am, I would like to dedicate this information to the wonderful layout of this place. It is small and only has 6 to 8 tables plus seats at the bar, but the tables are NOT squished together. I must commend the owners of this place for not trying to us every single inch of space they have for tables. 

Our food started to arrive and we were given to salads, one was the bean the other just a basic green salad, they even offered to toss the meat on the side since we had a veggie among us. The salads were good, the bean salad was my favorite because of the rich flavour of the beans and veggies, the other salad was lackluster and had little flavor. 

First round of Fondue hit the table, the Traditional and the Outlaw. There was a wonderful array of veggies, bread and fruit to dip into the wonderful gooy cheese. It was interesting see they were lit with a candle, at first I was unsure, but this candle kept the cheese nice and melty down to the very last drop. 

Second ground of Fondue, dessert! White Chocolate w/ Strawberry vinaigrette and Dark Chocolate with Cayenne Pepper. Two very distinct flavours. They were both WONDERFUL, I loved dipping the chocolate bread in the White Chocolate fondue.. Y.U.M

Minus one star because their Sangria is not that great. I wasn't sure what to expect seeing as it isn't a latin place, but even for an American joint it wasn't to die for. It was wine with mulled fruit yes, but they added A LOT of ice and also seltzer water.. weird. But it was light and refreshing.

Great staff, so friendly and so helpful.

I hope to return here very soon. Loved it over all!
author: Meghan L.

description:
If you're looking for Fondue, you're better off at the Melting Pot chain than here. 

The only redeeming part of our dinner was the dessert fondue. Which is pretty hard to screw up.
author: Dimple B.

description: These were literally the smallest portions I had ever seen in my life. When we walked in and our waiter said two bowls would be enough for four guys, we said OK! It was bland then he arrived with two small cups of fondue. We looked at each other confused. I am walking to in and out right now. Don't come here if you're hungry.
author: Gavin B.

description: Still remembered the place after one whole year. Got there at late night since we skipped dinner somehow and was eager for some food. Fondue was great!
author: Zoe S.

description: Went to dinner and I LOVED it.  Per everyone's suggestion, we also ordered the Outlaw which was really delicious and came with great sides (bread, apples [[favorite]], grapes, brocoli and a few otehr things).  We also ordered the sausage plate, definitely would have not been enough food for us if we hadn't ordered that.  For dessert we got the dark chocolate fondue.  I was skeptical because I'm personally not a fan of the bitter dryness of dark chocolate but our waitress reassurred me that as a fondue it was totally diffferent.  And she was right, the dark chocolate isn't too sweet and it come with all kinds of toppings, most importantly their CHOCOLATE BREAD (the love child of brownies and bread). It's awesome.
author: Michael T.

description:
My experience goes as follows:

Server: "How's everything tasting so far?"
Me: " Delicious (said in a sincere, long, dragged out, relaxed tone, with your head slightly tilted back toward your shoulder, slightly shaking it with intense pleasure and slowly blinking your eyes).

--------------------------------------

I really enjoy this place. Staff is friendly and the cheese is like "oh-mah-gah" (in a kind of out of breath tone, when you can't even say the last part of each word. It's like your tongue is floating). - I stick with the Traditional and the Outlaw with a side of sausage. Yes, sausage.

The dark chocolate fondue is sexy. Ultimately sexy. I would marry it if i could. When you dip the chocolate bread in it, it's like --- "SOW-GOO" (so good) - you can't even talk, you're just shaking your head in disbelief and thinking in your head..."is this real life?"
author: Sheena U.

description:
Yummy! I've been wanting to try Fondue Cowboy for a while now and last night was finally the night!

I went with my husband and friends, and made a reservation via OpenTable, just in case.  

The place is really cozy, lots of dark wood and soft light, very comfortable.  The gal who greeted us when we walked in was really nice and immediately took care of us.

I was a little concerned because I'd read other Yelp reviews complaining about the small portion sizes.  I agree that compared to say, The Melting Pot, the portions are small, but it's cheese, and while it's damn delicious you really don't need to be eating a whole vat all by yourself.  

We ordered, between 4 people:

2 Cheese Fondues: The Outlaw and The Rawhide - while we liked both, the Rawhide definitely packed more punch.  I wanted the Outlaw to be a little spicier but it was still good. (came with: bread, potatoes, broccoli, kalamata olives, grapes, apples, and gherkins!)

1 - cured meats plate - yum, 3 cured meats, all delicious and great with the Outlaw.

1 - tenderloin plate - it was good, but I didn't really care about it

1 - sausage plate - YES! Last night's sausage was the Louisiana Hot Link, and it was amazingly delicious dipped in the Rawhide.

1 - Chocolate Dessert - Happy Trails - yummy, but I expected it to pack a little more punch with the cayenne pepper, still delicious. (came w/ pineapple, kiwi, banana, strawberries, brownie bits, marshmallows and a cookie/bread thing)

We also shared two bottles of Cabernet...a great compliment to everything.  Oh and we had coffee.

Total was: $200ish and almost $100 was for wine, so it was about $25 a person and we had lots of food.  I consider that pretty damn awesome.
author: Margaret I.

description: Great fondue! Went here with two girlfriends and it is a cute and small fondue bar that made for a perfect Saturday night. Brought our own bottle of wine ($15 corkage fee) and enjoyed what seemed like an endless amount of cheese and dippers. Too full to eat dessert so I will be back for more!
author: Cristina R.

description:
Date & Time:  Thursday June 10, 2010 @ 5:30pm
Dining Companion:  The Husband
Scene:  Attractive 20-30 Something Ladies Dining Solo, in Pairs & Groups Decked-Out in Rebecca Taylor Tops, Flared Hudson Jeans & LV Bags
Vibe:  Lively
Music:  World
Decor:  Fun Contemporary Space.  Neutral & Brown Palette.  Clint Eastwood Mural & Westerns Playing Silently.  Sleek Bar & Lounge Seating
Service:  Efficient Hipsters
Imbibe:  Beer & Vino
Devour:  The Quick Draw(Gouda Cheese, White Wine, Roasted Garlic) & High Noon(White Chocolate w/ Strawberry Balsamic Puree)
Total:   $38.80
author: Genevieve Y.

description:
Delicious food. A little pricey but that's typical for fondue.

My fiancée and I both really enjoyed ourselves. She's Chinese and doesn't typically enjoy dishes containing a lot of cheese but she said the Outlaw was "the best cheese she's ever had". :)
author: Brian V.

description: 15 of my friends and I went for my birthday happy hour this past week and were very impressed by the food and service.  Fondue Cowboy easily accomodated a group of that size, and during happy hour almost everything is half off!  Paul, our server, went out of his way to make everything go perfect.  We all seemed to love "The Outlaw" savory fondue the most; all of the accoutrements that come with the fondue were great as well - plenty of options!  They had a great selection of beers and wine to choose from as well.
author: Susan C.

description: A superb culinary experience right in the heart of Folsom!! My friend and I had arrived in San Francisco around 5pm on Friday so after taking a nap we decided to head out at around 8:30 and after yelping around we decided to give Fondue Cowboy a shot due to its distance from our hotel and yelp reviews. After observing the menu and speaking with our waitress it was clear that the Outlaw was definitely the ultimate choice for us and we decided to go with the cured meat plate for our choice of meat. The outlaw cheese fondue was beyond perfection and as was the delicious prosciutto and salamis! Yelp reviews and pictures don't do it justice you definitely have to give it a shot yourself to clearly understand what I'm talking about. Will definitely be bringing my parents here when I'm back in May!
author: Harout S.

description:
I would like this place more if they served liquor.... But they don't. Only beer & wine but they did a great job of making their wine cocktails taste great! 
Decor was clean & trendy. Very small inside, probably need a reservation on the weekends. 
We got the cheddar cheese dip mix. I liked it but my friend complained to me about too many chunks of things in it. I liked the many different dipping options- the best variety I've had at a fondue restaurant!
author: D T.

description: This was my first fondue experience. I wasn't sure what to expect. I came with a group a 3 around 7pm? We were seated at the bar. Its very dim and dark inside, so I'd say it's a pretty good date spot. My friends and I ordered the Rawhide with a side of cured meats. I, personally, thought the cheese was overwhelming. We also ordered the High Noon, which is the white chocolate fondue. That was super sweet, which i like. Overall, it was an interesting experience. Definitely something to try once, but I probably won't come back for awhile.
author: Lina C.

description: I shall fondly remember this fondu. Really fun tasty fondu. Well thought out experience. Great service. Tasteful decor. Great service! Clean. Cozy. 1/2 price beer and wine on tap for happy hour. Great service.
author: Alizabeth S.

description: Make reservations and enjoy everything they have to offer! I honestly couldn't have asked for a better birthday dinner!  It was very romantic and the server was prompt and extremely helpful, he made sure we didn't miss out on the dessert! Highly recommend this to anyone staying in the city, too awesome of an dinner experience to miss!!
author: Dillon B.

description: Wanted to take my boyfriend on a date at a fondue place and since it was a week day i didnt think i needed to make a reservation. However when we got there no tables were available. So we decided to sit at the bar. After ordering our drinks someone had cancelled their reservations so we were able to get a table. We ordered the cowboy which was spicy so it was good but overpowering. We ordered the cured meats plates also. We didnt have room for dessert chocolate fondue :( overall it was good and fun. Romantic place for a date.
author: Thuyvi M.

description: Perfect Valentine's Day location! Delicious food, great ambiance, and romantic setting.
author: Jennifer W.

description: Great cheese and chocolate fondues! They also have a nice, reasonably-priced wine list and lots of beers on tap and in bottles. Be sure to make a reservation for Saturdays.
author: Bob A.

description:
Nice small cozy place. the area is a bit questionable.. lol but my bf and I went before sunset.

Had their fondue with mushrooms, i dont remember what it was called. I liked the wide variety of dippers they give us. Potatoes were the best match. I also love those tiny pickels! yuumm! 

Famous for the cayenne dark chocolate fondue. MMmm im not sure if i like or not? I"m not a huge chocolate fan but the chocolate was good. the spice from the pepper makes it interesting. Something different to try. but I think i'll try something else next time.

Server was really nice and informative. 

AWESOME dippers! reasonable price! MAKE reservations!
author: Erica L.

description: This place is cute. I don't think I'm into cheese fondue that much, but the dessert fondue was awesome. The white chocolate fondue the best.
author: Connie N.

description: So accommodating for gluten-free. Wow delicious :D
author: Ann Evelyn S.

description:
I came here to celebrate my friend's birthday and my first observation about this place was: beautiful and cozy space!

I was pleasantly surprised at how friendly and patient our server was. We were in a table of 12, so you get the picture, a lot of talking and a lot of delay in actually ordering. 

Our server was wonderful, I wish I had gotten his name so I could give him props here. He allowed me to try three different types of wine while trying to match the original wine I wanted. That was impressive. 

The food presentation was great, the quality was good and the service overall was fantastic: prompt, friendly and efficient. 

The dessert fondue was A-M-A-Z-I-N-G!! The Milk chocolate one that is. I was not a big fan of the dark chocolate with cayenne pepper. It tasted weird and unpleasant, but the milk chocolate one.... oh my, nothing was left to tell the story.

Thumbs up, definitely returning for more.
author: Monique T.

description: My boyfriend and I came here for Valentine's Day! We found out about Fondue Cowboy while randomly searching Yelp and it was perfect! The food was amazing! We had the Traditional fondue, but we will definitely be back to try the other fondue choices.
author: Jessica M.

description: This place is AWESOME! Do the happy hour. More bang for your buck and the food/service is great.
author: Melissa M.

description:
Fondue Fondue Fondue....

imagine modern restaurant, with John Wayne playing on the TV, and a small, limited menu.  This restauant feels like a guilty pleasure because there really isn't anything healthy on the menu and the options are so limited, that you really have to be in the mood for one of them.  

There are two kinds of fondue - savory fondue and sweet fondue.  
I tried both, with a nice glass of white wine.
author: Kaylee A.

description: I'm visiting from San Diego. I have never been to a Fondue spot. I wasnt familiar with the Menu, but our waiter explained everything and gave us plenty of time to make up our minds. At first we all were second guessing choosing this place for dinner, but once we got our food, it ended up being really good. Great atmosphere, great food, and great beer.
author: Kenyatta C.

description: This place was not too bad. You pick a fondue flavor that you like (from a selection of between 5-6) and it comes with bread, potato, grapes, broccoli, olives and pickles. Free refills on all of the above. You can choose to add meat plates which cost between $10-16 extra. The meat was way too salty in my opinion and even eating it with the bread didn't help. The fondue itself was good at first but got tiring really fast. Maybe it was because there wasn't a lot of taste to it or because there was some kind of weird after taste. But either way, my friend and I stopped using the fondue halfway through. It's definitely a cool place to try but probably not somewhere I would eat often. Awesome idea, mediocre execution. The staff was very nice and attentive though.
author: Queenie L.

description:
This place is super small and was literally a joke. Fondue was average and the server was flaming, but fun. We came here with 8 people and we all left still hungry with a bill around $300. 

Would I come back, definitely not only because you can go to la fondue or any other place that will actually fill you up. Probably a better place for dessert, but definitely not for dinner.
author: Jessica L.

description:
This place was awesome. I was in town for my birthday and really wanted some fondue. We booked this place at 5:00 for an 8:30 table. When we came in the place was empty, but filled up as we ate. 

The food was great, we had both a cheese and chocolate pot with the sausage plate on the side. The wine that was recommended was awesome and I loved the old black and white movies playing over the bar. 

I would recommend this place to friends and go back if I'm ever in the bay area again!
author: Kristie W.

description: This place is amazing. Been here about 4 times now and every time I've been impressed. We've come with and without reservations and everytime we've had great service. They offer a fixed price fondue where additional dippers are gratis. The wine is half off before 630 which is a great bonus.
author: Marcus R.

description:
I work right next to this place and met a girlfriend for happy hour.  It was cold out, so this place seemed nice and cozy and cute considering the neighborhood around it.

We sat at the bar and just got some wine and a fondue.  The wine was great, the fondue was OK, the cheese seemed a bit watery to me and lacked flavor even though it was supposed to have garlic and beer.  It was also a pretty small portion and the candle under it didn't really keep it hot.   

I don't think this is a place for dinner but for a happy hour or snack to chill and relax it's great.  Also, for $24 the fondue should be a better quality and larger portion given some of my other experiences.
author: Inga W.

description: More of app place than dinner. Wish they had broth selection. Just cheese and dessert. Simple. We had outlaw and traditional. Both were good.
author: Cindy K.

description:
Qhat a nice and quirky little place.  The fondues are amazing and come with ample selections to dip with from grapes, to bread, to apples, to olives.... you name it, and it's on the plate.  Choose from a variety of cheeses and don't be afraid to ask for recommendations.  the staff is knowledgeable, friendly, and happy to be there.  

Grab a glass of wine or sangria (no spirits) and dip away!
author: Kevin J.

description:
I'm giving this place a solid three for a few reasons.

The food is delicious, although I'd skip the Stage Coach, it was bland. 

I'd also skip their cocktails and go with beer. The sangria in particular was watered down from ice. 

Other than that, the food is tasty, they have interesting dippables. In general, I wish they had more options. I was really craving some steak that day, but they only had hot links (which were yummy but didn't quite hit that same spot). 

I also wish the portions were a smidge larger, both for the cheese and the chocolate. I'm probably just used to Melting Pot / Simply Fondue portions, but these seemed skimpy for the price. 

The ambiance is A++, as was the service, and the Outlaw was super duper delicious as was the cayenne chocolate. I'd go back, but get drinks elsewhere beforehand and know that we'll either need an entire portion per person (although it says serves two), or know that I'll need a snack later in the evening.
author: Guinnevere C.

description: I'm so glad this is near me in SF.  Very quaint and perfect little date spot.  Good food and service.
author: Mike J.

description:
Pros: 
  Tasty cheese fondue. 
  Amazing chocolate fondue (try the cayenne!)
  Casual but intimate setting (ie the place is surprisingly small)

Cons: 
  Very small portions. We had lots of dipping edibles remaining when the cheese fondue was gone.
  Expensive! $120 for 2 people. Cheese just doesn't cost this much. Especially with the portions they provide.
author: Tommy O.

description:
First off - make your reservation via Open Table, made it super easy! Took one of my best friends here for his birthday earlier this month, we had an amazing time!

The waitress was great, super attentive, funny and gave great drink recommendations. The sat us in the cozy corner by the window, good amount of room for five people. We all shared 2 orders of the fondue (Outlaw and the Raw Hide) - this was MORE than enough. They bring tons of bread, veggies, etc to dip in the delicious fondue.

We ordered the Happy Trails for dessert (TOTALLY ROCKED). They even gave us extra marshmallows for dipping when we asked. :)

Definitely making a return trip!
author: Tatiana H.

description: I have tried every cheese and chocolate concoction this place whips up and I love them all. I'm particularly partial to the Stage Coach (Jarlsberg and mushrooms) and the Buck-A-Roo (Milk Chocolate and walnuts). The fondues each come with a wide variety of dipping selections that range from broccoli and roasted potatoes (for the cheeses) to kiwis and marshmallows (for the chocolate). The owner is always there working hard and the waiters are always kind and willing to walk you through their recommendations. I have become a weekly regular and am glad this place is in my neighborhood.
author: Michael H.

description:
This is basically the perfect casual-but-classy experience with either friends or your partner. I went here with my favorite dining companion and am sure we'll be back again.

For a reasonable price, you can get a meal for two. We split the mushroom-containing cheese fondue, with nice chunks of steak and a great white wine to match. They also do the 500 ml carafes of wine, so it's just the right size for a light-ish dinner.

Gluten free notes: Just tell them you're gluten free and they'll keep the flour out of the fondue and give you potatoes and veggies with no bread. Sweet.
author: Ellie P.

description: I did not think I would enjoy this place as much as I did.  I mean, how hard can fondue be?  This place surprised me with the variety of cheeses and also how good each one was. The cheeses weren't too thick or heavy - they blended them and melted them well.  It's good for groups where you want to sample a few different things - try the spicy fondue and also definitely try the goat cheese one - that was my favorite.  Also you should try the chocolate fondue for dessert. It was awesome!
author: David Z.

description:
Had a wonderful time here Wednesday evening!  I came here with 2 friends and it was our first time for fondue...ever.  The ghetto chocolate fountains @ the all you can eat buffets don't count!

Our waitress, I really don't remember her name, but she was awesome!   Very attentive & very patient with our group of fondue newbies.

The setting is kind of romantic.  Cushions and dimmed lights.  John Wayne playing in the back.  Okay, that's not so romantic, but just thought I'd make you aware.

Food was good.  We got the Outlaw and the Milk chocolate fondue (forgot what it's special name was).

I wish some meat was included, but that's fine.  I would definitely come back.

Thanks, Fondue Cowboy. 

Lol, I saw a reviewer upset that there were no cowboys.  Seriously?   Where did you expect them and what did you expect them to do?  

Tata!
author: BizzyLizzy K.

description: A visit to Fondue Cowboy is kind of like a visit to Nana's back in the 70's. That is if Nana was kind of hip and more than a little into Clint Eastwood. It's an inviting space where you get treated like family and have the opportunity to devour lots and lots of cheese. It may be covering some broccoli or an olive, but it's still a wonderful mix of booze and dairy. Make sure to leave room for dessert. Then you get to eat lots of chocolate too. Great service. I know a lot of reviewers have complained about the portion sizes, but for me they are just right, Fondue tends to err on the rich side and it's easy to over do it. I've been to fondue Cowboy several times now and everyone I've been with has always seemed to go away full and happy. Love, Love, Love it.
author: Nicole M.

description:
I had dinner here on a date night and it was deliciiiiiious!  Being French myself I have missed Fondue so very much ! My only regret is I was too full to order the chocolate fondue, which looked absolutely amazing from our neighbor's table.

This place is worth the expense. Staff was very friendly!
author: Sabrina M.

description:
Such a fun and delicious place with a great atmosphere! I came here with a group of three other people (four of us total), and it was *perfect*

We ordered two different cheese fondues with the steak and cured meat platters (so delicious, followed this up with chocolate fondue (oh man, so good), and had the arugula + beet salad with some sangria and champagne as well.

I'd say this place is great for dates since your partner can wait for you at the bar and order a drink if you're arriving separately, great for friends since it's fun and interactive to drink and dip your fondue, and fun for work as well (a friend of mine consistently goes here for work dinners).

The service is friendly, the food is TOO good (ohhhh soooo goooood -- I want to go back!), and the environment is fantastic as well.

Would return!

Menu suggestions:
* Happy Trails (dark chocolate with cayenne -- mmmmm)
* Roasted Beet salad (nice appetizer before your heavy fondue meal comes in, and large enough to serve four people while waiting)
* Desperado (goat cheese -- really tasty)
* Stage Coach (also yummy)
* Grilled Beef plate (steak!)
* Cured Meat plate (YUUUUM)

Be sure to try the house sangria! :)
author: Sherilynn M.

description: Loved the western look inside. Great fondue. Definitely didn't leave hungry. Had traditional and enjoyed much.
author: Fallon Z.

description: Now this is a place that deserves it's high rating. Great atmosphere, pretty good and friendly service and delicious food. We had the Quick Draw with a the steak plate and shared the beet salad. Everything tasted pretty darn good. I really like the decor. If there weren't so many restaurants to try in SoMa we'd probably come back again soon. You could go here for a snack or for a meal. Very delicious!
author: Jennifer A.

description:
Had my birthday here-

They are more than accommodating for large groups.

Pro-tip: open table it

Atmosphere is laid back, but upscale. They play westerns on a screen while you eat your delicious, delicious fondue.

Order a side of meat, I know how you love your meat.
author: Jenny U.

description:
It was Valentines evening so a full house, although they only have 7 tables.  The server was always rushing and felt like he wanted to move us along.  It was a 3 course set menu for Valentines:  1) a choice of three salads.  We order two and they were both large and very good; 2) I think 5 choices of cheese fondue.  All with olives, pickles, grapes, melon, potatoes and bread.  Although the cheese fondue was very good it was a small amount of cheese and we ran out long before the food items; 3) 3 chocolate fondue options - white, dark or mil chocolate.  We ordered the dark and it again was very good but small quantity and we ran out long before the food items.

Additionally, the tables are on top of each other so your conversation is open to others, and in fact through half of dinner we had a conversation with our neighbor.  This is great if you want a social dinner, but not if you want a romantic dinner.
author: Joe D.

description:
My first fondue experience! The food portions don't seem big when they give it to you, but it is actually very filling once you take into account that you dip everything with delicious, creamy cheese!

The cheese fondue comes with: baked potatoes (greatly done, tender on the inside and crispy on the outside), bread, and a cold plate consisting of grapes, apples, olives, and pickled cucumbers. The cold plate is weird with the cheese so I ate it plain. We also got plate of sliced sausage. Together this leads to a very full stomach.

We got the "outlaw" flavor with bacon and spices in it.

For dessert, we got "happy trails" which is the quintessential dark chocolate with a bit of cayenne pepper mixed in. Comes with a generous portion of brownies, marshmallows, and sliced fruit. 

The place is small (reservation essential) but that makes the dining experience very intimate. I wouldn't say this is a good place for group dinners. Most ideal for couples (2 people) and maybe up to 4 people. 

Service was swift and pleasant.
author: Elizabeth T.

description:
I love the lighting and the fake wood wall, very cool, modern, and romantic. It would be even better if there's more "hidden" areas so you can't see the entire room at once.

The "Rawhide" fondue tastes good and gives you plenty of cheese to dip in. I don't really like the apple though, I prefer veggies as the dipping selections (not sure if you can switch). Although the portion is not huge, we didn't leave hungry. Make sure you order the sausage plate to fill you up a bit.

Will come back if I crave fondue and romantic ambiance.
author: Novalina N.

description: Service was amazingly friendly and welcoming, and the High Noon white chocolate dessert is literally the best thing I've ever tasted. Living in the Bay Area, I don't say that lightly.
author: Kirk S.

description: Ridiculous amounts of deliciousness.  Bring a date, a big appetite (and your wallet).  Friendly and sweet staff.  Good drinks.  Great choice for special, intimate dinner.  Be sure to save room for one of the dessert fondues; I've tried all three and can't decide which one I like best.
author: Scott B.

description: A charming little place with a very intimate setting. Tried the chocolate fondue and would love to try out the cheese version another time.
author: Candy L.

description: Delicious fondue! I went with a larger group (make a reservation, the place is small) and we ordered three cheeses for 6 people, which was a good amount. My favorite was the stagecoach. The drinks were also yummy. This restaurant is on the  pricier side, but io bed the ambience.
author: Karen D.

description: I'm from the Midwest! I love cheese!! This place had great cheese. Fondue is a dying art and I really enjoyed the simplistic and well executed take on fondue from this place. Thanks SF for being weird enough to have a gay fondue featuring. A+++
author: Casey N.

description: Bad service. To be more precise, no service at all. We made reservations prior to showing up. They acknowledge our reservations. But we were just flatly ignored while sitting on the bar section. Hard to say more since we hardly received any service. We decided to leave the place and move to another dining place.
author: Jai R.

description:
I was hoping for much better. Both the main course classic cheese fondue and the dark chocolate dessert fondue were good, not great, but good. The variety and freshness of the dipping sides was very nice, the classic fondue was good but dull, dark chocolate was done very well. 
What got me was the white wine selection. It is average on the page but when served WAS WATERED! I have not ever had this happen outside places and cultures where it is an acceptable variant and as such, is disclosed and described. I tasted four of the whites, their French Sav. Blanc, a Viogniet,  a Gruener Veltliner and a Gewuerztraminer, ordered 1/2 litres of two specific wines I know very well, both were actually watered down! I will never go here again. As nice as the staff were, this is shocking and both distasteful and dishonest!
author: Nicolas E.

description:
First question will have to be: why are fondue places so expensive?!

My bf and I happened upon here. Super cute and cozy. Love the flooring and walls. Lighting was just right and the throw pillows with the seating were fun.

On our menu:
Mixed green salad, roasted pear, gorgonzola, bacon
-the salad was fantastic and perfectly mixed and seasoned. devoured every bite. the garlic croutons on the side were just the right added texture

Fondues:
(although they looked small to me, with all the Dippers- potatoes, bread, broccoli, apples, grapes (why!?), olives..One order might have been plenty)

Traditional- too much wine! the flavor was as if they chucked in a bottle of wine right at the end
The Outlaw- you tasted alot of the tomoatoes, garlic, but not much else. 

Happy Trails- delightful. I found the chocolate bread interesting and delicious, along with fruit and marshmallows

We had a good time. Nothing super exciting to want to run back to. And again..this plus wine came out to $115..
author: Abigail W.

description:
The Outlaw was great!   
Have always wanted to try this place out . Check that off this list.  And will regularly now !
author: Trevor G.

description:
Boyfriend and I have visited the Fondue Cowboy several times and have had a great experience each time.  Love the music selection that they play and the cheese selections are to AMAZING.

We generally order either the Outlaw or the Rawhide and I really appreciate the aged flavors of the cheese.  Their Happy Trails dessert fondue is a great finisher if you're willing to try delicious dark chocolate with a glimpse of cayenne.

Tip:  Recommend that you make reservations as the space isn't large and can get quite busy on Thur-Sat.
author: Kathy F.

description:
SIT-REP

My sweet friend DEANNA (aka Dede) and I hit FONDUE COWBOY on a Friday evening for an 8:15pm dinner reservation to celebrate Dede's birthday.  It was just starting to rain, she got there first as I was still coming over the Bay Bridge.  It was nice getting back into The City. 

Fondue Cowboy strikes me as a fun eclectic establishment that got it's name because someone probably lost a bet.  It all adds to the fun and ambiance.
