Both had very strong bitter flavors.  The three of us all liked the rawhide (Italian Dolce Gorgonzola, Emmenthaler, White Wine, Bacon, Roasted Garlic) better than the other one.  

We HAD to get a sweet fondue for dessert and BOY AM I HAPPY THAT WE DID!  We ordered the dark chocolate cayenne fondue and it was out-of-this-world delicious!!  Highly recommend it!!!  Their selection of dippers was fantastic as well.... chocolate bread, madeleines, marshmallows, mandarin oranges, kiwi, strawberries, and bananas.  YUM YUM!!!

Bottom line:

Would probably skip the cheese fondues and just come back for dessert next time!
author: Suzie M.

description:
Loved the dark chocolate fondue with balsamic strawberry purée - came with delicious chocolate sourdough (who knew that combination would be tasty?), homemade (!!) marshmallows, madeline cookies, and lots of fruit. 

Also ordered the green salad and white bean salad - both quite good! Our server, James, was very friendly and attentive. A cute space too. Definitely planning to go back!
author: Diane C.

description:
A fondue dinner at a place called Fondue Cowboy didn't sound like a good idea to me. Once I arrived and saw the small fondue pots, it still seemed to not be a good idea. Seeing the small seats and low tables seemed to enforce the idea of this not being a good idea. 

By the end of the evening, I decided that fondue at a small place called Fondue Cowboy that served small fondue pots was a good idea. 

However, the cowboy-themed decor and silent movies are still not good ideas.
author: Jen A.

description:
2/5 stars mean "Meh. I've experienced better." but I haven't.... because this was my first fondue experience. Came on a Thursday night with some girlfriends and was warned that there may be quite a wait because this is a very popular spot. 

We walked in and the place is nearly empty and pretty much stayed that way. Ok fine, maybe half the place filled up. We got the outlaw and stage coach. Stage coach was so bland while the outlaw on the other hand was much better, but not by that much. And guys, before you start judging, I DO like cheese. For dessert we got the happy trail, which was probably the best. We also got the meat plate. 

Our grand total was about $90 something, which is kind of much for just melted cheese and cheap dipping items. Yeah yeah yeah, don't throw the crap at me that this is fondue, it's supposed to be expensive. But what irked me the most was... hm... I'll just keep it to myself. Fondue no more for me!
author: Eugenia G.

description:
It was tasty, novel, and fun, but not at all filling or amazing.  We had salads, the cheddar fondue pot, and the meat plate with a bottle of the rose.  The full bill, including tip was $107.  

Most of all, I loved that there was a sparkling rose (my favorite).  My boyfriend and I had never had fondue before and it was fun, but awkward.  We didn't know how to break the little cheese string connection between the pot and the toothpick .  Luckily, the awkwardness didn't give way to frustration, but instead gave us the giggles.  Or maybe that was the rose ...
author: Jenny C.

description:
Sad. Sad. Saaaaad!  Got news that a new fondue joint was opening up in the City and was super excited-not only of the fondue but because it was cowboy themed!  The menu was pretty small but to the point.  It's a fondue restaurant so aside from 4-5 side dishes (mainly salads), everything else was fondue-either cheese or chocolate.  The interior was designed very well.  

My friends and I were here on a Tuesday evening and at 8:15pm, they tell us they are out of chocolate!!! WHAT?!!?  (& please keep in mind that we ordered our chocolate fondue with our cheese fondue at the beginning & the waiter says he'll order it later so that it can come after the cheese-but we had to ask and order again after all and now there was none left!) For goodness sakes, that's half your menu!!!!  People come here for fondue and you run out of chocoalte?!  That is like going to the bathroom and running out of toilet paper!  What's your other option? Water and your hands!  Imagine that. That's pretty much how I felt during my experience that I was SO looking forward to.   The group to the right of us were SUPER disappointed that after they were savoring their cheese fondues, they couldn't even have the option to try the chocolate fondue.  

The group to the left of us was told they were being given the last of the chocolate they had for the evening and they ended up complaining that it was "weird" "clumpy" and "not creamy."  The waiter just told them "sorry it must have been because it was the last of it and maybe they didn't have enough half and half either."  WHY would you tell your customers that AFTER you've served it to them?  Did you think you could get away with it?  Obviously not...

First off, the portion size was pretty small.  We ordered the Outlaw, which was the better of the two we ordered.  We also ordered the Stagecoach, but it was so bitter it was almost inedible.  We just pushed it aside.  There was nothing spectacular here.

The service was poor as well.  The food took a long time to come out.  There was one guy running around doing everything looking disheveled.  We had to ask multiple times just to get water refilled.  Also, when he first served the accompaniments, he only served one saying that for lack of space on the table, he would bring the other later.  By the time he brought the other, there was no cheese left & the other one was inedible.  Our server didn't seem to know how to manage his tasks.  He was nowhere to be found everytime we needed something.  It didn't look like any co-workers were helping either.  There was a few minutes when there were no servers on the floor. 

It's too bad because there aren't many fondue places to go to in the City and they really could have capitalized on a unique business idea.  If they stock their ingredients correctly and train their servers properly,  this place has the potential to thrive.  Unfortunately during my visit, both service and product were lacking.  I was lucky that I had great company, which saved the whole experience. 

I don't think I would come here again, nor recommend it to anyone.
author: Jennifer N.

description:
Yummy yummy, fondue in my tummy!

We decided on a spur to go check out this new place. We went on a weekday evening at 10:00. Things didn't start out well with the hostess being rather cold with us. There were only three tables filled when we got there  but the hostess at first tried to seat us at the bar or suggested the three of us turn a two-top on it's side and pull a chair up to it. When I asked if we could have the four top that was actually available she made a big deal of checking her reservations before saying that it might be ok. Not sure what her issue was since no one else even came in after us.

Service got much better with our waiter who was a hoot and super friendly. We order the meat plate, the Traditional fondue and the Stage Coach and later got the Dark Chocolate fondue.

My spouse spend her early childhood in the French Alps and all through out her childhood her mom made cheese fondue. She really like both of the combinations but we all agreed that the alcohol flavour was too strong in the Stage Coach and the comte got overpowered by it. Not that the three of us didn't devour every last bit of cheese because we didn't.  The selection of veggies and bread that came with the fondue were generous portions and the potatoes were tasty as on their own.

The meat plate was good but not amazing and came with a large fruit salad. 

We finished with the dark chocolate fondue. It was a little too spiced much but again we did finish it. It came again with a great selection of fruit and breads including fresh madelines and chocolate bread.

With the fondues all at 16 dollars or higher and  a limited menu, this isn't a restaurant you would be likely to go to on a regular basis. It is a nice place and I would go back again if I was in the mood for fondue.
author: DeathandFood H.

description:
NOTE: I went Friday 6/11 and they'd only been open for a few days at this point.  So it's a little too early to get excited about this place.  

The hostess was hilarious and I appreciated her kindness.  We went around 8pm on Friday night and the place was packed with about 10 people waiting outside.  I was told my party 4 would have to wait about 45 minutes.In truth we only waited 20 minutes (score!) and were seated at the booth in the corner.  

Our waiter was atrocious- he had no idea how to open bottles of wine and it made me wonder if it was his first day serving.  The cork almost fell in the bottle twice.  He then took 45 minutes after we finished dessert to bring us our check and we were very obviously finished with our wine and food AND there was a massive crowd waiting to be seated.

This was my first fondue restaurant experience, but I've made it many times at home.  The cheese fondue's were good, I liked the flavors but they were nothing out of the ordinary.  

The accoutrements needed the biggest help: a pitted kalamata olive is not something I would consider appropriate for dipping and holding cheese.  Next, the cubed bread was absolutely at least a day old.  Finally, the apples at our table (and others when I peaked around) were brown and therefore been sitting out too long.

My friends and I DID love the chocolate fondue with cayenne- very good blend of flavors and not spicy just smokey.  One suggestion if anyone is listening: maybe add some cubed pound cake with the desserts?

I will absolutely go back here in another couple months once they've got their groove on.  Very affordable dinner: 4 fondues plus the cured meat plate and two bottles of wine for four people came to $100 plus tip.

Giddy Up!
author: Kyra W.

description: Nice little spot on Folsom. Sitting at the bar for 1/2 fondue happy hour is the way to go. We had the Cowboy fondue and loved it. Portions are a bit small so they only feed 2 if your not starving. However the service is great and they offer several options of fondue.
author: Heather W.

description: Went here for a "date night" on a Tuesday. Based on Yelp reviews, we made a reservation, but it was empty. We ordered the Traditional and Buck-A-Roo fondues, and the Mixed Greens salad. I've never been to a fondue restaurant so I don't have much to compare it to, but I thought the food was great. Portions seemed a little small for the price, but I'll definitely be coming back for happy hour when it's half off. :)
author: Kelsey F.

description:
After driving 6+ hours to SF, checking into the hotel, and taking a cab to the restaurant, we rushed to find a lovely dining experience with the family. 

We ordered three different types of cheese fondues, all of which included bread, potatoes, broccoli, olives, fruit. As separate sides, we ordered  sausage (nice n spicey) and meat plates that included salami and prociutto (great flavor). The wine list wasn't too long and the choices were very good. According to Kevin good beer list was satisfactory. I would have like more of a variety of veggies, but Kevin seems to think if we had asked for it, it would have been provided. Hmmmm.

For me the highlight was the desert (of course!). We selected two different chocolate versions of milk with walnuts and dark chocolate with cayenne. OMG, the dark chocolate with cayenne was in-cre-di-ble! served with pound cake, strawberries, grapes, bananas, and unsweetened chocolate cake. If we go back, I would select TWO orders of the dark. :)

The service was fantastic. We were seated right away and our server was adorable with his commentary to our orders and remarks while serving us. Only downside was the restaurant did not have a full bar and only served wine and beer. A cocktail would have been nice.

I would recommend this place if you are in the area.
author: Lisa H.

description:
As soon as I heard about this place I wanted to try it...I mean melted cheese and bread? It doesn't get much better than that in my book.  

I read the reviews and heard about the lack of tables and long wait times so I called ahead and asked to reserve a table.  Dave was super nice and called me the very next day to confirm.  Problem solved.  We arrived last night at 7:30 and our table and friendly wait staff were waiting with bells on (not literally).  

We ordered 3 fondues for 4 people as well as a bottle and half carafe of wine.   All of the fondues come with a generous plate full of bread, potatoes, broccoli, olives, pickles and grapes and apples for dipping.  The fondue pots are small, not much larger than your standard ramekin but 3 was plenty for the 4 of us.  Plus they have sides and salads if you're hankering for more than just cheese.  We ordered the Traditional, Outlaw and Rawhide.  The consistency was a little thick but they were all flavorful.  I think I liked the traditional one the best.  

We all shared the Happy Trails chocolate fondue for dessert.  Beware - it has a major dose of cayenne, but paired with the sweet bread and fruit it was pretty yummy.  

The bill for 4 fondues plus alcohol totaled $100, not bad for 4 people.  

Is it the best fondue I've ever had?  No.  But it was pretty tasty.  Overall I think it's a great addition to the neighborhood and I would (and will) definitely go back.  

On a side note it did not appear too crowded or difficult to get a table when we were there and by the time we left (about 9:30) it was pretty empty.  My guess is if you walk in on a Thu-Sat night at 8pm with a big group you might have to wait a while but if you and a friend pop in on a weeknight you should be fine.
author: Julie P.

description: Cutest place I've been to in a long time. Friendly staff, cute and cozy atmosphere with a great bar. It was a girls night out dinner and my 2 year old is in the group - no flinching at all when we walked in with a toddler. Fondue is awesome!!!! Not only bread to dip into the cheesy awesomeness but veggies and potatoes! Would also recommend the meat plate. Drinks were great as well. We all left loving this place. A must go!!!
author: Diana D.

description:
How can you not love cheese and cowboys? Awesome combo but sadly underwhelming.

The decor is modern. Not a lot of seating overall but good for small groups or a date. The service was great and our food came on time even though this was just their second week open. We met the general manager who gave us a free carafe of wine for my friend's belated birthday. Great customer service. 

The $15 prices means pretty small portions. Which would be fine but there wasn't enough cheese for the bread and dippers. All of the fondue pots have herbs and seasonings in the cheese but instead of lots of flavor, it was a bit like cheese out of a jar. I'd say they'd do better serving a gourmet cheese plain. They had run out of the cured meats by the time we sat down. I was disappointed to see that there were no other meat options on there. A stronger cheese with some steak medallions or sausages would have hit it out of the ballpark.
author: Kimmie N.

description: Staff is very friendly, all fondues are made to order so it was easy to exclude certain ingredients my friends were allergic to. The fondue was amazing and I highly recommend dessert.
author: Vaclav H.

description: My boyfriend and I loved the Milk chocolate!! Great quality chocolate and fruits :D I recommend this place for any couple looking for a romantic spot to hang out!
author: Serra D.

description:
This place is great, I can't recommend it enough. 
Great setting, atmosphere... cozy, great service by a very friendly staff. The owner, Dave, is almost always there making sure things run smoothly and people are happy.

I tried one of the sweet fondues, but have heart great things about some other ones. This is near my house, and is a great addition this side of SOMA. We definitely need more restaurants like this in the area. Great job guys, keep up the good work!

I read some reviews here, and I think its stupid to give a place 1 star because it was busy and people couldn't seat you soon. C'mon people, if I had to judge restaurants based on something like that, Yamo, Burma Superstar and Mr. Pickles ratings would tank. Suck it up, stop being sex and the city about your girls night and judge the place based on its service and food. NOT the fact it was too busy and you couldn't find a table. As for the 1 star review based on price. Check the $ before you come. Use this advice for any other restaurants you try for the first time. 

Go eat here, tell your friends about it.
author: Anish B.

description:
An interesting take on fondue. Certainly not traditional at all, except for the fact that one of their choices is the traditional cheese mixture. Nice hip space too, though it can get loud.

Best is to share one cheese fondue, and follow with one chocolate fondue. The former comes with bits of bread, potatoes and yams (?), and a selection of vegetables, fruit, pickes and olives. The latter comes with bread, marshmallows and madeleines, and a selection of fruit. It's very non-meat oriented, though there are a couple of meat plates you can order.
author: Bruce C.

description: When you go out for fondue, you're either gonna get awesome fondue or a bowl of melted cheese. This is awesome fondue. After a day hiking on the beach, this is a charming and romantic way to end the night.
author: Vani A.

description: I've only been here one time, but would certainly go back.  We had the Rawhide - Italian Dolce Gorgonzola, Emmenthaler, White Wine, Bacon, Roasted Garlic.  It was tasty!  It came with bread, potatoes, broccoli, olives, apples, grapes and pickles.  I had no idea it came with that much food, but, it was perfect.  When the fondue first came out, my initial impression was that it was small, but it turned out to be totally fine for two of us.  I wanted to try the dessert fondue, but was too full from the meal to attempt it.  I would recommend to make reservations, as there aren't a ton of tables.  My only suggestion would be have a some lower price point wines.  I think the cheapest red was $32.  All that being said, we're stoked to go back!
author: dave g.

description:
This restaurant was amazing!  I went with a group a 11 rowdy ladies and they fit us comfortably, even with half our party being about 30 minutes late.  
The food was fantastic!  I highly recommend the Outlaw and Rawhide for savory and Happy Trails for sweet.  

Our waiter, James (shout out) was patient and a real trooper dealing with all our noise and excitement.

The best part...we ladies assumed that with our drinks, salads, and 10 total fondues that we would owe a fortune, but the bill was very manageable AND less than any other fondue place we had been to.

Great fun, highly recommend.  Small location, so make reservations!
author: Lacey C.

description: Truly amazing place that I stumbled upon last night with my iPhone's "AROUND ME" suggestion. I was blow away by the ambiance, food and drink. Thank goodness I happened to have on cowboy boots and a poncho as they played Dirty Harry on the big screen TV. I'll go again to be sure. I loved it.
author: anna m.

description: Great little fondue joint hat is much more affordable and timely than the Melting Pot or the like. It is limited to cheese and chocolate fondue, but all the ones I have had (which I think is almost all of them at this point) are great. The wait staff remembers us as regulars and though the same Westerns always tend to be playing, the ambience is very chill. One rec is that one of the cheese and chocolate can be pretty filing for two especially if you get a meat plate or salad as well. But the stuffing yourself is well worth it. Overall a nice little gem in SOMA.
author: Lindsay J.

description: It was ok...my friend and I tried the dark chocolate cayenne fondue and although good...it wasn't anything special. In fact I couldnt taste any cayenne in there at all. Also towards the end, the chocolate started burning and chunking up. I ordered a pomegranate margarita and that tasted ok too..a little bland... They give you some cut up fruit and some bread to dip in the chocolate (the bread was just french bread) that with the chocolate was a weird combo. The total was about $46 tax/tip for everything. Pretty pricey for stuff I could do and make at home for probably $5. Hmmm..won't be coming back.
author: Em F.

description:
Arrived at 7:15 and put down my name for a table for 4 and was told it would be about an hour wait (reasonable for a Friday night). The host (might have been the owner?) got my cell phone number and said he would call with an update (and he did!). The estimated wait time was almost right on target, not bad.

Western themed atmosphere with a flat screen tv over the bar playing old western films. It is a small space and there are not very many tables, maybe 5 in the whole restaurant plus the seats at the bar, which makes for a cozy restaurant.

Our server was friendly (he looked like Adam Brody; Seth from the OC). He recommended the Petite Syrah, which we liked and ended up getting two bottles of.

Fondue:
Served with grapes, broccoli, mini pickles, olives, bread and potatoes.

The Traditional: Swiss Gruyere, ementhaller, white wine, roasted garlic, fresh ground nutmeg. Had a strong wine taste to it and was very good.

The Outlaw: aged cheddar, beer, slow roasted tomatoes, roasted garlic, roasted jalapenos, cilantro. This fondue was my favorite, had a bit of a kick to it and did not have a strong wine taste.

The Quick Draw: manchego, white wine, roasted red puree, roasted garlic. Probably my least favorite out of the three and did not have a strong flavor, but it was still good.

Dessert Fondue:
Served with marshmallows, bread, kiwi, strawberries, madelines and tangerines.

Happy Trails: dark chocolate with cayenne. You MUST order this! I loved the dark chocolate dessert fondue and would go back just to have it for dessert. I liked that the cayenne taste was not weak and you could actually taste it.

Other:

Roasted Beet Salad: arugula, goat cheese, toasted walnuts and tarragon vinaigrette. Good salad, but nothing extraordinary.

Sausage Plate: a plate of sliced sausages, was a good addition to the fondue.

For 2 bottles of wine, 3 fondues, 1 dessert fondue, a salad & a sausage plate the bill totaled $166 (without tip) for 4 of us and we were all extremely full (and buzzed).
author: Elaine S.

description:
Our annual fondue celebration brought us to Fondue Cowboy this year, and we were not disappointed.  Each fondue serves two and is very reasonably priced and comes with a TON of bread and potatoes, and a few other sides.  My request here would be to do away with the olives and pickles (the cheese is already salty, and some of the fondue already features olives, so this was salt overkill for me), and up the ante on the veggies - more broccoli and maybe some I dunno, carrots, cauliflower or mushrooms?
The dessert fondues are fab as well - I'm not a milk chocolate fan so I skipped that other than a couple of tastes, but I devoured the dark chocolate and loved the kick from the cayenne.  The chocolate-chocolate chip bread stuff made for an insanely intense chocolate bomb.  I could only eat a couple bites of that combo without a big glass of cold milk.  My recommendation here would be to add some of that salt in - pretzels would be amazing.  
Both savory and sweet fondues came with plenty to dip - and really, it was perfectly portioned so that you didn't run out of cheese or chocolate before you ran out of dippers or vice versa - both of which kind of suck.
Service was good.  We were a little bit perplexed by the cowboy lean - everyone needs an angle, but I think fondue might already be your angle, you know?
A great, well priced fondue evening - a few small tweaks could make it five star.
author: Jennifer D.

description: Beware yelp says they are open until 10.00 pm, but that's not true. Two weeks ago, on Sunday we were there at 9.03 pm, and the guy told us they closed the service in a very rude way. Then I ask him to change the yelp information, because it's misleading. It was very disappointing because we drived there almost for one hour. So, we never get a chance to try their food, i can't say anything about it. Although I asked them to change the hours on yelp, they still didn't change it. (in two weeks) Bad customer service.
author: Gökçe Ç.

description:
Ordered The Outlaw and The Quickdraw.  
Both were really tasty.  
Sat at the bar, service was awesome!!
author: Deb S.

description:
What an unexpected surprise!    This place rocks!   Not what you would expect at a restaurant with the word  'Fondue' in the name.

The food was great, the presentation awesome and we left the restaurant not smelling like oil (thank you).
author: Mark F.

description:
7 of us last night and ordered just about one of everything on the menu and loved it! Great service as well. Going back soon. 
Love,
Todd
author: Todd P.

description: Holy yum. Holy great service. Yeeeeeeehaw!
author: Aurora D.

description: Came here with a friend on a Friday night. I'm really glad I made a reservation-- the place fills up QUICK. The spread was very nice and hit the spot. Though, I wasn't the biggest fan of the Manchego fondue, I found it a bit too bitter and salty. I should've opted with the original flavor. We ordered the cured meat on the side and between two people it was barely enough food to keep us full. Perhaps an appetizer would've been a good option? For the price, I wish we would've gotten more food. But, the staff was very friendly and attentive and it's a cute neighborhood spot to check out. I would definitely return but for happy hour. That's when it makes the most sense and you will actually leave full without spending as much! Every day they're open from 5-6pm half off fondue-- great deal!
author: Lissette L.

description: We tried two different type of cheese and they were both gross. One more so than the other. The chocolate dip on the other hand was delicious!
author: Dreamer L.

description:
Solid place. Haven't had fondue in a long while and I came here on a Friday night for my birthday with 6 friends. We ordered 3 vegetarian fondue plates, 2 salads, cured meat dish, and the dark chocolate desert.  The food was all great  and we each had different favorites. We were more than full (having already eaten cupcakes beforehand...because, well...why not, it was my birthday). 

Ambiance:
When we got there (7ish) place was pretty empty, but we were happy that it filled up more over the next hour or so. I would suggest to the management they add a bit more lively music - would help make the place feel as fun as it should/could be. 

Service: 
Pretty good. She helped us with our wine selection. Bordered being ever so slightly pushy, but that could have been because we were one of the only groups there. 

Would recommend and would go back.
author: M B.

description:
This is a great place to pick up an appetizer before dinner or dessert after dinner, but I wouldn't really recommend them for a "fondue" experience. I fully admit that my review is colored by a comparison to La Fondue in Saratoga (see end of this review). Not having been to La Fondue, I might have given this place 4 stars. One star down for narrow offerings and the other star down for value for price. 

Atmosphere - Thematically "western" but with a sophisticated and elegant twist. A nice atmosphere for a date with dim lighting. The place is very small (reservations recommended) and probably cannot dine more than 20 people at tables at any given time. 

Service - Excellent. Our waitress was attentive and professional. We saw another group of 6 come in while we were there who had accidentally booked their reservation for the next evening. They made every effort to accomodate them at the bar when all the tables were taken. 

Food - Tasty, but little that is special. Here's the hard, cold truth. Fondue is essentially easy. You melt cheese/chocolate in a pot and cut up some veggies/fruit to dip in it. If you're going to pay someone to make fondue for you, there should be something special. The cheese fondues had a decent selection allowing options for traditional "authentic" Swiss fondue and then other flavor combinations that were well thought out and differed enough from each other to make each a unique offering. The chocolate fondues, I found lacking. There were three options - dark with cayenne, milk with walnuts, white with strawberry. First, white chocolate isn't even chocolate, but it might float some people's boats so sure - keep it on the menu. For folks actually looking for chocolate you are left with two options. There are so many amazing things you can do with chocolate fondue so I find the narrow selection worthy taking off a star. The dipping options? The chocolate bread from the local bakery was different and special, but the other selections were not. 4 tiny marshmallows, a selection of fruit, and cut up Madeline cookies (which instantly crumbled and got lost in the fondue is just nothing special to me. 

Other things to note - They do not have a full bar and their wine/beer selection is limited, but tasty. They have very limited drink options for someone who does not drink alcohol or caffeine. It might be difficult to get a filling meal if you are kosher, vegetarian, or gluten-free. It's 3.5 blocks from the Civic Center BART station, but I don't recommend walking that distance alone at night as the streets are mostly vacant and rather dark. 

For the best fondue experience available, check out my review of La Fondue in Saratoga. I would only recommend this place if there were transportation limitations that made driving down to Saratoga impossible or if you were just looking for an appetizer/dessert to begin/end a date in the city. 

At La Fondue you can order piece-meal if you just want cheese or just want chocolate, but they also have a $90 feast for two where you each get a (1) choice of 3 delicious salads, (2) a choice of several cheese fondues paired with bread and veggies, (3) an entree course where you can have a grill, broth, or oil paired with a 4 oz portion of 6 meats including seafood, high-end cuts like filet minon, and exotic meets like kangaroo, and (4) a choice of several cheese fondues including a Frangelico fondue, a Godiva liquor fondue, and a rocky road one all of which are paired with the usual fruits, but also marshmallows, cookie dough, cream puffs, rice krispie balls, and snickers. 

Fondue Cowboy has only a piece-meal menu. For two people to get salads, a cheese fondue, a supplemental plate of 3 cured meats, and a chocolate fondue costs $72. The fondue pot portions are smaller and selection of chocolate fondues is rather pitiful.
author: Kat S.

description:
What can I say about cheese that hasn't already been said?  It's ooey, it's gooey, it's delicious.   

Fondue Cowboy's atmosphere is pleasant and conducive to conversation.  They rotate John Wayne and other Western movies on the screen behind the bar and have a fusion urban cowboy decor that just works.

The cheese selections are interesting, but might be in need of a little salt.  Their wine list is standard.  But the dessert!  I highly recommend the High Noon.  Even if you aren't gaga over white chocolate, this fondue won't disappoint.
author: Ambere S.

description: Grace and I like the Cowboy.  It's fun, funky and you can always get a spot at the bar to eat.
author: Robin S.

description:
I'm not a huge fan of fondue, but this place was fun. Very generous portions of dipping options, a good cured meat plate, and excellent service. They have a nice beer selection and the house sangria is pretty good. We had the traditional and the fondue with jalapeno/bacon/garlic. Both were very good.

Had the milk chocolate fondue for dessert, and that was delicious. If for nothing else, come here for an affordable and decadent dessert!
author: Dan S.

description:
After reading numerous Yelp reviews about how the wait was an hour or more and the service was terrible, I was praying that there would be space for my friend and I at the bar and we'd get lucky w/ a nice bartender. 

For a Thursday night, the place was quiet. Tables were filled and people were at the bar, but it was far from packed.

Our bartender, Lauren, had a rad hipster haircut, and was awesomely accommodating. When my friend and I couldn't decide between fondue's, she brought out the different cheese's to taste so we could pick which one we liked best.

We went w/ the Quick Draw.

The red peppers gave it a small bit of spice and the cheese was nice and gooey. 

Many folks complained about the portions. Us two petite girls finished one order and were full. We also had 3 beers and two Rose's between us. This shouldn't be treated as a dinner meal. I felt like it was more of a big gourmet snack w/ my drinks to ensure I didn't get drunk.

3 beers, 2 Rose's, 1 Fondue amounted to $29 per person w/ tip. 

To me the service was great, it was relatively cheap, and the fondue was amazing. I'm not afraid to give bad reviews (check my review for the recently opened Great American Cheese Kitchen) but Fondue Cowboy far surpassed the negative Yelp reviews for me and has become my new fav. drinks spot.
author: Maria A.

description: Fondue Cowboy - what a TREAT! Delicious cheesy melted sublime experience. We had a nicely crafted gorgonzola - emmenthaler mix and the layers of flavor were delightful. And it's not just a meal - it's an experience to share with someone you like, trying all the different dipping accoutrements: sour dough bread, bread crostini, broccoli, cornichons (little french pickles), green apples, black grapes, etc. Also we had a the cured meat platter, served with melon - again, what a treat! The waitress recommended a robust red wine that paired beautifully with our dining experience. And the feeling of the restaurant is warm and inviting.
author: David W.

description:
I came to Fondue Cowboy with my co-workers and we ordered EVERYTHING on the menu. The salads were superb (especially the one with the bacon). I found that the cheese fondues were all sharp and strong in taste. I wish they offered something a little milder. If I had to choose my favourite cheese fondue, I would pick the one with the mushrooms. The meat was very tasty, as well as the veggies. I liked how they offered the little potatoes to dip in the fondues!!! The dessert was my favourite part. I definitely enjoyed the white chocolate over the dark, but both were great!!

3 STARS for the restaurant: very tiny and intimate 

3 1/2 STARS for the food: This place isn't bad. I would come back!!
author: Cnn F.

description: Fondue everything! If you like melted cheese and chocolate then this is the place to go. I dipped fruits and a variety of meats into their selection of cheeses and boom! heaven... I don't have much to say because there is nothing to complain about. Yeah, it's a little pricey, but well worth it!  =)
author: Jingee M.

description:
Very affordable fondue that anyone can enjoy...... unless you're not a cheese fan.  

The Quickdraw
-Manchego, White wine, Roasted Red Puree, Roasted Garlic

The Rawhide
-Italian Dolce Gorgonzola, Emmenthaler, White wine base, Bacon, 
Roasted Garlic

To be honest, I couldn't tell too much of a difference between the two.  Why?  I was distracted with some work related stuff that had me rushing through the meal.  What I did notice?  The variety of sides they provide.

Baby pickles, apple slices, grapes, miscellaneous breads, roasted potatoes, olives, and broccoli.  They seem to provide these without limitation.  As long as you've got the cheese to dip, they'll keep'em coming.  Cool?  Very cool!

My favorite side?  baby pickles for sure.  They had the perfect sourness to them while still possessing its crunchy essence.  

The ambiance was... nice.  Slightly dim, but not too dark.  The atmosphere felt warm, the service was spectacular.  Our server was friendly, funny, and just always in tune with what we needed.  

Dessert:
Happy Trails
-Dark chocolate with Cayenne
--Amazing.  Served with sourdough and chocolate bread, grapes, strawberries, kiwi, bananas, and other various fruits, I couldn't enjoy fondue anymore than I was.

I was amazed with the collective effort by the wait staff and kitchen and how great of a dining experience they provided.  Truly a great fondue outing, exceeding that of The Melting Pot on sheer price alone.  

4 Stars.
author: Johnson N.

description:
This is definitely one of my favorite relatively new restaurants in SF. I've been there three times now and have enjoyed my meal every time.

This is not your typical fondue place. It's clean, contemporary and it's a great place to take anyone -- your out of town guests, your kids (if they're out of infant/toddler age), or a date.

I've had two different cheese fondues and two different chocolate fondues, and recommend all of them. The Traditional is one of their best, and the dark chocolate dessert fondue is out of this world.
author: Lynn F.

description:
Not bad.  Not bad at all.
Have been a long-time fondue virgin, despite many attempts to get to Matterhorn.  
Ambiance is minimalist, but tasteful.  Wasn't fond of the "ottoman" seating, though.
Nice wine list.
And contrary to my first impression, it was quite a filling meal.  Two of us split a salad, a Traditional, and a dessert.

The cheese was delicious.  Although they were tasty on their own,  I'm not sure about dipping olives or gherkins in the pot.

The white chocolate dessert was a little too thick, as if it were simply melted chocolate and not any additional cream to thin it out a bit.  Thus the bottom burned in the pot as we were eating.

Overall though, it was a nice experience, and even with a bottle of wine, quite affordable.
author: Ken B.

description: Great atmosphere, friendly staff, delicious food at a reasonable price for what you get. What else can you ask for?  Not many tables so make a reservation.
author: Jason p.

description:
I would rate this restaurant more like 3 1/2.  

I love the concept.  They have taken a traditional dish and updated it a little by adding more things to dip with such as vegetables, pickles and olives (for the savory fondues), madelines, melons and other various fruits (for the sweet fondues). I went with a group and had a total of 6 fondues.  We also ordered two types of salad which I am happy to say that iceberg lettuce was not used.  The four cheese fondues were good.  They would have been excellent if they reduced the alcohol in the fondue by cooking it a little longer.  However, the two sweet fondues were fantastic.  This turned out to be a great group restaurant since we were able to order a variety of fondues as opposed to being on a date, you would most likely choose one (or two for dessert).
author: Jay A.

description:
Not bad! We tried all 5 of the savory and both of the sweet fondues, two salads and the meat plate. Loved The Outlaw -- a spicy white cheddar fondue and the dark chocolate (also had a kick like mexican hot chocolate). 

Great assortment of veggies to dip including purple cauliflower and cornichon ... LOVE. Too bad the portions of each savory fondue are kinda small to share with a large group... for two ppl, one fondue is fine.

Atmosphere is very Mission hipstery, though much sleepier because of it's neighboring highway locale. Parking was easy albeit a bit sketchy, but totally fine on an early weekday eve.

As far as bang for the buck, seemed pretty reasonable. Overall, not to die for, but fun for a birthday party or date. Really friendly staff, too!
author: Lauren H.

description:
1st time fondue experience, so would have to be a fan of it unless it completely flopped. 

advice: make reservations - even if it's Sunday night, at 6:30pm & there's only 4 of you...we got the last 4 seats, at the bar, due to a large party reservation. So, better safe than waiting a while...which fondue can take! 

4 girls, 2 of us on our 1st time fondue experience. Opted for 2 cheese fondues, 2 salads & 2 chocolate fondues. 
Savory:
-manchego & tomatoes - pretty yummy. the cheese was bold but not overly so, the veg/fruit/bread paired nicely with it.
-french compte w/ mushrooms - needed more mushroom flavor. the cheese was ok. don't know much about french cheese.
-waiter's favorite: gorgonzola w/ bacon...apparently not too salty & the bacon adds a nice touch. maybe i'll be adventurous next time.

Salads:
-beet salad - yummy! order it - order 1 just for yourself. Golden beets which were cooked perfectly.
-fennel & apple salad - let down. 3 slices of extremely thin apple, some bits of fennel & arugula. pass on it & order another beet salad!

Sweet: whoever reviewed the white chocolate w/ balsamic raspberry swirl & the milk chocolate w/ walnuts were deliciousness in a bowl...was absolutely right. 
-white chocolate w/ balsamic raspberry swirl - i don't even like white chocolate (too over processed; mainly sugar w/ no real cacao bean left) but i was floored by how good this was! my friend & i were digging it out w/ our coffee spoons! it did get a bit thick by the end...kind of coagulated on the sides of the bowl
-milk chocolate w/ walnuts - nuts sunk to the bottom which made it even better to dunk the fruit/bread in & dig 'em out! completely not expecting how good that milk chocolate was going to be, even after reading the reviews...good job fondue cowboy!
-waiter's favorite sweet: milk chocolate w/ nuts
-will have to try the dark chocolate (my favorite) w/ cayenne (not my favorite!) next time.

i think the 4 barrel french press could have used another minute or 2 in its steeping, but i'll let that fly.

overall: service was very good & attentive. bartender knew his stuff. love the wine on tap aspect although i didn't partake. sweet fondues were the best - would take them over the cheese fondues any day. the place is tiny, tiny, tiny. only open about a month now but seems to be doing well. good to have some variety close the mission.
author: Marissa H.

description:
This was a marvelous find in SOMA. Great service, yummy fondues, and the accompanying veggies, fruit, and bread were out of sight! 

Wine on tap was unique and desserts were tempting but I passed.
author: David G.

description: This place is amazing. Everything on the menu is delicious and the staff is super friendly and attentive. My husband and I come here on special occasions and we are never disappointed!
author: Sarah C.

description:
Prices here are what really set it apart, for what you get this place is a bargain, especially compared with Melting Pot or La Fondue.  The food here is really really good too, easily on par.  They sell wine by the bottle at almost at MSRP prices and the mixed drinks are very good as well.  

The interior is pretty minimalist but it's cool looking nonetheless, and the service is friendly.  The reasonable prices and quality are what really elevate this place to 5 stars.
author: Scott S.

description:
It boggles my mind that people would compare this place to the Melting Pot or be hungry after have $30 worth of food here. 

First of all, I've been there twice now: first time I shared a cheese fondue and two sides (salad and meat plate) and we didn't have room for dessert.   The second time we shared a cheese fondue (manchego and red pepper one) got a salad each and then split a dark chocolate fondue even though I barely had room - we couldn't finish it!  

The food is yummy, the service was excellent both times and we sat at the bar because it was the weekend both times but it was fine - it's easier to share sitting side by side if there are only two of you anyway.

It turns out the first time I was there I forgot my jacket, and even though it was three weeks later, the second time I was there they recognized me and brought out my jacket!  No place that has bad service would have done that!

I'm a fan and I'll be back!  Gotta try the cheese and mushroom fondue and the white chocolate next time.  Maybe I'll need to bring more people with me so that I'm no so stuffed!
author: Asya K.

description:
My friend and I had dinner there last night.  It was my second time.  During my first visit. like others mentioned, the Traditional fondue was watery but the rest of the experience was worth a second try.  I wrote an e-mail to their main contact and made some suggestions.  

So at this second visit, I am happy to say, the Traditional Fondue was perfect.  The nutmeg, the wine, the cheeses were perfectly balanced and with excellent consistency and flavor.  

The fondues are wonderful!  The Milk Chocolate one is heavenly!  All the trimmings are generous and creative!  Keep up the good work.  

Nice ambiance, music, patrons,  wines, service all great!

Dan was a great server.  Can't wait to go back... 

**Not kid friendly?  I think WELL BEHAVED older children would love it!  Maybe at another location in the near future?
author: Emilia G.

description: AMAZING!!!! How can you go wrong with bread, sausage and more dipped in cheese? I love this place. It is small, so be sure to make a reservation if you are coming on a Friday or Saturday night. I love the cheddar cheese one with the sausage plate. SO GOOD! I also really like the salads they have. And of course the dessert fondue is delicious! If you haven't been here, GO NOW!
author: Holly L.

description:
Excited that there is cool fondue joint in town. I love cheese! I truly love cheese and could eat it all day long.
I went opening day so it was bit crazy.  I thought the service was great and food was delicious. 

What we ate:
Quickdraw -- yum
The Traditional - yum
Happy Trails -- ok
Roasted Beet Salad - yum
Mixed Greens, Roasted Pear and Gorgonzola - yum
author: Rachna P.

description: Went here on all hallows eve with my boy Paulie as cow pokes. There was one other couple and we didn't get so much as a free shot of beer!  We were dressed as cowboys go damn it! Did I mention it was all hallows eve?!? At least the food was better than anything cooked over a camp fire.
author: Eric J.

description: Delicious fondue and cozy atmosphere. Definitely save room for the dessert! They also have gluten free options
author: Yemsrach T.

description:
Yee haw! 3 girls + 4 fondues= total awesomeness.

Fondue cowboy rocks. Went on Friday after work, so can't really comment on the huge wait that others have mentioned- there wasn't any, but when we left it was pretty packed.

Service was great. Kyle was our server and he was super cute, friendly, and fun. The sommelier sat down with us for a few minutes, let us sample some wine, and suggested a great wine that he hadn't even put on the menu yet.  Me likey!

The fondue is where it gets hot. I love pots of melted cheese. I love to dip things in said melted cheese. Cheesy heaven. It was SOOO delicious. We started with 2 cheese fondues and moved onto a 3rd because we just couldn't get enough. Then we had a chocolate. More dipping. I don't even love chocolate, but that chocolate cayenne was amazing! Admittedly, it was a lot. Maybe even too much. Maybe...

Cant wait to go back. Next time I won't eat so much that I'm passed out in a cheesy food coma by 9pm on a Friday night.
author: Stephanie R.

description:
Did you hear about the three-alarm fire in San Francisco yesterday afternoon?  The fire started less than 24 hours after my sister and I finished our dinner at Fondue Cowboy.  Even I would say that's just a little suspicious.

We made a reservation for 7 pm and showed up a few minutes early.  We had a choice of 2 tables, and we opted for the one closest to the kitchen.  There was nothing unusual about the table, except for a settee-like bench on the right, separating our table from a wooden barrel with an old saddle on top.  Yep, business as usual.  The LCD TV hanging behind the bar showed old westerns, and the walls were covered with wood.  It's as if an old saloon woke up and one day and decided to be "metro."  I liked it.

My last fondue experience was at The Melting Pot (http://www.yelp.com/biz/the-melting-pot-san-mateo#hrid:WOkgHqb1R8Bfq-8KBo4xiA).  I enjoyed it immensely, despite the fact it was an overpriced, mass produced fondue.  Come on, people: it's dipping stuff in cheese, hot oil and chocolate.  Who doesn't love it?  I was hoping for a more sophisticated experience at Fondue Cowboy, and I am happy to say: mission accomplished.

We ordered 2 salads to start: the white bean salad and the roasted beet salad.  The salads were light and refreshing, with just the right amount of dressing.  It's amazing how much you get for $8, and I would have been totally happy splitting the salad.  It's big enough for two.  We then ordered The Outlaw, which, according to Yelp, was the way to go.  The Outlaw features melted aged cheddar with a splash of beer, a hint of roasted garlic and tomatoes, as well as a dash of cilantro.  It had a very unique flavor, which made dipping stuff in cheese far more sophisticated.  We had plenty of stuff to dip: (bread, mushrooms, olives, pickles, broccoli, grapes, apples, fingerling potatoes).  I also opted for the $8 sausage plate.  It was a thinly sliced andouille sausage, and it was delicious. $8 was a bit aggressive for one sausage though.   Aside from olives, everything else tasted surprisingly great.  Our waiter (the owner?) informed us that he could bring us more veggies, but what we needed was more cheese.  Perhaps we didn't do a good job of dipping, but we had veggies left after the cheese was long.

For dessert, we shared a High Noon fondue, which was a white chocolate fondue with balsamic strawberry puree.  It tasted like strawberry compote to me, but I am sure the chef knows best.  For our dipping pleasure, we had a variety of fruit (strawberries, kiwi, bananas and mandarin slices), as well as a less healthy plate of cut p chocolate loaf, Madeleines, and homemade marshmallows.  Aside from being almost too sweet, it was a perfect way to end an evening of dipping.

Serve fondue in slightly bigger ramekins (is that what those things are called?), and you've got yourself a repeat customer.  Mmmm, I wish I had some melted cheese right now.
author: Yan G.

description:
Opening night (admittedly early so we didn't see the crowds).  How can I go wrong with cheese, chocolate & cowboys?

A perfect strawberry mojito made with wine, meat plate & cheese fondue for two of us.  The music was quiet enough we could just sit at the bar and chat (actually two girls, we were probably blabbering away at a million miles an hour) and we could actually hear each other.

I wish I had left some room for the chocolate fondue, there was a kid with his parents with chocolate all over his face who looked like he was in heaven.

This is a great drinks and snacks/light meal bar. 

So happy you have opened in the neighborhood, I will be back with some friends who were excited to try out a place called fondue cowboy!
author: D B.

description:
I wish I could give this restaurant a review on its food.  Unfortunately, the owner cancelled my reservation for 30 people the day we were supposed to eat there, via voicemail.  So I'm just going to use this opportunity to point out a few flaws in the customer service I received leading up to the evening we were supposed to eat there.

Now, I'll fully take ownership of the fact that I didn't confirm the day or two before, but I honestly didn't think I needed to.  I'd offered to give David (owner) a credit card to hold the reservation when I made it a month in advance, which he told me was unneccessary.  I also called him 6 days before the reservation to see if we could squeeze a few extra people in, and told him I would absolutely cap it at that number and call if anyone bailed.  He did leave a message a few days later to confirm numbers, but unfortunately I didn't get it.  So he called again at 10 am the day of saying that he hadn't heard from me, so he was giving away my tables.

When I called a few hours before the reservation, the owner was actually antagonistic.  "You should have confirmed with me; this isn't my fault."  When I said, "I'm sorry, I'm just trying to understand what's happening.  There's no reason to be combative."  He responded "I'm not being combative; I'm being perfectly reasonable."  It went on in that vein, but I was too stunned to remember the details.  Except I do remember the conversation ended with him saying, "I'm sorry; I don't have time to deal with you.  It's busy here." Click.

Now, on principle, I'm never going to eat here.  I am a lady, and I don't intend to subject myself to similar treatment if I can avoid it.  Similarly, on principle, my dinner club (the 30 people who were going to eat there, as well as the 50 other members of the club who weren't able to attend) will never eat there.  

All of this would have been perfectly forgivable (I'm a Christian woman, after all), had the owner not flown off the handle when I called to clarify what was happening (I mean, really, who says "It's not my fault" if they don't actually think that a situation is, kind of, their fault?).  I work in an industry that deals heavily in customer service; and when something goes wrong with one of my clients, I apologize, even if I truly believe the issue is completely their fault... even if I believe them to be total morons...  I also try to find a way to help them.  This guy could have said "I'm so sorry, but I couldn't risk an empty night at the restaurant.  Since I didn't hear from you, I got nervous and gave away your tables.  Let me recommend a few other places in the area you might try.  If you find one to accommodate you, let me know which one it is, so I can direct your guests there if they end up here."

So I suppose my only feedback would be to call and confirm your reservations to this place two days before, or else they won't necessarily mean anything.  Or just don't take large groups there.  Take them to 21st Amendment, which scrambled to find a way to take us when we explained our situation, sat us all near each other, and didn't allow any employee or owner to raise his/her voice to me.
author: Emy D.

description: Found a living social deal for this place and was excited since I had heard about this place. Decided to stop in without a reservation and were quickly seated (it got busy later). I like this place a lot. The food was good, although the portions of cheese do not match the amount of dipping items they give you...for the price they should be more generous (this is why 4 stars and not 5). The front of the house manager was great! He made good suggestions and provided unobtrusive but attentive service. The Dark Chocolate Cayenne desert was good and there was plenty of chocolate to go with the dipping options. It's a good place, good food, comfortable but trendy atmosphere, and good service, they need to either adjust the pricing a bit or offer enough cheese to match the dipping items, other then that it's a win!
author: Jill T.

description: Great food, yummy chocolate.  Was surprised the beef was already cooked.  Such good cheese.  Really worth a visit.
author: Robyn R.

description:
Came here on a Sunday around 6pm.  Though happy hour had ended about 7 minutes before, they gave us happy hour prices - yay!!  50% off is pretty frikken sweet!

Our entree was the cheese with bacon (can't remember the western-y name), the sausage plate, and the steak plate.  I got the beet salad to start. For dessert we shared the milk chocolate with walnuts.

I really liked the beet salad, but it could have had a little more goat cheese.  I also found it a bit hard to eat because the long ends of the lettuces kept sticking out, like un-bendy pasta.  I'd have appreciated a butter knife to chop the greens a little smaller.

The cheese fondue was ok-to-good, but the bacon and garlic were kind of non-players.  I couldn't taste them.  I just tasted cheese with wine in it.  The portions are indeed small, but mostly tasty.  I don't get the cornichons or kalamatas, personally.  Pickles and winey cheese...uh no thanks.  The steak was yummy, even without covering it in cheese.  

Overall, the entree is decent, and totally worth the happy hour price of $12.  

For me though, the dessert was the star.  I'm probably going to go back for dessert, with a special friend, and let the creamy sexy chocolate start some magic. :-)

My only issue with the dessert was that the spot right over the candle flame got kind of burned, and in other parts of the pot the chocolate cooled a bit and got clumpy.  A more even heater would be appreciated.

I think its a nicely put-together establishment, but I don't "get" the melty European cheese meets John Wayne thing.  Whaaaat?  I don't rightly know what cowboys have to do with Fondue, pardner.  It's pretty, but a little...weird.
author: Mel B.

description:
I was really looking forward to trying Fondue Cowboy so perhaps my expectations were inflated but net net I thought it was just OK. I feel generous by giving it three stars but I think it has potential and the service was good so want to give it the benefit of the doubt and hope they work through new restaurant jitters.

When I called to check in on how long the wait was the gentleman who answered the phone was very welcoming and friendly however our server was a bit lackluster especially considering the place wasn't too busy.

As this was our first visit we asked for recommendations and were pretty disappointed with the results. We started with a side spinach salad that had a bit too much dressing. For the savory fondue, the alcohol dominated the fondue and it was hard to enjoy the cheese and spices. We did get a variety of food to dip but not worth a $17 price tag. After the first two dishes we didn't have a whole lot of confidence to even try dessert.

Perhaps will give it another go in a few months.
author: Brianna R.

description: This was my second trip to Fondue Cowboy and it is a fun little place. Had the Outlaw Cheese and the Dark Chocolate fondue. Also had the meet plate, but think the sausage is a better choice. Overall it is amazing how something so simple can be so good. The fondues are tasty and adequate to fill up two people. A great place to eat and talk while enjoying good company.
author: Jim H.

description:
What do Italy, Switzerland and the USA have in common?  They may not all be NATO members, but what's important is that they have joined together to manifest: 

FONDUE COWBOY :
Brought to you by Italian Spaghetti Westerns, Swiss Fondue, and American Western Cowboy images.  Not the most intuitive of partnerships, (and perhaps not the most politically important,) I grant you, but a winning combination nevertheless.  They have a very simple menu, so be forewarned: you pretty much have to like cheese fondue to be sated here.  The fondue options are fairly standard, but perfectly executed.  My favorite is the Quick Draw (with Manchego & White Wine) and Happy Trails (dark chocolate with cayenne) for dessert.  They serve the obligatory bread, but also a lovely sampler of other dippers including olives, apples, grapes, cornichons and so forth.  Fondue portions are quite small (1-2 people per pot), but that works well if you like trying a variety of fundue.  Service is 5-stars.  Very social and friendly, with plenty of great recommendations.  Our waiter on Sunday handled our party with easy grace and style in this sexy, low-lit restaurant.

All in all, a delightful rendition of the proverbial melting pot and also a literal one.
author: Ravena F.

description: This place is like.....Great  appetizers....but......NO MAIN COURSE!  The cheese fondues are yummy...but.....a little platter of raw veggies, and cubes of bread do not make for a very filling dinner.  Too bad they don't do meat fondues...Even if you can't have pots of hot oil on the tables...They could serve already cooked meats....with different sauces to dip them in. We also ordered the Meat Platter.  A plate of very thinly sliced cured meats...If you piled them up, it would be less than an eighth of an inch.  Still...not filling.  Too much money for what you get.  We ended up grabbing a hamburger an hour later. This place is more for girls,  I guess...
author: Bryan M.

description: Great food and service. Loved the traditional fondue and goat cheese one was definitely interesting and tasty. Portion sizes are deceptive - a lot more dipping than you first think. Good pairing with wine. Worth trying.
author: Todd M.

description: -1 Hunger pains! I had a great dinner here with friends for a birthday party. However, one star taken off for our reservation time being 8:30 and us not getting seated until 9:45. Bummer!
author: Honest Y.

description: Cool and cozy. They should turn the subtitles on for the movies they are playing, but when you want cheap fondue(and dont feel like making it) I would definitly recommend this place. Reasonable prices, reasonably good fondue. The service is awesome! Drinks arent bad, but could be waaay better. If I am ever in a pinch for fondue and happen to be in the neighborhood, I might come back.
author: Nelson S.

description:
Went with 3 girlfriends on a Tue evening and we had a great time. Every table was packed, but it's a small place, so that's really only maybe 8 tables. We got a 1/2 carafe of wine, 3 cheese fondues and a chocolate one for dessert and were stuffed by the end. We liked all 3 cheese fondues and scraped the bottom of the dishes, and the amount of dippers they give you is perfect for 4 females. It might look like a small dish, but it's actually quite a bit of cheese!
Our service was perfect. Our waiter was friendly and attentive and with wine, cheese and dessert with 20% tip, we still only paid $22 a person. For SF I'd say that's very reasonable! I definitely want to go back and take my boyfriend. It's a cute date spot.
author: Ramey M.

description:
Anybody who says they don't like this restaurant must not like fondue, because this is one of the best fondue restaurants I've been to in San Francisco.  I loved the setting (very modern, the bar had old Clint movies playing on the tv, it was small and very nice).  And even better than the food and ambiance was the service.

Me and my sister went to this restaurant and were helped by a young woman by the name of Lauren.  This server was attentive and helpful, but wasn't over-bearing.  Even if the food was horrible, her service would have made me love it because she was so kind.
When me and my sister found a phone on one of the seats, we left it at the table rather than take it with us.  After we left the restaurant, Lauren ran after us after we were already a block away.  We told her the situation, and to this day are impressed by her.  Next time I come in, I'll be sure to ask if Lauren is working for two reasons, 1) I know I will have a good time and good dinner if she is serving, and 2) her small act of kindness (running after me and my sister when she thought one of us forgot our phones) made a huge impression.

I highly recommend you ask for Lauren if you go in.
And if you read this Lauren, thank you for your sublime service!
author: Joey T.

description: Went in for the first time with a Groupon certificate after a day at the spa hoping for a nice night out to dinner with my girlfriend. We knew what we wanted when we went in and ordered right away. My salad came first and when I was done, the cheese portion was pretty slow in coming. I could forgive that if what happened next hadn't occurred: we then proceeded to wait 35 minutes for our dessert. We waited a good 20 minutes for the 1 waitress in the restaurant to come over and reveal to us that she didn't remember we ordered the dessert. It then took another 15-20 minutes for our dessert to come out. The food was okay, but I've had far better. nowhere near worth waiting over a half hour for. Service is everything, and this restaurant is heavily lacking.
author: Jessi M.

description:
Already elated because I was meeting someone for a first date, my expectations were high. It had been a while since I'd had fondue, so I can say excitement was definitely a factor. 
My date recommended the pear salad. I agreed to try it; because I've made this salad at home several times. A bed of baby greens (arugula, spinach) lightly bathed in vinaigrette, accompanied by feta cheese and seared pear slices. The salad was crisp, vibrant in both colors and flavors. It was tasty for what it was, but I mean one of the most simple salads. Ever. 
We then shared a Swiss cheese fondue plate complete with cubes of bread, apple, potatoes, grapes and broccoli (those weren't cubed). The portion of one plate will serve two, unless you are famished and don't like sharing. 
I'm giving Fondue Cowboy 3 stars because nothing about it stood out to me. It was good; but I've had better fondue elsewhere. The service was good, but I felt a little rushed (it was later in the evening and the kitchen was near closed). 
I probably would come back if I lived in Soma, but I don't.
author: Alyssa G.

description: A girlfriend and I came here for dinner a few nights ago. We shared the Rawhide for dinner with the sausage appetizer along with a couple of glasses of wine each and Happy Trails for dessert and left absolutely stuffed. Each fondue has a generous serving of sides (potatoes, breads, veggies, etc.) so while the actual cheese may look like not that much, you end up gorging yourself. We were seated at the bar and the bartender was very friendly and helpful. I would recommend reservations since it does get pretty full (even on a wednesday night when we went).
author: Maja Z.

description: This place is like a little slice of heaven.  5 distinctly different cheese fondues, a charcuterie plate that will knock your socks off, a great selection of wines, yummy salads and then you get to the chocolate.  We tried Happy Trails which has cayenne in it.  I thought it was fantastic and I'm not a huge chocolate person.  You get so many great little things to dip your fondue in, bread, little dill pickles, olives, potatoes and brocoli.  They should rename this place FONDUE HEAVEN!  Thanks guys - xoxo
author: Christine E.

description:
4.5 stars.

finally a good fondue option in the city (and i don't count matterhorn as good).  we looked at the menu and thought that we had to try this place out.  it's pretty non-descript from the outside as we circle the block twice before actually finding it.  the setting for the place is kinda a contemporary old school western bar if that makes any sense.  the big flat screen behind the bar was playing the good, the bad and the ugly which i fits the cowboy motif.  i'm still not sure how fondue and cowboy are connected but that didn't matter...

we let the fondue do the talking.  the pricing is pretty darn good for what you get and while the fondue pots look small, they hold a deceiving amount of cheese/chocolate.  we didn't know this before ordering though.

we got 2 cheese fondues to start, the outlaw and the stage coach.  the outlaw was a cheddar fondue with jalapenos, tomatoes and garlic.  the stage coach was a compte fondue with white wine and garlic.  both were incredibly flavorful with the stage coach taking the edge.  the food to dip into the cheese was quite good too.  asides from the usual suspects of bread and veggies, they also gave some roasted potatoes which were cooked and seasoned well.  they later told us that they would being using that when they opened up for brunch.

for dessert we got the buck-a-roo which was a milk chocolate fondue with walnuts.  the usual assortment of goodies was given along w/ chocolate bread which we felt didn't really do much.  the fondue itself was great but we really struggled getting thru because of the 2 cheese offerings we had gotten.

i do wish that they had a meat fondue course but i guess that would take away from the lounge feel and elongate dinner service.  overall, we were happy and like the fact that we have a spot to grab some quick fondue in the city.
author: Swarup B.

description: Small, dimly lit, decent fondue.  Our experience was pleasant enough, but neither delicious nor amazing.   It was fine.
author: Jill D.

description: Let me start by saying I tried to go the first time without a reservation...BIG mistake, which I take responsibility for, but when we walked in and the guy behind the bar found out we had no rese...he was just sorta rude about informing us that we were S.O.L. Moving on...to the night I did make a rese and did eat here...it was just ok. The fondue I make is much better and my sides are way better. I went with a friend who has been here before and she recommended we order salads first...which I highly agree with. Two pots of cheese fondue (or a cheese and a chocolate dessert fondue) would have been waaaayyyy too much. So we ordered the manchengo cheese fondue and it was enjoyable but nothing to write home about. The salad was good...probably my fav part of the meal. Our service was fine. So all in all...everything was not horrible but just ok.
author: Susan G.

description:
fondue places... this is the first i've been to.

i expected the giant pot of fondue you see in the shows about the 60's and 70's.
not what they have and after eating, not what is necessary.

They come out with just enough to leave you satisfied.

An interesting note I overheard one of the employees say about the hardware they use to keep the fondue hot. it is all hand made by a friend of the owner or something. which means you wont get the same set up anywhere else.

I say check it out. you can get sliced meats or sausages for extra, but and fondue pot comes with fruit and breads and such.
author: Ross K.

description: Came here on a busy saturday night and was greeted by an extremely friendly guy who looked like he was playing the roles of host, bartender, waiter, and busser.  He informed us they were fully booked that night, but if we wanted to wait around for a few minutes we could grab a spot at the bar and would be offered the full menu.  The fondues all had an interesting, rustic quality with the use of bacon, different spices, and cheeses.  The prices were reasonable and the additional meat plate we ordered was superb.  The wine / beer list is very expansive and local, while still being reasonably inexpensive.  Definitely worth checking out if you're in the area.
author: Phil K.

description:
I would say 3.5 stars. Cool concept, great space (although quite small) and delish drink selection. The menu all sounded really appealing too, but as someone who lived in Switzerland for 2 years, I wasn't expecting traditional fondue and luckily that's not really what I got.

I liked the different flavors on the menu, but we made the mistake of ordering the simplest version, which was bland and not the least bit exciting. The Quick Draw was pretty good and had a lot more flavor. I would definitely recommend getting the more exciting versions as the basic ones leave a lot to be desired.

Overall, it's a fun place for friends to eat, but felt a bit incomplete. We ordered 2 salads to share between 4 (perfect for 4) and then 2 fondues with the veg and sausage. It wasn't that we were still super hungry when done, but it just didn't really feel like a complete meal.
author: Lauren M.

description: Wonderful food, service and decor. The menu is simple. Grab a salad before the fondue and it will feed two!
author: Jefferson L.

description: We had an awesome experience here.  My son turned 10 and requested fondue.  I am sure that this isn't a place where kids come regularly, so I was bracing myself for looks from the servers when I brought my 7 & 10 year old in for an early dinner.  I couldn't have been more pleasantly surprised! Our server was fantastic - he went out of his way to make this an enjoyable evening.  He even gave us the White Chocolate Fondue (High Noon) on the house for my son's birthday - his recommendation- and it was the BEST. We had the Outlaw & another one with mushrooms I don't see on the menu.  Both were super yummy.  I do wish they gave us more of the homemade marshmallows because those were the most popular.  A bit pricey for a light meal, but the experience was worth it!
author: stephany m.

description:
I know it is still a slow opening, but I walked out after standing at the entrance ignored by the bartender and waitress for ~ 10 minutes..  Apparently, there was a host/owner sitting hidden at the bar, but I had no idea until someone in the know walked in, past me, to whomever this clipboard-meister was who could not be bothered to visit the front of the house or a customer standing there with his thumb up his butt, came back, and I overheard her saying there was a 1 hour wait.  

Not an auspicious start.
author: Colin A.

description: This might be an ok place to have a couple drinks, but terrible place to have "real food". If you would like to pay $20 for something that worths probably $3 to make, feel free. Remember to bring extra cash to buy some real food after eating there.
author: Zj H.

description:
Not a very large place so we called ahead for reservations.  

The ambiance was pleasant, nice decor to go with the theme of the restaurant.  Service was fantastic!  Kyle was super friendly and made great recommendations.  

Two cheeses, a bottle of wine, and a salad all for about $70 between two couples.  We tried the outlaw and the quickdraw.  Both with very strong flavors and very tasty.  The roasted beet salad was delicious.  The dippers for the cheeses were good:  bread, potatoes, cornichons, apples, and broccoli.  And we got refills on all the dippers we wanted.  

We enjoyed the meal enough to go back a second time the following week with family.  

The food and service were equally good the second time around.  My only complaint was the dippers for the chocolate.  Mostly fruit and bread again.  I would have loved to dip some marshmallows or cookies or other non-fruit dippers.  We made our request, so hopefully they'll have some new dippers next time around!  

And we will go back.
author: Nivita S.

description: Ok- I admit it! I procrastinated before going to Fondue Cowboy. My mom's fondue parties in the 1970s ruined me (so I thought) on the fondue experience! Anyway- the fondues are a huge HIT! The chocolate (with cayenne) almost made me weep! Do not walk to Fondue Cowboy- RUN! Bring some friends so you can split a couple of cheese fondues- but leave room for the chocolate fondue after wards!
author: Darrin D.

description: I TOTALLY gotta come back to try each and every fondue on the menu! !st we were asked to sit at the bar but because of the inconvenience, the server bought out first round of drinks... I had a living social deal to spend $40, so we actually spent $82, paid $42 - $24 for the fondue of choice (feeds 2), with bread, potatoes, apples, olives, mini dill pickles; $8 for a side of sliced hot links, and a bottle of the Savignon Blanc... we were stuffed and very happy.
author: Alyssa Z.

description:
my boyfriend and i showed up here around 8:15PM last saturday night. i was in need of some cheesey goodness to help with a champagne hangover. the bartender was actually our server. he was very attentive and always made sure we were taken care of.

we had two fondues and the white choco strawberry for dessert. we were pretty full at the end and couldn't finish the dessert but i have to say - potatoes + cheese = amazing.

i really want to try the chocolate walnut fudge....
author: laura f.

description: Outlaw and sausage are awesome! And don't pass up dessert chocolate sourdough.
author: Scot L.

description: This place is cool. A small and cozy place decorated with the best gay style. That is, perfect taste. It is a cool place for a date. At the beginning the portions look small, but my girlfriend and I had enough food with a appetizer and a fondue. There is a screen playing B&W cowboy movies too. When I was there, Clint Eastwood was killing bad boys without stop.
author: Javi V.

description: A super cute place that will help the beautification of soma beyond 5th street. The food however doesn't justify the $17 price tag. The savory fondue contains too much soju (or whatever alcohol is in it)  and the dessert fondue feels like a lake of corn fructose syrup. A really great place with phenomenal potential that doesn't deliver.
author: Fred F.

description: Great place, great environment.  Cheese were very tasteful, and service was great.  Fruits were very fresh as well.
author: Zhiyu L.

description:
Perfect place for a small birthday get together! Came her for a friends bday around 8 on a Wed. There was only one other group there, and it was their bday too! 

The place is super cute! Very rustic cowboy with an urban twist. They play westerns on the big screen behind the bar.

The fondues are to die for and the pots seem small but it gladly leaves room for dessert!!! 

It's all just cheesy goodness!

Great cocktails too! i love the lychee! 

We got the dark chocolate w/ the cayenne pepper and it was the highlight of the meal. The chocolate bread is AMAZING!!! i originally thought that it would be gross, but the wonderful crunchy crust and chocolate chips running through it makes it the perfect dipper!

Can't wait to go back!
author: stephanie c.

description: Got a call from a college friend who said he was in town, and I decided we should try this place out.  I was excited to come here.  They sat us at the bar since all the tables were reserved.  For about 15 seconds after sitting down, I felt a little awkward - the thought of sitting cozily side by side, sharing a pot of fondue - sounded more like a date night than a "let's go hang out with a college brah" kind of place.  And then I got over it, ordered a beer, one fondue and a plate of meat to share, and was a happy clam the rest of the night.
author: Ernest S.

description: Love love LOVE this place.  The cheese and dessert fondues are amazing, the ambiance is lovely, and the people who work there are the best.  It is our go-to neighborhood restaurant whenever we have some small victory to celebrate.  The prices do make it a special-occasions-only place for us and while there is a part of me that wishes it were a little less pricey, my waistline is glad that we can't afford to eat there whenever we feel like it.  Everybody wins.
author: Rebecca W.

description: Cute room, great service, and excellent food. We shared a salad (mixed greens with gorgonzola and roasted pear), a cheese fondue (traditional), the "High Noon" chocolate fondue (dark chocolate with cayenne), and a 1/2 carafe of wine, and left completely full and completely satisfied for under $60. Yeehaw.
author: Ziad E.

description: Went with a bunch of friends and had a great time. You get like 4 or 5 choices of what kind of cheese dips you want. They were all good but a couple of them tasted kinda the same. While the place is really small (it has an awesome decor) it's a great place to go with a group of people.  The place also has a cool bar to hang out and have some wine (free-flow). Both the bartender and the server were great. I would definitely check this place out
author: Jerry G.

description: Tried Fondue Cowboy on a whim and was more than pleasantly surprised.  I liked the vibe of the restaurant, calm but still cool.  Although I thought the portions seemed small at first, I realized that it was really perfect considering the richness of the main course.  Service was exceptional (as was the dessert).  I will be back again.
author: Roberta B.
