description: it was ok. we love love love fondue and had to give this a try. a nifty place for some date-night nibbles but not enough options for a real dinner. they make the fondue from scratch for each order which is amazing since i have a garlic allergy and they were able to leave it out no problem. for the two of us we ordered 2 salads, 2 fondues and the meat plate, and it came with a good portion of dippers. it was plenty of food and the salads were outstanding - with a couple glasses of wine the bill came to $125. waitstaff was exceptionally nice but i wouldn't necessarily say it was 'good service' since we were kept waiting a lot. We'd come back for a snack but when we're craving fondue again we'll go back to the Swiss Chalet.
author: Loralyn S.

description:
Our servers did a great job with such a large party.  They were very tentative and helped explain dishes well.  

Portions are so small.  We left hungry.  Food tasted great but it's a bit pricey for what you get.

The decore is lovely.  The cowboy theme is really fun.
author: Alisha B.

description: Very fun place for dinner and has a very cool, intimate atmosphere. We had a fantastic dinner for 11 people here through Grubwithus and would highly recommend it for large groups. The food was fantastic and it is vegetarian-friendly. My favorite was the chocolate fondue dessert! They also offer half-off draft beers from 5-6pm and have a great selection of import and domestic beers.
author: Vicki J.

description: My husband is a creature of habit, so every time we go there (and I am not going to admit how much) we get an Outlaw and a Buckaroo at the same time. (Don't judge until you try it... and you should try it with the wine on tap which is also awesome.)
author: Emily N.

description: This was an unexpected find!  Great hip spot for fondue!  Loved it.  Great service.
author: Liss J.

description:
Fondue Cowboy = Delish.

I personally  prefer that the menu is not brewing over with a million choices so that the first 30 minutes of dinner conversation isn't recapping the waiters instructions about what to pick from each column (ie; La Fondue and Melting Pot)

The cheese & chocolate combinations that are offered are wonderfully brilliant.
author: K D.

description: Fantastic.  The atmosphere is perfect.  Great attention to detail. I'm glad Dave waited til it was perfect before opening the doors.  I was surprised actually by the price as well. Fondue Cowboy bucks the two-hour, ridiculous check trend of typical fondue restaurants.   Nice to be able to have fondue without making a big production out of it.  Lauren was our server and she was superb.  Great wine presentation and extremely attentive while being barely noticeable.  My glass was never 1/3 empty.  Speaking of wine, the bottle we had was $20.  Two people splitting a fondue and a bottle-a filling meal-was $50 including tip.  Can't beat it.  Sorry it took me two months to try this place.
author: Brad W.

description: So much better than expected! Fresh ingredients to dip, really nice space, quiet enough to chat without yelling, and truly exquisite dessert! The perfect place to catch up with an old friend visiting from out of town and staying downtown. Sending my out of town sis-in-law there for date night tonight!
author: Shannon T.

description: This was my first time every doing fondue, it because of this place, it definitely made it a wonderful experience. We ordered the traditional, and then the white chocolate for desert. I also had a side plate of the meat. Let's just start by saying, they give you so much food, and for the price is a value. The decor is so nice, intimate, and romantic. I do want to say that conversations may not be as private because of the small space, but unless you're purposely eavesdropping, shouldn't be a problem. They provide bread, fruits, vegetables with the cheese fondue. With the desert one, they give you fruits. My girlfriend said the chocolate was better than orgasms (Not a reflection on me people!!!! YET.) Had some rose, which was good, though we are wine snobs. Only complaints are few and minor, such as the old western cowboy film that they play, I know it's called fondue cowboy, but play some HGTV or a yule log burning to help set the mood. 2nd complaint is that it is small, so make sure you have reservations or you wont be seated at all. And lastly, the tables do need to be a little bigger, but given the space, can't really complain. Great food, fast and friendly service, and a decent value. Few places get 5 stars from me, this deserved it
author: Phan H.

description: Cute!  Savory and sweet fondues.  The Original was pretty good, dippers were all fresh.  Awesome for groups.  Service was slow, which happens when your bartender is also your server.  Table in the corner is swank but beware cause it's cold.  Chocolate bread to dip for dessert was creative.  Overall it was clean and pretty tasty. The vibe is a little awkward, but you wont notice if you bring your own.
author: Danielle B.

description: Wow, this is a fairly small restaurant but the decor is super cool, and the ambiance is lovely. The service was fast. I went there to celebrate my birthday and ordered the foundue with mushrooms, sausage as an appetizer and the spicy chocolate dessert. I loved all the items I ordered. I am definitely going back to try out every single foundue out of menu :)
author: Erika A.

description: this is a horribly run establishment.  fine food, nice waitstaff, terrible customer service.  we had a reservation for 6 people we made a month in advance and they gave us an hour and 30 minutes to eat.  They rushed us the entire time and made the people who were waiting for our table stand right next to our table and glare at us for 30  minutes.  All the while, they were telling them that we were told not to order desert (which never happened and, really, how could it?).  the owner is bad at his job. In this economy, people need to know to give their business to places that deserve it.  This place does not.
author: Shannon S.

description: Yes please. This place rocks! I have always loved fondue, but what I love most is that I live near a fondue restaurant! I went on an empty stomach around dinner time, convinced I would have to pick up a snack later after consuming only fondue from here. Not so much- my friend and I split two fondues and we both left completely stuffed. First we tried The Outlaw (Aged Cheddar, Beer, Slow Roasted Tomatoes, Roasted Garlic, Roasted Jalapeno, Cilantro). It had just enough spice for someone like me who doesn't like super spicy foods. It came with bread, fruits, vegies and potatoes. Yum! We then decided we couldn't leave without getting our chocolate fix, so we split the Buck-a-roo (Milk Chocolate with Walnuts).  Once again it came with lots of fun items to dip in the luscious warm chocolate....yummy chocolate heaven. I especially enjoyed dipping the marshmallows and chocolate bread for the ultimate chocolate indulgence. Besides being completely satisfied with our meals, we enjoyed the good service and pleasant ambience.
author: Sonya D.

description: It was my first visit and what is up with the name?  Dave the owner is a very unpleasant chap and really made our visit very uncomfortable.  We had a large group and service went well, but we found the menu is limited.  After spending $350 they pushed us out of the place when we were done.  I would say the food was ok; well it is just fondue after all...  I most likely would have come back but the way they treat folks I have taken it off my list. I don't think this place is going to make it...
author: William M.

description: so i loved this place so much i actually dined there twice...fondue is like the best, but this isn't your traditional swiss fondue . the decor is very cute, there's a flat screen on the wall playing old black and white cowboy movies , which gives you a sense of comfort, it's quite cozy and the people there are awesome. i love the assortment of things to dip into my cheese, which i usually order when i dine. i would highly recommend this place, you will not be disappointed. all there drinks are made from wine so i found this very interesting!!
author: Pia Z.

description: This was my first fondue experience, and it was fantastic. The service was great, the food was delicious, and the ambiance was interesting (dim lighting and some kind of pulsing music combined with old Roy Rogers videos playing silently over the bar). We had two fondues: the Quick Draw (manchego, white wine, roasted red peppers, roasted garlic) and the High Noon dessert fondue (white chocolate with balsamic strawberry puree). Both were amazing. We managed to finish almost everything, but we were full to bursting. Highly recommended.
author: R C.

description:
So I started to write this review the first time I visited this restaurant but never got around finishing it.  I was there again last night and the original stars are still warranted.  
I have now tried the traditional cheese fondue and the rawhide cheesed fondue (made with a hint of gorg). For those gorg lovers, the rawhide is definitely the bomb!
I think my only complaint is that the cheese was not hot enough last night. I could have asked them to heat it up a little more but I was so hungry that I did not care and it still tasted very good in it's lukewarm state.
We finished with the milk chocolate fondue and can I say HELLO CHOCOLATA! Oh my word is that chocolate fondue to die for! Next time I go there I am going to ask them what kind of chocolate they use because it is honestly remarkable.
I think this restaurant also has the advantage in SF when it comes to fondue because there just aren't that many fondue joints.  In fact, the one that I have visited (the Melting Pot) was so bad that I can't even compare it to Fondue Cowboy.
On a last note, I grew up in French Canada and know what the real fondue is supposed to taste like cause I grew up with it.  So far the closest thing to the real thing in SF is Fondue Cowboy.
Do not leave this place without trying the chocolate fondue. I promise you won't regret it! Bon appetit!
author: Caroline K.

description: Fondue was delicious.  I went here with 2 really good friends and the place was crowded.  We found a spot in the corner of the bar since all the table seating were taken when we arrived.  The place is small and cozy.  I guess this atmosphere is best for fondue, however, I can see it being busy on a weekend night with a long wait.  We went on a Thursday night at about 7:30 pm and the place was crowded but I would not say packed. There is about 10 bar chairs to sit at the bar and about 10 small tables. that can be put together to make a big table.  We ordered a savory (cheese) fondue and a sweet (chocolate with a hint of cayenne pepper) fondue.  Both fondues were very good.  Better then some places I have been to for fondue.  The cheese was smooth and just a bite to it.  It was served with crostini, cut up squared bread, potatoes on one plate. On the other plate there were grapes, raw broccoli, gherkin pickles, and olives.  The sweet fondue was served with tiny marshmallows, chocolate sourdough bread, and madeleines on one plate.  The other had fruit consisting of bananas, kiwi, strawberry, grapes, and little mandarin oranges. The chocolate for the fondue was of decent quality and the cayenne pepper was just a hint which really accentuate the chocolate and flavors from the fruit.  We also each ordered a drink (sparkling wine, pomegranate margarita, and strawberry mojito) and those were good too.  The drinks were $7.  Savory fondue was $18 and the sweet fondue was $16.  The food was good but if you are hungry, do not go here since they are small bites and you will be hungry again after a few hours.  I repeat.......YOU WILL BE HUNGRY again in a few hours.  The place is great for snacks and drinks with your friends but not a real restaurant with a hearty menu to fill you up. Last but not least, the wait staff were friendly, nice, and provided great service.
author: Mary P.

description: Celebrated my sisters birthday there last night with a party of 12.  Amazing service, amazing food.  We ordered all of the cheese fundue's as well as the milk chocolate fondue for dessert.  Delish!  and let me again say that the service was top notch!  Loved it and will definately go back.
author: Theresa S.

description: The fondues look small when then arrive, but they're more filling that you might expect.  Two savory fondues for two people is a bit much, especially if you also want a dessert fondue (and you do, you really do).  I'd recommend going with a larger group, and getting something like three fondues for four, plus a single dessert fondue (I'd recommend the dark chocolate with cayenne).
author: Michael K.

description: Really enjoyed this place.  Cute ambiance, perfect music level and charming and excellent service.  We started with the heirloom tomato salad which was refreshing and tasty.  Then, we got "The Outlaw" which has beer, cheddar and jalapenos and it was yummy, because melted cheese is yummy, but really not spectacular--I actually thought it was a tad bit bland and could have used some salt.  Also, they're definitely generous with the dippers but 6 oz of cheese was just a little too skimpy--I think 8 oz would have been perfect.  We had lots of stuff left over for dipping and no dip.  On the other hand, I was absolutely stuffed at the end of the meal so maybe they're protecting me from myself.  Anyway, the highlight of the whole meal was the dessert--the "Happy Trails"-- dark chocolate with cayenne was divine!  I'm not a huge chocolate fan and especially not a dark chocolate lover but I could have made a meal of just that--it was delicious.  And they are incredibly generous with the fruit and other dipping accessories.  Overall, this place gets it right and I would definitely return.
author: BJ F.

description: This is a great new addition to the neighborhood. The cheese fondues are awesome, we tried three of them. Next time I'll leave some room for the chocolate fondue.  The atmosphere is great and the staff is very friendly. I'll definitely be returning for more.
author: Mag G.

description: This is it!  Finally a restaurant that serves fondue the way I like it.  I'm a veggie so when the waiter said there is no hot oil for cooking meat I was very happy.  I hate that smell!    No, this is all great veggies and cheeses.   Our table of three had two of the cheese fondues which were both out of this world!  One, the traditional was very tangy - just the way my mom used to make for us at home but better!   The selection of dippers is over the top with little potatoes being the favorite.  They also had bread, olives, pickles, broccoli, and apples.   Excellent!   The dessert was fantastic!  We got the dark chocolate flavored with cayenne pepper.    Delicious!!    Yes it is expensive but we felt it was worth it.  Obviously not a place I can afford to go to every week but it's great for special occasions.  Or that cozy dessert that you want to share between the two of you one night.   This is perfect for that kind of meal.    Give it a try!
author: Tommy G.
